column1: 22 - oxacalcitriol suppresses secondary hyperparathyroidism without inducing low bone turnover in dogs with renal failure .
column2: chem* 22 - oxacalcitriol *chem suppresses secondary hyperparathyroidism without inducing low bone turnover in dogs with renal failure .

column1: BACKGROUND : Calcitriol therapy suppresses serum levels of parathyroid hormone ( PTH ) in patients with renal failure but has several drawbacks , including hypercalcemia and / or marked suppression of bone turnover , which may lead to adynamic bone disease .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Calcitriol *chem therapy suppresses serum levels of parathyroid hormone ( PTH ) in patients with renal failure but has several drawbacks , including hypercalcemia and / or marked suppression of bone turnover , which may lead to adynamic bone disease .

column1: A new vitamin D analogue , 22 - oxacalcitriol ( OCT ) , has been shown to have promising characteristics .
column2: A new chem* vitamin D *chem analogue , chem* 22 - oxacalcitriol *chem ( chem* OCT *chem ) , has been shown to have promising characteristics .

column1: This study was undertaken to determine the effects of OCT on serum PTH levels and bone turnover in states of normal or impaired renal function .
column2: This study was undertaken to determine the effects of chem* OCT *chem on serum PTH levels and bone turnover in states of normal or impaired renal function .

column1: METHODS : Sixty dogs were either nephrectomized ( Nx , N = 38 ) or sham - operated ( Sham , N = 22 ) .
column2: METHODS : Sixty dogs were either nephrectomized ( Nx , N = 38 ) or sham - operated ( Sham , N = 22 ) .

column1: The animals received supplemental phosphate to enhance PTH secretion .
column2: The animals received supplemental chem* phosphate *chem to enhance PTH secretion .

column1: Fourteen weeks after the start of phosphate supplementation , half of the Nx and Sham dogs received doses of OCT ( three times per week ) ; the other half were given vehicle for 60 weeks .
column2: Fourteen weeks after the start of chem* phosphate *chem supplementation , half of the Nx and Sham dogs received doses of chem* OCT *chem ( three times per week ) ; the other half were given vehicle for 60 weeks .

column1: Thereafter , the treatment modalities for a subset of animals were crossed over for an additional eight months .
column2: Thereafter , the treatment modalities for a subset of animals were crossed over for an additional eight months .

column1: Biochemical and hormonal indices of calcium and bone metabolism were measured throughout the study , and bone biopsies were done at baseline , 60 weeks after OCT or vehicle treatment , and at the end of the crossover period .
column2: Biochemical and hormonal indices of chem* calcium *chem and bone metabolism were measured throughout the study , and bone biopsies were done at baseline , 60 weeks after chem* OCT *chem or vehicle treatment , and at the end of the crossover period .

column1: RESULTS : In Nx dogs , OCT significantly decreased serum PTH levels soon after the induction of renal insufficiency .
column2: RESULTS : In Nx dogs , chem* OCT *chem significantly decreased serum PTH levels soon after the induction of renal insufficiency .

column1: In long - standing secondary hyperparathyroidism , OCT ( 0 . 03 microg / kg ) stabilized serum PTH levels during the first months .
column2: In long - standing secondary hyperparathyroidism , chem* OCT *chem ( 0 . 03 microg / kg ) stabilized serum PTH levels during the first months .

column1: Serum PTH levels rose thereafter , but the rise was less pronounced compared with baseline than the rise seen in Nx control .
column2: Serum PTH levels rose thereafter , but the rise was less pronounced compared with baseline than the rise seen in Nx control .

column1: These effects were accompanied by episodes of hypercalcemia and hyperphosphatemia .
column2: These effects were accompanied by episodes of hypercalcemia and hyperphosphatemia .

column1: In animals with normal renal function , OCT induced a transient decrease in serum PTH levels at a dose of 0 . 1 microg / kg , which was not sustained with lowering of the doses .
column2: In animals with normal renal function , chem* OCT *chem induced a transient decrease in serum PTH levels at a dose of 0 . 1 microg / kg , which was not sustained with lowering of the doses .

column1: In Nx dogs , OCT reversed abnormal bone formation , such as woven osteoid and fibrosis , but did not significantly alter the level of bone turnover .
column2: In Nx dogs , chem* OCT *chem reversed abnormal bone formation , such as woven osteoid and fibrosis , but did not significantly alter the level of bone turnover .

column1: In addition , OCT improved mineralization lag time , ( that is , the rate at which osteoid mineralizes ) in both Nx and Sham dogs .
column2: In addition , chem* OCT *chem improved mineralization lag time , ( that is , the rate at which osteoid mineralizes ) in both Nx and Sham dogs .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : These results indicate that even though OCT does not completely prevent the occurrence of hypercalcemia in experimental dogs with renal insufficiency , it may be of use in the management of secondary hyperparathyroidism because it does not induce low bone turnover and , therefore , does not increase the risk of adynamic bone disease .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : These results indicate that even though chem* OCT *chem does not completely prevent the occurrence of hypercalcemia in experimental dogs with renal insufficiency , it may be of use in the management of secondary hyperparathyroidism because it does not induce low bone turnover and , therefore , does not increase the risk of adynamic bone disease .

column1: Hypotension , bradycardia , and asystole after high - dose intravenous methylprednisolone in a monitored patient .
column2: Hypotension , bradycardia , and asystole after high - dose intravenous chem* methylprednisolone *chem in a monitored patient .

column2: This study reviews the current proposed mechanisms of sudden death after a high dose of intravenous chem* methylprednisolone *chem ( chem* IVMP *chem ) .

column1: Ten patients who had Parkinson ' s disease with disabling dyskinesia were included in this study to evaluate the role of mental ( mental calculation ) and motor ( flexion / extension of right fingers , flexion / extension of left fingers , flexion / extension of the neck , speaking aloud ) tasks on the worsening of peak - dose dyskinesia following administration of an effective single dose of apomorphine .

column1: These results suggest that activation tasks such as " speaking aloud " could be used for objective assessment of dyskinesia severity .

column1: Urine N - acetyl - beta - D - glucosaminidase - - a marker of tubular damage ?
column2: Urine N - acetyl - beta - D - glucosaminidase - - a marker of tubular damage ?

column1: BACKGROUND : Although an indicator of renal tubular dysfunction , an increased urinary N - acetyl - beta - D - glucosaminidase ( NAG ) activity might reflect increased lysosomal activity in renal tubular cells .
column2: BACKGROUND : Although an indicator of renal tubular dysfunction , an increased urinary N - acetyl - beta - D - glucosaminidase ( NAG ) activity might reflect increased lysosomal activity in renal tubular cells .

column1: METHODS : Puromycin aminonucleoside ( PAN ) was administered to Sprague Dawley rats to induce proteinuria .
column2: METHODS : chem* Puromycin aminonucleoside *chem ( chem* PAN *chem ) was administered to Sprague Dawley rats to induce proteinuria .

column1: Total protein , albumin , NAG activity and protein electrophoretic pattern were assessed in daily urine samples for 33 days .
column2: Total protein , albumin , NAG activity and protein electrophoretic pattern were assessed in daily urine samples for 33 days .

column1: The morphological appearance of the kidneys was examined on days three , four , six , eight and thirty three and the NAG isoenzyme patterns on days zero , four , eight and thirty three .
column2: The morphological appearance of the kidneys was examined on days three , four , six , eight and thirty three and the NAG isoenzyme patterns on days zero , four , eight and thirty three .

column1: RESULTS : Following intravenous PAN urine volume and urine NAG activity increased significantly by day two , but returned to normal by day four .
column2: RESULTS : Following intravenous chem* PAN *chem urine volume and urine NAG activity increased significantly by day two , but returned to normal by day four .

column1: After day four all treated animals exhibited a marked rise in urine albumin , total protein excretion and NAG activity .
column2: After day four all treated animals exhibited a marked rise in urine albumin , total protein excretion and NAG activity .

column1: Electrophoresis showed a generalised increase in middle and high molecular weight urine proteins from day four onwards .
column2: Electrophoresis showed a generalised increase in middle and high molecular weight urine proteins from day four onwards .

column1: Protein droplets first appeared prominent in tubular cells on day four .
column2: Protein droplets first appeared prominent in tubular cells on day four .

column1: Peak urine NAG activity and a change in NAG isoenzyme pattern coincided with both the peak proteinuria and the reduction in intracellular protein and NAG droplets ( day six onwards ) .
column2: Peak urine NAG activity and a change in NAG isoenzyme pattern coincided with both the peak proteinuria and the reduction in intracellular protein and NAG droplets ( day six onwards ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : This animal model demonstrates that an increase in lysosomal turnover and hence urine NAG activity , occurs when increased protein is presented to the tubular cells .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : This animal model demonstrates that an increase in lysosomal turnover and hence urine NAG activity , occurs when increased protein is presented to the tubular cells .

column1: Urine NAG activity is thus a measure of altered function in the renal tubules and not simply an indicator of damage .
column2: Urine NAG activity is thus a measure of altered function in the renal tubules and not simply an indicator of damage .

column1: Cauda equina syndrome after spinal anaesthesia with hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine : a review of six cases of cauda equina syndrome reported to the Swedish Pharmaceutical Insurance 1993 - 1997 .
column2: Cauda equina syndrome after spinal anaesthesia with hyperbaric 5 % chem* lignocaine *chem : a review of six cases of cauda equina syndrome reported to the Swedish Pharmaceutical Insurance 1993 - 1997 .

column1: Six cases of cauda equina syndrome with varying severity were reported to the Swedish Pharmaceutical Insurance during the period 1993 - 1997 .
column2: Six cases of cauda equina syndrome with varying severity were reported to the Swedish Pharmaceutical Insurance during the period 1993 - 1997 .

column1: All were associated with spinal anaesthesia using hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine .
column2: All were associated with spinal anaesthesia using hyperbaric 5 % chem* lignocaine *chem .

column2: Five cases had single - shot spinal anaesthesia and one had a repeat spinal anaesthetic due to inadequate block .

column1: The dose of hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine administered ranged from 60 to 120 mg .
column2: The dose of hyperbaric 5 % chem* lignocaine *chem administered ranged from 60 to 120 mg .

column1: Three of the cases were most likely caused by direct neurotoxicity of hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine .
column2: Three of the cases were most likely caused by direct neurotoxicity of hyperbaric 5 % chem* lignocaine *chem .

column1: In the other 3 cases , direct neurotoxicity was also probable , but unfortunately radiological investigations were not done to definitely exclude a compressive aetiology .
column2: In the other 3 cases , direct neurotoxicity was also probable , but unfortunately radiological investigations were not done to definitely exclude a compressive aetiology .

column1: All cases sustained permanent neurological deficits .
column2: All cases sustained permanent neurological deficits .

column1: We recommend that hyperbaric lignocaine should be administered in concentrations not greater than 2 % and at a total dose preferably not exceeding 60 mg .
column2: We recommend that hyperbaric chem* lignocaine *chem should be administered in concentrations not greater than 2 % and at a total dose preferably not exceeding 60 mg .

column1: Glyceryl trinitrate induces attacks of migraine without aura in sufferers of migraine with aura .

column1: Rapid reversal of life - threatening diltiazem - induced tetany with calcium chloride .

column1: Predictors of decreased renal function in patients with heart failure during angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitor therapy : results from the studies of left ventricular dysfunction ( SOLVD )

column1: BACKGROUND : Although angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitor therapy reduces mortality rates in patients with congestive heart failure ( CHF ) , it may also cause decreased renal function .
column2: BACKGROUND : Although chem* angiotensin *chem - converting enzyme inhibitor therapy reduces mortality rates in patients with congestive heart failure ( CHF ) , it may also cause decreased renal function .

column1: Little information is available to predict which patients are at highest risk for this complication .
column2: Little information is available to predict which patients are at highest risk for this complication .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To quantify specific clinical predictors of reduction in renal function in patients with CHF who are prescribed angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitor therapy .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To quantify specific clinical predictors of reduction in renal function in patients with CHF who are prescribed chem* angiotensin *chem - converting enzyme inhibitor therapy .

column1: METHOD : We analyzed data from the Studies of Left Ventricular Dysfunction ( SOLVD ) , a randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial of enalapril for the treatment of CHF .
column2: METHOD : We analyzed data from the Studies of Left Ventricular Dysfunction ( SOLVD ) , a randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial of chem* enalapril *chem for the treatment of CHF .

column1: There were 3379 patients randomly assigned to enalapril with a median follow - up of 974 days and 3379 patients randomly assigned to placebo with a mean follow - up of 967 days .
column2: There were 3379 patients randomly assigned to chem* enalapril *chem with a median follow - up of 974 days and 3379 patients randomly assigned to placebo with a mean follow - up of 967 days .

column1: Decreased renal function was defined as a rise in serum creatinine > / = 0 . 5 mg / dL ( 44 micromol / L ) from baseline .
column2: Decreased renal function was defined as a rise in serum chem* creatinine *chem > / = 0 . 5 mg / dL ( 44 micromol / L ) from baseline .

column1: We used time - to - event analysis to identify potential predictors of decrease in renal function including age , baseline ejection fraction , baseline creatinine , low systolic blood pressure ( < 100 mm Hg ) , history of hypertension , diabetes , and use of antiplatelet , diuretic , and beta - blocker therapy .
column2: We used time - to - event analysis to identify potential predictors of decrease in renal function including age , baseline ejection fraction , baseline chem* creatinine *chem , low systolic blood pressure ( < 100 mm Hg ) , history of hypertension , diabetes , and use of antiplatelet , chem* diuretic *chem , and beta - blocker therapy .

column1: RESULTS : Patients randomly assigned to enalapril had a 33 % greater likelihood of decreased renal function than controls ( P = . 003 ) .
column2: RESULTS : Patients randomly assigned to chem* enalapril *chem had a 33 % greater likelihood of decreased renal function than controls ( P = . 003 ) .

column1: By multivariate analysis , in both the placebo and enalapril groups older age , diuretic therapy , and diabetes were associated with decreased renal function , whereas beta - blocker therapy and higher ejection fraction were renoprotective .
column2: By multivariate analysis , in both the placebo and chem* enalapril *chem groups older age , chem* diuretic *chem therapy , and diabetes were associated with decreased renal function , whereas beta - blocker therapy and higher ejection fraction were renoprotective .

column1: Older age was associated with a greater risk of developing decreased renal function in both groups , but significantly more so in the enalapril group ( enalapril : risk ratio [ RR ] 1 . 42 per 10 years , 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] 1 . 32 - 1 . 52 with enalapril ; placebo : RR 1 . 18 , 95 % CI 1 . 12 - 1 . 25 ) .
column2: Older age was associated with a greater risk of developing decreased renal function in both groups , but significantly more so in the chem* enalapril *chem group ( chem* enalapril *chem : risk ratio [ RR ] 1 . 42 per 10 years , 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] 1 . 32 - 1 . 52 with chem* enalapril *chem ; placebo : RR 1 . 18 , 95 % CI 1 . 12 - 1 . 25 ) .

column1: Diuretic therapy was likewise associated with a greater risk of decreased renal function in the enalapril group ( RR 1 . 89 , 95 % CI 1 . 70 - 2 . 08 ) than in the placebo group ( RR 1 . 35 , 95 % CI 1 . 09 - 1 . 66 ) .
column2: chem* Diuretic *chem therapy was likewise associated with a greater risk of decreased renal function in the chem* enalapril *chem group ( RR 1 . 89 , 95 % CI 1 . 70 - 2 . 08 ) than in the placebo group ( RR 1 . 35 , 95 % CI 1 . 09 - 1 . 66 ) .

column1: Conversely , enalapril had a relative renoprotective effect ( RR 1 . 33 , 95 % CI 1 . 13 - 1 . 53 ) compared with placebo ( RR 1 . 96 , 95 % CI 1 . 57 - 2 . 44 ) in patients with diabetes .
column2: Conversely , chem* enalapril *chem had a relative renoprotective effect ( RR 1 . 33 , 95 % CI 1 . 13 - 1 . 53 ) compared with placebo ( RR 1 . 96 , 95 % CI 1 . 57 - 2 . 44 ) in patients with diabetes .

column1: A lower risk of renal impairment was seen in both groups with beta - blocker therapy ( RR 0 . 70 , 95 % CI 0 . 57 - 0 . 85 ) and higher baseline ejection fraction ( RR 0 . 93 per 5 % increment , 95 % CI 0 . 91 - 0 . 96 ) .
column2: A lower risk of renal impairment was seen in both groups with beta - blocker therapy ( RR 0 . 70 , 95 % CI 0 . 57 - 0 . 85 ) and higher baseline ejection fraction ( RR 0 . 93 per 5 % increment , 95 % CI 0 . 91 - 0 . 96 ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Enalapril use caused a 33 % increase in the risk of decreased renal function in patients with CHF .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* Enalapril *chem use caused a 33 % increase in the risk of decreased renal function in patients with CHF .

column1: Apomorphine : an underutilized therapy for Parkinson ' s disease .
column2: chem* Apomorphine *chem : an underutilized therapy for Parkinson ' s disease .

column1: Apomorphine was the first dopaminergic drug ever used to treat symptoms of Parkinson ' s disease .
column2: chem* Apomorphine *chem was the first dopaminergic drug ever used to treat symptoms of Parkinson ' s disease .

column1: While powerful antiparkinsonian effects had been observed as early as 1951 , the potential of treating fluctuating Parkinson ' s disease by subcutaneous administration of apomorphine has only recently become the subject of systematic study .
column2: While powerful antiparkinsonian effects had been observed as early as 1951 , the potential of treating fluctuating Parkinson ' s disease by subcutaneous administration of chem* apomorphine *chem has only recently become the subject of systematic study .

column1: A number of small scale clinical trials have unequivocally shown that intermittent subcutaneous apomorphine injections produce antiparkinsonian benefit close if not identical to that seen with levodopa and that apomorphine rescue injections can reliably revert off - periods even in patients with complex on - off motor swings .
column2: A number of small scale clinical trials have unequivocally shown that intermittent subcutaneous chem* apomorphine *chem injections produce antiparkinsonian benefit close if not identical to that seen with chem* levodopa *chem and that chem* apomorphine *chem rescue injections can reliably revert off - periods even in patients with complex on - off motor swings .

column1: Continuous subcutaneous apomorphine infusions can reduce daily off - time by more than 50 % in this group of patients , which appears to be a stronger effect than that generally seen with add - on therapy with oral dopamine agonists or COMT inhibitors .
column2: Continuous subcutaneous chem* apomorphine *chem infusions can reduce daily off - time by more than 50 % in this group of patients , which appears to be a stronger effect than that generally seen with add - on therapy with oral chem* dopamine *chem agonists or COMT inhibitors .

column1: Extended follow - up studies of up to 8 years have demonstrated long - term persistence of apomorphine efficacy .
column2: Extended follow - up studies of up to 8 years have demonstrated long - term persistence of chem* apomorphine *chem efficacy .

column1: In addition , there is convincing clinical evidence that monotherapy with continuous subcutaneous apomorphine infusions is associated with marked reductions of preexisting levodopa - induced dyskinesias .
column2: In addition , there is convincing clinical evidence that monotherapy with continuous subcutaneous chem* apomorphine *chem infusions is associated with marked reductions of preexisting chem* levodopa *chem - induced dyskinesias .

column1: The main side effects of subcutaneous apomorphine treatment are related to cutaneous tolerability problems , whereas sedation and psychiatric complications play a lesser role .
column2: The main side effects of subcutaneous chem* apomorphine *chem treatment are related to cutaneous tolerability problems , whereas sedation and psychiatric complications play a lesser role .

column1: Given the marked degree of efficacy of subcutaneous apomorphine treatment in fluctuating Parkinson ' s disease , this approach seems to deserve more widespread clinical use .
column2: Given the marked degree of efficacy of subcutaneous chem* apomorphine *chem treatment in fluctuating Parkinson ' s disease , this approach seems to deserve more widespread clinical use .

column2: Probing peripheral and central cholinergic system responses .

column1: OBJECTIVE : The pharmacological response to drugs that act on the cholinergic system of the iris has been used to predict deficits in central cholinergic functioning due to diseases such as Alzheimer ' s disease , yet correlations between central and peripheral responses have not been properly studied .
column2: OBJECTIVE : The pharmacological response to drugs that act on the cholinergic system of the iris has been used to predict deficits in central cholinergic functioning due to diseases such as Alzheimer ' s disease , yet correlations between central and peripheral responses have not been properly studied .

column1: This study assessed the effect of normal aging on ( 1 ) the tropicamide - induced increase in pupil diameter , and ( 2 ) the reversal of this effect with pilocarpine .
column2: This study assessed the effect of normal aging on ( 1 ) the chem* tropicamide *chem - induced increase in pupil diameter , and ( 2 ) the reversal of this effect with chem* pilocarpine *chem .

column1: Scopolamine was used as a positive control to detect age - dependent changes in central cholinergic functioning in the elderly .
column2: chem* Scopolamine *chem was used as a positive control to detect age - dependent changes in central cholinergic functioning in the elderly .

column1: DESIGN : Randomized double - blind controlled trial .
column2: DESIGN : Randomized double - blind controlled trial .

column1: PARTICIPANTS : Ten healthy elderly ( mean age 70 ) and 9 young ( mean age 33 ) volunteers .
column2: PARTICIPANTS : Ten healthy elderly ( mean age 70 ) and 9 young ( mean age 33 ) volunteers .

column1: INTERVENTIONS : Pupil diameter was monitored using a computerized infrared pupillometer over 4 hours .
column2: INTERVENTIONS : Pupil diameter was monitored using a computerized infrared pupillometer over 4 hours .

column1: The study involved 4 sessions .
column2: The study involved 4 sessions .

column1: In 1 session , tropicamide ( 20 microL , 0 . 01 % ) was administered to one eye and placebo to the other .
column2: In 1 session , chem* tropicamide *chem ( 20 microL , 0 . 01 % ) was administered to one eye and placebo to the other .

column1: In another session , tropicamide ( 20 microL , 0 . 01 % ) was administered to both eyes , followed 23 minutes later by the application of pilocarpine ( 20 microL , 0 . 1 % ) to one eye and placebo to the other .
column2: In another session , chem* tropicamide *chem ( 20 microL , 0 . 01 % ) was administered to both eyes , followed 23 minutes later by the application of chem* pilocarpine *chem ( 20 microL , 0 . 1 % ) to one eye and placebo to the other .

column1: All eye drops were given in a randomized order .
column2: All eye drops were given in a randomized order .

column1: In 2 separate sessions , a single dose of scopolamine ( 0 . 5 mg , intravenously ) or placebo was administered , and the effects on word recall were measured using the Buschke Selective Reminding Test over 2 hours .
column2: In 2 separate sessions , a single dose of chem* scopolamine *chem ( 0 . 5 mg , intravenously ) or placebo was administered , and the effects on word recall were measured using the Buschke Selective Reminding Test over 2 hours .

column1: OUTCOME MEASURES : Pupil size at time points after administration of tropicamide and pilocarpine ; scopolamine - induced impairment in word recall .
column2: OUTCOME MEASURES : Pupil size at time points after administration of chem* tropicamide *chem and chem* pilocarpine *chem ; chem* scopolamine *chem - induced impairment in word recall .

column1: RESULTS : There was no significant difference between elderly and young volunteers in pupillary response to tropicamide at any time point ( p > 0 . 05 ) .
column2: RESULTS : There was no significant difference between elderly and young volunteers in pupillary response to chem* tropicamide *chem at any time point ( p > 0 . 05 ) .

column1: The elderly group had a significantly greater pilocarpine - induced net decrease in pupil size 85 , 125 , 165 and 215 minutes after administration , compared with the young group ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: The elderly group had a significantly greater chem* pilocarpine *chem - induced net decrease in pupil size 85 , 125 , 165 and 215 minutes after administration , compared with the young group ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: Compared with the young group , the elderly group had greater scopolamine - induced impairment in word recall 60 , 90 and 120 minutes after administration ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: Compared with the young group , the elderly group had greater chem* scopolamine *chem - induced impairment in word recall 60 , 90 and 120 minutes after administration ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : There is an age - related pupillary response to pilocarpine that is not found with tropicamide .
column2: CONCLUSION : There is an age - related pupillary response to chem* pilocarpine *chem that is not found with chem* tropicamide *chem .

column1: Thus , pilocarpine may be useful to assess variations in central cholinergic function in elderly patients .
column2: Thus , chem* pilocarpine *chem may be useful to assess variations in central cholinergic function in elderly patients .

column1: Pain responses in methadone - maintained opioid abusers .

column2: This study was designed to describe pain tolerance and analgesic response in a sample of opioid addicts stabilized in chem* methadone *chem - maintenance ( MM ) treatment ( n = 60 ) in comparison to matched nondependent control subjects ( n = 60 ) .

column1: By using a placebo - controlled , two - way factorial design , tolerance to cold - pressor ( CP ) pain was examined , both before and after oral administration of therapeutic doses of common opioid ( hydromorphone 2 mg ) and nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory ( ketorolac 10 mg ) analgesic agents .
column2: By using a placebo - controlled , two - way factorial design , tolerance to cold - pressor ( CP ) pain was examined , both before and after oral administration of therapeutic doses of common opioid ( chem* hydromorphone *chem 2 mg ) and nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory ( chem* ketorolac *chem 10 mg ) analgesic agents .

column1: Results showed that MM individuals were significantly less tolerant of CP pain than control subjects , replicating previous work .
column2: Results showed that MM individuals were significantly less tolerant of CP pain than control subjects , replicating previous work .

column1: Analgesic effects were significant neither for medication nor group .
column2: Analgesic effects were significant neither for medication nor group .

column1: These data indicate that MM opioid abusers represent a pain - intolerant subset of clinical patients .
column2: These data indicate that MM opioid abusers represent a pain - intolerant subset of clinical patients .

column1: Their complaints of pain should be evaluated seriously and managed aggressively .
column2: Their complaints of pain should be evaluated seriously and managed aggressively .

column1: High - dose methylprednisolone may do more harm for spinal cord injury .
column2: High - dose chem* methylprednisolone *chem may do more harm for spinal cord injury .

column1: Because of the National Acute Spinal Cord Injury Studies ( NASCIS ) , high - dose methylprednisolone became the standard of care for the acute spinal cord injury .
column2: Because of the National Acute Spinal Cord Injury Studies ( NASCIS ) , high - dose chem* methylprednisolone *chem became the standard of care for the acute spinal cord injury .

column1: In the NASCIS , there was no mention regarding the possibility of acute corticosteroid myopathy that high - dose methylprednisolone may cause .
column2: In the NASCIS , there was no mention regarding the possibility of acute chem* corticosteroid *chem myopathy that high - dose chem* methylprednisolone *chem may cause .

column1: The dosage of methylprednisolone recommended by the NASCIS 3 is the highest dose of steroids ever being used during a 2 - day period for any clinical condition .
column2: The dosage of chem* methylprednisolone *chem recommended by the NASCIS 3 is the highest dose of chem* steroids *chem ever being used during a 2 - day period for any clinical condition .

column1: We hypothesize that it may cause some damage to the muscle of spinal cord injury patients .
column2: We hypothesize that it may cause some damage to the muscle of spinal cord injury patients .

column1: Further , steroid myopathy recovers naturally and the neurological improvement shown in the NASCIS may be just a recording of this natural motor recovery from the steroid myopathy , instead of any protection that methylprednisolone offers to the spinal cord injury .

column1: Conversion to rapamycin immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients : report of an initial experience .
column2: Conversion to chem* rapamycin *chem immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients : report of an initial experience .

column1: BACKGROUND : The aim of this study is to evaluate the effects of RAPA conversion in patients undergoing cyclosporine ( CsA ) or tacrolimus ( Tac ) toxicity .

column2: METHODS : Twenty renal transplant recipients were switched to fixed dose chem* rapamycin *chem ( chem* RAPA *chem ) ( 5 mg / day ) 0 to 204 months posttransplant .

column1: Drug monitoring was not initially used to adjust doses .
column2: Drug monitoring was not initially used to adjust doses .

column1: The indications for switch were chronic CsA or Tac nephrotoxicity ( 12 ) , acute CsA or Tac toxicity ( 3 ) , severe facial dysmorphism ( 2 ) , posttransplant lymphoproliferative disorder ( PTLD ) in remission ( 2 ) , and hepatotoxicity in 1 .

column2: Follow - up is 7 to 24 months .

column1: RESULTS : In the 12 patients switched because of chronic nephrotoxicity there was a significant decrease in serum creatinine [ 233 + / - 34 to 210 + / - 56 micromol / liter ( P < 0 . 05 ) at 6 months ] .
column2: RESULTS : In the 12 patients switched because of chronic nephrotoxicity there was a significant decrease in serum chem* creatinine *chem [ 233 + / - 34 to 210 + / - 56 micromol / liter ( P < 0 . 05 ) at 6 months ] .

column1: Facial dysmorphism improved in two patients .
column2: Facial dysmorphism improved in two patients .

column1: No relapse of PTLD was observed .
column2: No relapse of PTLD was observed .

column1: Five patients developed pneumonia ( two Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia , one infectious mononucleosis with polyclonal PTLD lung infiltrate ) and two had bronchiolitis obliterans .
column2: Five patients developed pneumonia ( two Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia , one infectious mononucleosis with polyclonal PTLD lung infiltrate ) and two had bronchiolitis obliterans .

column2: There were no deaths .

column2: chem* RAPA *chem was discontinued in four patients , because of pneumonia in two , PTLD in one , and oral aphtous ulcers in one .

column1: RAPA levels were high ( > 15 ng / ml ) in 7 of 13 ( 54 % ) patients .
column2: chem* RAPA *chem levels were high ( > 15 ng / ml ) in 7 of 13 ( 54 % ) patients .

column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* RAPA *chem conversion provides adequate immunosuppression to enable chem* CsA *chem withdrawal .

column1: Electro - oculography , electroretinography , visual evoked potentials , and multifocal electroretinography in patients with vigabatrin - attributed visual field constriction .

column1: PURPOSE : Symptomatic visual field constriction thought to be associated with vigabatrin has been reported .
column2: PURPOSE : Symptomatic visual field constriction thought to be associated with chem* vigabatrin *chem has been reported .

column1: The current study investigated the visual fields and visual electrophysiology of eight patients with known vigabatrin - attributed visual field loss , three of whom were reported previously .
column2: The current study investigated the visual fields and visual electrophysiology of eight patients with known chem* vigabatrin *chem - attributed visual field loss , three of whom were reported previously .

column2: Six of the patients were no longer receiving chem* vigabatrin *chem .

column1: METHODS : The central and peripheral fields were examined with the Humphrey Visual Field Analyzer .
column2: METHODS : The central and peripheral fields were examined with the Humphrey Visual Field Analyzer .

column1: Full visual electrophysiology , including flash electroretinography ( ERG ) , pattern electroretinography , multifocal ERG using the VERIS system , electro - oculography , and flash and pattern visual evoked potentials , was undertaken .
column2: Full visual electrophysiology , including flash electroretinography ( ERG ) , pattern electroretinography , multifocal ERG using the VERIS system , electro - oculography , and flash and pattern visual evoked potentials , was undertaken .

column1: RESULTS : Seven patients showed marked visual field constriction with some sparing of the temporal visual field .
column2: RESULTS : Seven patients showed marked visual field constriction with some sparing of the temporal visual field .

column1: The eighth exhibited concentric constriction .
column2: The eighth exhibited concentric constriction .

column1: Most electrophysiological responses were usually just within normal limits ; two patients had subnormal Arden electro - oculography indices ; and one patient showed an abnormally delayed photopic b wave .
column2: Most electrophysiological responses were usually just within normal limits ; two patients had subnormal Arden electro - oculography indices ; and one patient showed an abnormally delayed photopic b wave .

column1: However , five patients showed delayed 30 - Hz flicker b waves , and seven patients showed delayed oscillatory potentials .
column2: However , five patients showed delayed 30 - Hz flicker b waves , and seven patients showed delayed oscillatory potentials .

column1: Multifocal ERG showed abnormalities that sometimes correlated with the visual field appearance and confirmed that the deficit occurs at the retinal level .
column2: Multifocal ERG showed abnormalities that sometimes correlated with the visual field appearance and confirmed that the deficit occurs at the retinal level .

column1: CONCLUSION : Marked visual field constriction appears to be associated with vigabatrin therapy .
column2: CONCLUSION : Marked visual field constriction appears to be associated with chem* vigabatrin *chem therapy .

column1: The field defects and some electrophysiological abnormalities persist when vigabatrin therapy is withdrawn .
column2: The field defects and some electrophysiological abnormalities persist when chem* vigabatrin *chem therapy is withdrawn .

column1: Myocardial ischemia due to coronary artery spasm during dobutamine stress echocardiography .
column2: Myocardial ischemia due to coronary artery spasm during chem* dobutamine *chem stress echocardiography .

column1: Dobutamine stress echocardiography ( DSE ) is a useful and safe provocation test for myocardial ischemia .
column2: chem* Dobutamine *chem stress echocardiography ( DSE ) is a useful and safe provocation test for myocardial ischemia .

column1: Until now , the test has been focused only on the organic lesion in the coronary artery , and positive DSE has indicated the presence of significant fixed coronary artery stenosis .
column2: Until now , the test has been focused only on the organic lesion in the coronary artery , and positive DSE has indicated the presence of significant fixed coronary artery stenosis .

column1: The aim of the present study is to examine whether myocardial ischemia due to coronary spasm is induced by dobutamine .
column2: The aim of the present study is to examine whether myocardial ischemia due to coronary spasm is induced by chem* dobutamine *chem .

column1: We performed DSE on 51 patients with coronary spastic angina but without significant fixed coronary artery stenosis .
column2: We performed DSE on 51 patients with coronary spastic angina but without significant fixed coronary artery stenosis .

column1: All patients had anginal attacks at rest with ST elevation on the electrocardiogram ( variant angina ) .
column2: All patients had anginal attacks at rest with ST elevation on the electrocardiogram ( variant angina ) .

column1: Coronary spasm was induced by intracoronary injection of acetylcholine , and no fixed coronary artery stenosis was documented on angiograms in all patients .
column2: Coronary spasm was induced by intracoronary injection of chem* acetylcholine *chem , and no fixed coronary artery stenosis was documented on angiograms in all patients .

column1: DSE was performed with intravenous dobutamine infusion with an incremental doses of 5 , 10 , 20 , 30 , and 40 microg / kg / min every 5 minutes .
column2: DSE was performed with intravenous chem* dobutamine *chem infusion with an incremental doses of 5 , 10 , 20 , 30 , and 40 microg / kg / min every 5 minutes .

column1: Of the 51 patients , 7 patients showed asynergy with ST elevation .
column2: Of the 51 patients , 7 patients showed asynergy with ST elevation .

column1: All 7 patients ( 13 . 7 % ) had chest pain during asynergy , and both chest pain and electrocardiographic changes were preceded by asynergy .
column2: All 7 patients ( 13 . 7 % ) had chest pain during asynergy , and both chest pain and electrocardiographic changes were preceded by asynergy .

column1: These findings indicate that dobutamine can provoke coronary spasm in some patients with coronary spastic angina .
column2: These findings indicate that chem* dobutamine *chem can provoke coronary spasm in some patients with coronary spastic angina .

column1: When DSE is performed to evaluate coronary artery disease , not only fixed coronary stenosis , but also coronary spasm should be considered as a genesis of asynergy .
column2: When DSE is performed to evaluate coronary artery disease , not only fixed coronary stenosis , but also coronary spasm should be considered as a genesis of asynergy .

column1: Effect of intravenous metoprolol or intravenous metoprolol plus glucagon on dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia .
column2: Effect of intravenous chem* metoprolol *chem or intravenous chem* metoprolol *chem plus glucagon on chem* dobutamine *chem - induced myocardial ischemia .

column1: STUDY OBJECTIVE : To determine the effect of metoprolol on dobutamine stress testing with technetium - 99m sestamibi single - photon emission computed tomography imaging and ST - segment monitoring , and to assess the impact of intravenous glucagon on metoprolol ' s effects .
column2: STUDY OBJECTIVE : To determine the effect of chem* metoprolol *chem on chem* dobutamine *chem stress testing with chem* technetium - 99m sestamibi *chem single - photon emission computed tomography imaging and ST - segment monitoring , and to assess the impact of intravenous glucagon on chem* metoprolol *chem ' s effects .

column1: DESIGN : Randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial .
column2: DESIGN : Randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial .

column1: SETTING : Community hospital .
column2: SETTING : Community hospital .

column1: PATIENTS : Twenty - two patients with known reversible perfusion defects .
column2: PATIENTS : Twenty - two patients with known reversible perfusion defects .

column1: INTERVENTION : Patients underwent dobutamine stress tests per standard protocol .
column2: INTERVENTION : Patients underwent chem* dobutamine *chem stress tests per standard protocol .

column1: Before dobutamine was begun , no therapy was given during the first visit , and patients were randomized on subsequent visits to receive metoprolol or metoprolol plus glucagon 1 mg .
column2: Before chem* dobutamine *chem was begun , no therapy was given during the first visit , and patients were randomized on subsequent visits to receive chem* metoprolol *chem or chem* metoprolol *chem plus glucagon 1 mg .

column1: Metoprolol was dosed to achieve a resting predobutamine heart rate below 65 beats / minute or a total intravenous dose of 20 mg .
column2: chem* Metoprolol *chem was dosed to achieve a resting chem* predobutamine *chem heart rate below 65 beats / minute or a total intravenous dose of 20 mg .

column1: MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS : Metoprolol reduced maximum heart rate 31 % , summed stress scores 29 % , and summed difference scores 43 % versus control .
column2: MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS : chem* Metoprolol *chem reduced maximum heart rate 31 % , summed stress scores 29 % , and summed difference scores 43 % versus control .

column1: Metoprolol plus glucagon also reduced the maximum heart rate 29 % versus control .
column2: chem* Metoprolol *chem plus glucagon also reduced the maximum heart rate 29 % versus control .

column1: Summed stress and summed difference scores were not significantly reduced , although they were 18 % and 30 % lower , respectively , than control .
column2: Summed stress and summed difference scores were not significantly reduced , although they were 18 % and 30 % lower , respectively , than control .

column1: No significant differences were found in any parameter between metoprolol and metoprolol - glucagon .
column2: No significant differences were found in any parameter between chem* metoprolol *chem and chem* metoprolol *chem - glucagon .

column1: CONCLUSION : During dobutamine stress testing , metoprolol attenuates or eliminates evidence of myocardial ischemia .
column2: CONCLUSION : During chem* dobutamine *chem stress testing , chem* metoprolol *chem attenuates or eliminates evidence of myocardial ischemia .

column1: Glucagon 1 mg , although somewhat effective , does not correct this effect to the extent that it can be administered clinically .
column2: Glucagon 1 mg , although somewhat effective , does not correct this effect to the extent that it can be administered clinically .

column1: Evidence of functional somatotopy in GPi from results of pallidotomy .
column2: Evidence of functional somatotopy in GPi from results of pallidotomy .

column1: The objective of this study was to explore the functional anatomy of the globus pallidus internus ( GPi ) by studying the effects of unilateral pallidotomy on parkinsonian ' off ' signs and levodopa - induced dyskinesias ( LID ) .
column2: The objective of this study was to explore the functional anatomy of the globus pallidus internus ( GPi ) by studying the effects of unilateral pallidotomy on parkinsonian ' off ' signs and chem* levodopa *chem - induced dyskinesias ( LID ) .

column1: We found significant positive correlations between the preoperative levodopa responsiveness of motor signs and the levodopa responsiveness of scores in timed tests ( Core Assessment Program for Intracerebral Transplantations ) in the contralateral limbs and the improvement in these scores after surgery , whereas there was no correlation with the improvement in LID .
column2: We found significant positive correlations between the preoperative chem* levodopa *chem responsiveness of motor signs and the chem* levodopa *chem responsiveness of scores in timed tests ( Core Assessment Program for Intracerebral Transplantations ) in the contralateral limbs and the improvement in these scores after surgery , whereas there was no correlation with the improvement in LID .

column1: We also found a highly significant correlation ( P : < 0 . 0001 , r = 0 . 8 ) between the volume of the ventral lesion in the GPi and the improvement in LID in the contralateral limbs , whereas there was no correlation between the ventral volume and the improvement in parkinsonian ' off ' signs .
column2: We also found a highly significant correlation ( P : < 0 . 0001 , r = 0 . 8 ) between the volume of the ventral lesion in the GPi and the improvement in LID in the contralateral limbs , whereas there was no correlation between the ventral volume and the improvement in parkinsonian ' off ' signs .

column1: The volumes of the total lesion cylinder and the dorsal lesion did not correlate with the outcome of either dyskinesias or parkinsonian ' off ' signs .
column2: The volumes of the total lesion cylinder and the dorsal lesion did not correlate with the outcome of either dyskinesias or parkinsonian ' off ' signs .

column1: The differential predictive value of levodopa responsiveness for the outcome of parkinsonian ' off ' signs and LID and the different correlations of ventral lesion volume with dyskinesias and parkinsonian ' off ' signs indicate that different anatomical or pathophysiological substrates may be responsible for the generation of parkinsonian ' off ' signs and dyskinesias .
column2: The differential predictive value of chem* levodopa *chem responsiveness for the outcome of parkinsonian ' off ' signs and LID and the different correlations of ventral lesion volume with dyskinesias and parkinsonian ' off ' signs indicate that different anatomical or pathophysiological substrates may be responsible for the generation of parkinsonian ' off ' signs and dyskinesias .

column1: Whereas cells in a wider area of the GPi may be implicated in parkinsonism , the ventral GPi seems to be crucial for the manifestation of LID .
column2: Whereas cells in a wider area of the GPi may be implicated in parkinsonism , the ventral GPi seems to be crucial for the manifestation of LID .

column1: We suggest that our observations are additional proof of the functional somatotopy of the systems within the GPi that mediate parkinsonism and dyskinesias , especially along the dorsoventral trajectory used in pallidotomy .
column2: We suggest that our observations are additional proof of the functional somatotopy of the systems within the GPi that mediate parkinsonism and dyskinesias , especially along the dorsoventral trajectory used in pallidotomy .

column1: The outcome of pallidotomy in which the lesion involves the ventral and dorsal GPi could be the net effect of alteration in the activity of pathways which mediate different symptoms , and hence could be variable .
column2: The outcome of pallidotomy in which the lesion involves the ventral and dorsal GPi could be the net effect of alteration in the activity of pathways which mediate different symptoms , and hence could be variable .

column1: Screening for stimulant use in adult emergency department seizure patients .

column2: METHODS : This prospective study evaluated consecutive eligible seizure patients who had a plasma sample collected as part of their clinical evaluation .

column1: RESULTS : Fourteen of 248 ( 5 . 6 % , 95 % CI 2 . 7 % - 8 . 5 % ) plasma samples were positive by immunoassay testing for benzoylecgonine and no samples ( 0 % , 95 % CI 0 - 1 . 2 % ) were positive for amphetamine .
column2: RESULTS : Fourteen of 248 ( 5 . 6 % , 95 % CI 2 . 7 % - 8 . 5 % ) plasma samples were positive by immunoassay testing for chem* benzoylecgonine *chem and no samples ( 0 % , 95 % CI 0 - 1 . 2 % ) were positive for chem* amphetamine *chem .

column2: Positive test results were more common in patient visits where there was a history or suspicion of cocaine or amphetamine abuse ( p < 0 . 0005 ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : During this study period , routine plasma screening for cocaine and amphetamines in adult seizure patients had a low yield .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : During this study period , routine plasma screening for chem* cocaine *chem and chem* amphetamines *chem in adult seizure patients had a low yield .

column1: As a result , routine plasma screening would yield few cases of stimulant drug in which there was neither a history nor suspicion of drug abuse in this population .
column2: As a result , routine plasma screening would yield few cases of stimulant drug in which there was neither a history nor suspicion of drug abuse in this population .

column1: We have studied the role of NO and its association with apoptosis in an experimental model of nephrotic syndrome induced by a single injection of adriamycin ( ADR ) .
column2: We have studied the role of chem* NO *chem and its association with apoptosis in an experimental model of nephrotic syndrome induced by a single injection of chem* adriamycin *chem ( chem* ADR *chem ) .

column1: METHODS : The alteration in the NO pathway was assessed by measuring nitrite levels in serum / urine and by evaluating the changes in vascular reactivity of the isolated perfused rat kidney ( IPRK ) system .
column2: METHODS : The alteration in the chem* NO *chem pathway was assessed by measuring chem* nitrite *chem levels in serum / urine and by evaluating the changes in vascular reactivity of the isolated perfused rat kidney ( IPRK ) system .

column1: Rats were stratified into control groups and ADR - induced nephropathy groups .
column2: Rats were stratified into control groups and chem* ADR *chem - induced nephropathy groups .

column1: These two groups were then divided into : group 1 , animals receiving saline ; and group 2 , animals receiving aminoguanidine ( AG ) which is a specific inhibitor of inducible - NO synthase .
column2: These two groups were then divided into : group 1 , animals receiving saline ; and group 2 , animals receiving chem* aminoguanidine *chem ( chem* AG *chem ) which is a specific inhibitor of inducible - chem* NO *chem synthase .

column1: On day 21 , rats were sacrificed after obtaining material for biochemical analysis .
column2: On day 21 , rats were sacrificed after obtaining material for biochemical analysis .

column1: RESULTS : Histopathological examination of the kidneys of rats treated with ADR revealed focal areas of mesangial proliferation and mild tubulointerstitial inflammation .
column2: RESULTS : Histopathological examination of the kidneys of rats treated with chem* ADR *chem revealed focal areas of mesangial proliferation and mild tubulointerstitial inflammation .

column1: They also had significantly higher levels of proteinuria compared with control and treatment groups ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: They also had significantly higher levels of proteinuria compared with control and treatment groups ( P < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: Urine nitrite levels were significantly increased in the ADR - nephropathy group ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: Urine chem* nitrite *chem levels were significantly increased in the chem* ADR *chem - nephropathy group ( P < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: In the IPRK phenylephrine and acetylcholine related responses were significantly impaired in the ADR - nephropathy group .
column2: In the IPRK chem* phenylephrine *chem and chem* acetylcholine *chem related responses were significantly impaired in the chem* ADR *chem - nephropathy group .

column1: Apoptosis was not detected in controls .
column2: Apoptosis was not detected in controls .

column1: However , in the ADR - nephropathy group , numerous apoptotic cells were identified in the tubulointerstitial areas .
column2: However , in the chem* ADR *chem - nephropathy group , numerous apoptotic cells were identified in the tubulointerstitial areas .

column1: Double staining revealed numerous interstitial apoptotic cells to stain for ED1 , a marker for monocytes / macrophages .
column2: Double staining revealed numerous interstitial apoptotic cells to stain for ED1 , a marker for monocytes / macrophages .

column1: Treatment with AG prevented the impairment of renal vascular bed responses and reduced both urine nitrite levels and apoptosis to control levels .
column2: Treatment with chem* AG *chem prevented the impairment of renal vascular bed responses and reduced both urine chem* nitrite *chem levels and apoptosis to control levels .

column1: CONCLUSION : We suggest that interactions between NO and apoptosis are important in the pathogenesis of the ADR - induced nephrosis .
column2: CONCLUSION : We suggest that interactions between chem* NO *chem and apoptosis are important in the pathogenesis of the chem* ADR *chem - induced nephrosis .

column1: Dual effects of melatonin on barbiturate - induced narcosis in rats .

column1: Reduced cardiotoxicity and preserved antitumor efficacy of liposome - encapsulated doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide compared with conventional doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide in a randomized , multicenter trial of metastatic breast cancer .
column2: Reduced cardiotoxicity and preserved antitumor efficacy of liposome - encapsulated chem* doxorubicin *chem and chem* cyclophosphamide *chem compared with conventional chem* doxorubicin *chem and chem* cyclophosphamide *chem in a randomized , multicenter trial of metastatic breast cancer .

column1: PURPOSE : To determine whether Myocet ( liposome - encapsulated doxorubicin ; The Liposome Company , Elan Corporation , Princeton , NJ ) in combination with cyclophosphamide significantly reduces doxorubicin cardiotoxicity while providing comparable antitumor efficacy in first - line treatment of metastatic breast cancer ( MBC ) .
column2: PURPOSE : To determine whether chem* Myocet *chem ( liposome - encapsulated chem* doxorubicin *chem ; The Liposome Company , Elan Corporation , Princeton , NJ ) in combination with chem* cyclophosphamide *chem significantly reduces chem* doxorubicin *chem cardiotoxicity while providing comparable antitumor efficacy in first - line treatment of metastatic breast cancer ( MBC ) .

column1: PATIENTS AND METHODS : Two hundred ninety - seven patients with MBC and no prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease were randomized to receive either 60 mg / m ( 2 ) of Myocet ( M ) or conventional doxorubicin ( A ) , in combination with 600 mg / m ( 2 ) of cyclophosphamide ( C ) , every 3 weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity .
column2: PATIENTS AND METHODS : Two hundred ninety - seven patients with MBC and no prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease were randomized to receive either 60 mg / m ( 2 ) of chem* Myocet *chem ( M ) or conventional chem* doxorubicin *chem ( A ) , in combination with 600 mg / m ( 2 ) of chem* cyclophosphamide *chem ( C ) , every 3 weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity .

column1: Cardiotoxicity was defined by reductions in left - ventricular ejection fraction , assessed by serial multigated radionuclide angiography scans , or congestive heart failure ( CHF ) .
column2: Cardiotoxicity was defined by reductions in left - ventricular ejection fraction , assessed by serial multigated radionuclide angiography scans , or congestive heart failure ( CHF ) .

column1: Antitumor efficacy was assessed by objective tumor response rates ( World Health Organization criteria ) , time to progression , and survival .
column2: Antitumor efficacy was assessed by objective tumor response rates ( World Health Organization criteria ) , time to progression , and survival .

column1: RESULTS : Six percent of MC patients versus 21 % ( including five cases of CHF ) of AC patients developed cardiotoxicity ( P = . 0002 ) .
column2: RESULTS : Six percent of MC patients versus 21 % ( including five cases of CHF ) of AC patients developed cardiotoxicity ( P = . 0002 ) .

column1: Median cumulative doxorubicin dose at onset was more than 2 , 220 mg / m ( 2 ) for MC versus 480 mg / m ( 2 ) for AC ( P = . 0001 , hazard ratio , 5 . 04 ) .
column2: Median cumulative chem* doxorubicin *chem dose at onset was more than 2 , 220 mg / m ( 2 ) for MC versus 480 mg / m ( 2 ) for AC ( P = . 0001 , hazard ratio , 5 . 04 ) .

column1: MC patients also experienced less grade 4 neutropenia .
column2: MC patients also experienced less grade 4 neutropenia .

column1: Antitumor efficacy of MC versus AC was comparable : objective response rates , 43 % versus 43 % ; median time to progression , 5 . 1 % versus 5 . 5 months ; median time to treatment failure , 4 . 6 versus 4 . 4 months ; and median survival , 19 versus 16 months .
column2: Antitumor efficacy of MC versus AC was comparable : objective response rates , 43 % versus 43 % ; median time to progression , 5 . 1 % versus 5 . 5 months ; median time to treatment failure , 4 . 6 versus 4 . 4 months ; and median survival , 19 versus 16 months .

column1: CONCLUSION : Myocet improves the therapeutic index of doxorubicin by significantly reducing cardiotoxicity and grade 4 neutropenia and provides comparable antitumor efficacy , when used in combination with cyclophosphamide as first - line therapy for MBC .
column2: CONCLUSION : chem* Myocet *chem improves the therapeutic index of chem* doxorubicin *chem by significantly reducing cardiotoxicity and grade 4 neutropenia and provides comparable antitumor efficacy , when used in combination with chem* cyclophosphamide *chem as first - line therapy for MBC .

column1: The effects of N - nitro - L - arginine - methyl ester ( L - NAME ) a nitric oxide ( NO ) synthase inhibitor and L - arginine , a NO precursor , were investigated on lidocaine - induced convulsions .

column1: In the first experiment , four groups of mice received physiological saline ( 0 . 9 % ) , L - arginine ( 300 mg / kg , i . p . ) , L - NAME ( 100 mg / kg , i . p . ) and diazepam ( 2 mg / kg ) , respectively .
column2: In the first experiment , four groups of mice received physiological saline ( 0 . 9 % ) , chem* L - arginine *chem ( 300 mg / kg , i . p . ) , chem* L - NAME *chem ( 100 mg / kg , i . p . ) and chem* diazepam *chem ( 2 mg / kg ) , respectively .

column2: Thirty minutes after these injections , all mice received chem* lidocaine *chem ( 50 mg / kg , i . p . ) .

column1: Erythropoietin restores the anemia - induced reduction in cyclophosphamide cytotoxicity in rat tumors .
column2: Erythropoietin restores the anemia - induced reduction in chem* cyclophosphamide *chem cytotoxicity in rat tumors .

column1: The aim of this study was to examine the impact of anemia prevention by recombinant human erythropoietin ( rHuEPO ) treatment on the cytotoxicity of cyclophosphamide in solid experimental tumors .
column2: The aim of this study was to examine the impact of anemia prevention by recombinant human erythropoietin ( rHuEPO ) treatment on the cytotoxicity of chem* cyclophosphamide *chem in solid experimental tumors .

column1: Anemia was induced using a single dose of carboplatin ( 50 mg / kg i . v . ) resulting in a long - lasting reduction ( 30 % ) of the hemoglobin concentration .
column2: Anemia was induced using a single dose of chem* carboplatin *chem ( 50 mg / kg i . v . ) resulting in a long - lasting reduction ( 30 % ) of the hemoglobin concentration .

column1: In a second group , the development of anemia was prevented by rHuEPO ( 1000 IU / kg ) administered s . c . three times / week starting 7 days before carboplatin application .
column2: In a second group , the development of anemia was prevented by rHuEPO ( 1000 IU / kg ) administered s . c . three times / week starting 7 days before chem* carboplatin *chem application .

column1: Four days after carboplatin treatment , tumors ( DS - sarcoma of the rat ) were implanted s . c . onto the hind food dorsum .
column2: Four days after chem* carboplatin *chem treatment , tumors ( DS - sarcoma of the rat ) were implanted s . c . onto the hind food dorsum .

column1: Neither carboplatin nor rHuEPO treatment influenced tumor growth rate per se .
column2: Neither chem* carboplatin *chem nor rHuEPO treatment influenced tumor growth rate per se .

column1: When tumors were treated with a single dose of cyclophosphamide ( 60 mg / kg i . p . ) 5 days after implantation , a growth delay with a subsequent regrowth of the tumors was observed .
column2: When tumors were treated with a single dose of chem* cyclophosphamide *chem ( 60 mg / kg i . p . ) 5 days after implantation , a growth delay with a subsequent regrowth of the tumors was observed .

column1: In the anemia group , the growth delay was significantly shorter compared with nonanemic controls ( 13 . 3 days versus 8 . 6 days ) .
column2: In the anemia group , the growth delay was significantly shorter compared with nonanemic controls ( 13 . 3 days versus 8 . 6 days ) .

column1: In the group where anemia was prevented by rHuEPO treatment , growth delay was comparable with that of nonanemic controls ( 13 . 3 days ) .
column2: In the group where anemia was prevented by rHuEPO treatment , growth delay was comparable with that of nonanemic controls ( 13 . 3 days ) .

column1: These results suggest that chemotherapy - induced anemia reduces cytotoxicity of cyclophosphamide in tumors , whereas correction of anemia by rHuEPO treatment ( epoetin alpha ) increases the sensitivity , probably as a result of an improved oxygen supply to tumor tissue .
column2: These results suggest that chemotherapy - induced anemia reduces cytotoxicity of chem* cyclophosphamide *chem in tumors , whereas correction of anemia by rHuEPO treatment ( epoetin alpha ) increases the sensitivity , probably as a result of an improved chem* oxygen *chem supply to tumor tissue .

column1: Effects of verapamil on atrial fibrillation and its electrophysiological determinants in dogs .

column1: BACKGROUND : Atrial tachycardia - induced remodeling promotes the occurrence and maintenance of atrial fibrillation ( AF ) and decreases L - type Ca ( 2 + ) current .
column2: BACKGROUND : Atrial tachycardia - induced remodeling promotes the occurrence and maintenance of atrial fibrillation ( AF ) and decreases L - type chem* Ca *chem ( 2 + ) current .

column1: There is also a clinical suggestion that acute L - type Ca ( 2 ) channel blockade can promote AF , consistent with an AF promoting effect of Ca ( 2 + ) channel inhibition .
column2: There is also a clinical suggestion that acute L - type chem* Ca *chem ( 2 ) channel blockade can promote AF , consistent with an AF promoting effect of chem* Ca *chem ( 2 + ) channel inhibition .

column1: METHODS : To evaluate the potential mechanisms of AF promotion by Ca ( 2 + ) channel blockers , we administered verapamil to morphine - chloralose anesthetized dogs .
column2: METHODS : To evaluate the potential mechanisms of AF promotion by chem* Ca *chem ( 2 + ) channel blockers , we administered chem* verapamil *chem to chem* morphine *chem - chem* chloralose *chem anesthetized dogs .

column2: Epicardial mapping with 240 epicardial electrodes was used to evaluate activation during AF .

column1: RESULTS : Verapamil caused AF promotion in six dogs , increasing mean duration of AF induced by burst pacing , from 8 + / - 4 s ( mean + / - S . E . ) to 95 + / - 39 s ( P < 0 . 01 vs . control ) at a loading dose of 0 . 1 mg / kg and 228 + / - 101 s ( P < 0 . 0005 vs . control ) at a dose of 0 . 2 mg / kg .
column2: RESULTS : chem* Verapamil *chem caused AF promotion in six dogs , increasing mean duration of AF induced by burst pacing , from 8 + / - 4 s ( mean + / - S . E . ) to 95 + / - 39 s ( P < 0 . 01 vs . control ) at a loading dose of 0 . 1 mg / kg and 228 + / - 101 s ( P < 0 . 0005 vs . control ) at a dose of 0 . 2 mg / kg .

column1: Underlying electrophysiological mechanisms were studied in detail in five additional dogs under control conditions and in the presence of the higher dose of verapamil .
column2: Underlying electrophysiological mechanisms were studied in detail in five additional dogs under control conditions and in the presence of the higher dose of chem* verapamil *chem .

column1: In these experiments , verapamil shortened mean effective refractory period ( ERP ) from 122 + / - 5 to 114 + / - 4 ms ( P < 0 . 02 ) at a cycle length of 300 ms , decreased ERP heterogeneity ( from 15 + / - 1 to 10 + / - 1 % , P < 0 . 05 ) , heterogeneously accelerated atrial conduction and decreased the cycle length of AF ( 94 + / - 4 to 84 + / - 3 ms , P < 0 . 005 ) .
column2: In these experiments , chem* verapamil *chem shortened mean effective refractory period ( ERP ) from 122 + / - 5 to 114 + / - 4 ms ( P < 0 . 02 ) at a cycle length of 300 ms , decreased ERP heterogeneity ( from 15 + / - 1 to 10 + / - 1 % , P < 0 . 05 ) , heterogeneously accelerated atrial conduction and decreased the cycle length of AF ( 94 + / - 4 to 84 + / - 3 ms , P < 0 . 005 ) .

column1: Diltiazem did not affect ERP , AF cycle length or AF duration , but produced conduction acceleration similar to that caused by verapamil ( n = 5 ) .
column2: chem* Diltiazem *chem did not affect ERP , AF cycle length or AF duration , but produced conduction acceleration similar to that caused by chem* verapamil *chem ( n = 5 ) .

column1: In the presence of autonomic blockade , verapamil failed to promote AF and increased , rather than decreasing , refractoriness .
column2: In the presence of autonomic blockade , chem* verapamil *chem failed to promote AF and increased , rather than decreasing , refractoriness .

column1: Neither verapamil nor diltiazem affected atrial conduction in the presence of autonomic blockade .
column2: Neither chem* verapamil *chem nor chem* diltiazem *chem affected atrial conduction in the presence of autonomic blockade .

column2: Epicardial mapping suggested that chem* verapamil *chem promoted AF by increasing the number of simultaneous wavefronts reflected by separate zones of reactivation in each cycle .

column1: Calcitonin gene - related peptide levels during nitric oxide - induced headache in patients with chronic tension - type headache .

column2: It has been proposed that chem* nitric oxide *chem ( chem* NO *chem ) induced headache in primary headaches may be associated with release of calcitonin gene - related peptide ( CGRP ) .

column2: In the present study we aimed to investigate plasma levels of CGRP during headache induced by the chem* NO *chem donor chem* glyceryl trinitrate *chem ( chem* GTN *chem ) in 16 patients with chronic tension - type headache and 16 healthy controls .

column2: The subjects were randomly allocated to receive 0 . 5 microg / kg / min chem* GTN *chem or placebo over 20 min on two headache - free days .

column2: Blood samples were collected at baseline , 10 , 20 and 60 min after start of infusion .

column1: Both patients and controls developed significantly stronger immediate headache on the GTN day than on the placebo day and the headache was significantly more pronounced in patients than in controls .
column2: Both patients and controls developed significantly stronger immediate headache on the chem* GTN *chem day than on the placebo day and the headache was significantly more pronounced in patients than in controls .

column1: There was no difference between the area under the CGRP curve ( AUCCGRP ) on GTN vs . placebo day in either patients ( P = 0 . 65 ) or controls ( P = 0 . 48 ) .
column2: There was no difference between the area under the CGRP curve ( AUCCGRP ) on chem* GTN *chem vs . placebo day in either patients ( P = 0 . 65 ) or controls ( P = 0 . 48 ) .

column2: The AUCCGRP recorded on the chem* GTN *chem day did not differ between patients and controls ( P = 0 . 36 ) .

column1: Fluconazole - induced torsade de pointes .
column2: chem* Fluconazole *chem - induced torsade de pointes .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To present a case of fluconazole - associated torsade de pointes ( TDP ) and discuss fluconazole ' s role in causing TDP .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To present a case of chem* fluconazole *chem - associated torsade de pointes ( TDP ) and discuss chem* fluconazole *chem ' s role in causing TDP .

column1: CASE SUMMARY : A 68 - year - old white woman with Candida glabrata isolated from a presacral abscess developed TDP eight days after commencing oral fluconazole The patient had no other risk factors for TDP , including coronary artery disease , cardiomyopathy , congestive heart failure , and electrolyte abnormalities There was a temporal association between the initiation of fluconazole and TDP .
column2: CASE SUMMARY : A 68 - year - old white woman with Candida glabrata isolated from a presacral abscess developed TDP eight days after commencing oral chem* fluconazole *chem The patient had no other risk factors for TDP , including coronary artery disease , cardiomyopathy , congestive heart failure , and electrolyte abnormalities There was a temporal association between the initiation of chem* fluconazole *chem and TDP .

column1: The TDP resolved when fluconazole was discontinued ; however , the patient continued to have premature ventricular contractions and nonsustained ventricular tachycardia ( NSVT ) until six days after drug cessation DISCUSSION : Use of the Naranjo probability scale indicates a probable relationship between the use of fluconazole and the development of TDP .
column2: The TDP resolved when chem* fluconazole *chem was discontinued ; however , the patient continued to have premature ventricular contractions and nonsustained ventricular tachycardia ( NSVT ) until six days after drug cessation DISCUSSION : Use of the Naranjo probability scale indicates a probable relationship between the use of chem* fluconazole *chem and the development of TDP .

column1: The possible mechanism is depression of rapidly activating delayed rectifier potassium currents .
column2: The possible mechanism is depression of rapidly activating delayed rectifier chem* potassium *chem currents .

column1: In our patient , there was no other etiology identified that could explain QT prolongation or TDP The complete disappearance of NSVT and premature ventricular contractions followed by normalization of QT interval after the drug was stopped strongly suggests fluconazole as the etiology .
column2: In our patient , there was no other etiology identified that could explain QT prolongation or TDP The complete disappearance of NSVT and premature ventricular contractions followed by normalization of QT interval after the drug was stopped strongly suggests chem* fluconazole *chem as the etiology .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Clinicians should be aware that fluconazole , even at low doses , may cause prolongation of the QT interval , leading to TDP .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Clinicians should be aware that chem* fluconazole *chem , even at low doses , may cause prolongation of the QT interval , leading to TDP .

column1: Serial electrocardiographic monitoring may be considered when fluconazole is administered in patients who are at risk for ventricular arrhythmias .
column2: Serial electrocardiographic monitoring may be considered when chem* fluconazole *chem is administered in patients who are at risk for ventricular arrhythmias .

column1: METHODS : A systematic literature review was conducted to synthesize information on the incidence and management of RIHA .

column2: The standard of care for management of RIHA is reduction or discontinuation of the chem* ribavirin *chem dosage .
