column1: Intravenous ribavirin treatment for severe adenovirus disease in immunocompromised children .
column2: Intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem treatment for severe adenovirus disease in immunocompromised children .

column1: BACKGROUND : Adenovirus is an important cause of morbidity and mortality in the immunocompromised host .
column2: BACKGROUND : Adenovirus is an important cause of morbidity and mortality in the immunocompromised host .

column1: The incidence of severe adenovirus disease in pediatrics is increasing in association with growing numbers of immunocompromised children , where case fatality rates as high as 50 % to 80 % have been reported .
column2: The incidence of severe adenovirus disease in pediatrics is increasing in association with growing numbers of immunocompromised children , where case fatality rates as high as 50 % to 80 % have been reported .

column1: There are no approved antiviral agents with proven efficacy for the treatment of severe adenovirus disease , nor are there any prospective randomized , controlled trials of potentially useful anti - adenovirus therapies .
column2: There are no approved antiviral agents with proven efficacy for the treatment of severe adenovirus disease , nor are there any prospective randomized , controlled trials of potentially useful anti - adenovirus therapies .

column1: Apparent clinical success in the treatment of severe adenovirus disease is limited to a few case reports and small series .
column2: Apparent clinical success in the treatment of severe adenovirus disease is limited to a few case reports and small series .

column1: Experience is greatest with intravenous ribavirin and cidofovir .
column2: Experience is greatest with intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem and chem* cidofovir *chem .

column1: Ribavirin , a guanosine analogue , has broad antiviral activity against both RNA and DNA viruses , including documented activity against adenovirus in vitro .
column2: chem* Ribavirin *chem , a chem* guanosine *chem analogue , has broad antiviral activity against both RNA and DNA viruses , including documented activity against adenovirus in vitro .

column1: Ribavirin is licensed in aerosol form for the treatment of respiratory syncytial virus infection , and orally in combination with interferon to treat hepatitis C .
column2: chem* Ribavirin *chem is licensed in aerosol form for the treatment of respiratory syncytial virus infection , and orally in combination with interferon to treat hepatitis C .

column1: Intravenous ribavirin is the treatment of choice for infection with hemorrhagic fever viruses .
column2: Intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem is the treatment of choice for infection with hemorrhagic fever viruses .

column1: The most common adverse effect of intravenous ribavirin is reversible mild anemia .
column2: The most common adverse effect of intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem is reversible mild anemia .

column1: The use of cidofovir in severe adenovirus infection has been limited by adverse effects , the most significant of which is nephrotoxicity .
column2: The use of chem* cidofovir *chem in severe adenovirus infection has been limited by adverse effects , the most significant of which is nephrotoxicity .

column1: OBJECTIVE : We report our experience with intravenous ribavirin therapy for severe adenovirus disease in a series of immunocompromised children and review the literature .
column2: OBJECTIVE : We report our experience with intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem therapy for severe adenovirus disease in a series of immunocompromised children and review the literature .

column1: DESIGN / METHODS : We retrospectively reviewed the medical records of 5 children treated with intravenous ribavirin for documented severe adenovirus disease .
column2: DESIGN / METHODS : We retrospectively reviewed the medical records of 5 children treated with intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem for documented severe adenovirus disease .

column1: Two patients developed adenovirus hemorrhagic cystitis after cardiac and bone marrow transplants , respectively .
column2: Two patients developed adenovirus hemorrhagic cystitis after cardiac and bone marrow transplants , respectively .

column1: The bone marrow transplant patient also received intravenous cidofovir for progressive disseminated disease .
column2: The bone marrow transplant patient also received intravenous chem* cidofovir *chem for progressive disseminated disease .

column1: An additional 3 children developed adenovirus pneumonia ; 2 were neonates , 1 of whom had partial DiGeorge syndrome .
column2: An additional 3 children developed adenovirus pneumonia ; 2 were neonates , 1 of whom had partial DiGeorge syndrome .

column1: The remaining infant had recently undergone a cardiac transplant .
column2: The remaining infant had recently undergone a cardiac transplant .

column1: Intravenous ribavirin was administered on a compassionate - use protocol .
column2: Intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem was administered on a compassionate - use protocol .

column1: RESULTS : Complete clinical recovery followed later by viral clearance was observed in 2 children : the cardiac transplant recipient with adenovirus hemorrhagic cystitis and the immunocompetent neonate with adenovirus pneumonia .
column2: RESULTS : Complete clinical recovery followed later by viral clearance was observed in 2 children : the cardiac transplant recipient with adenovirus hemorrhagic cystitis and the immunocompetent neonate with adenovirus pneumonia .

column1: The remaining 3 children died of adenovirus disease .
column2: The remaining 3 children died of adenovirus disease .

column1: Intravenous ribavirin therapy was well tolerated .
column2: Intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem therapy was well tolerated .

column1: Use of cidofovir in 1 child was associated with progressive renal failure and neutropenia .
column2: Use of chem* cidofovir *chem in 1 child was associated with progressive renal failure and neutropenia .

column1: DISCUSSION : Our series of patients is representative of the spectrum of immunocompromised children at greatest risk for severe adenovirus disease , namely solid - organ and bone marrow transplant recipients , neonates , and children with immunodeficiency .
column2: DISCUSSION : Our series of patients is representative of the spectrum of immunocompromised children at greatest risk for severe adenovirus disease , namely solid - organ and bone marrow transplant recipients , neonates , and children with immunodeficiency .

column1: Although intravenous ribavirin was not effective for all children with severe adenovirus disease in this series or in the literature , therapy is unlikely to be of benefit if begun late in the course of the infection .
column2: Although intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem was not effective for all children with severe adenovirus disease in this series or in the literature , therapy is unlikely to be of benefit if begun late in the course of the infection .

column1: Early identification , eg by polymerase chain reaction of those patients at risk of disseminated adenovirus disease may permit earlier antiviral treatment and better evaluation of therapeutic response .
column2: Early identification , eg by polymerase chain reaction of those patients at risk of disseminated adenovirus disease may permit earlier antiviral treatment and better evaluation of therapeutic response .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Two of 5 children with severe adenovirus disease treated with intravenous ribavirin recovered .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Two of 5 children with severe adenovirus disease treated with intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem recovered .

column1: The availability of newer rapid diagnostic techniques , such as polymerase chain reaction , may make earlier , more effective treatment of adenovirus infection possible .
column2: The availability of newer rapid diagnostic techniques , such as polymerase chain reaction , may make earlier , more effective treatment of adenovirus infection possible .

column1: Given the seriousness and increasing prevalence of adenovirus disease in certain hosts , especially children , a large , multicenter clinical trial of potentially useful anti - adenoviral therapies , such as intravenous ribavirin , is clearly required to demonstrate the most effective and least toxic therapy .
column2: Given the seriousness and increasing prevalence of adenovirus disease in certain hosts , especially children , a large , multicenter clinical trial of potentially useful anti - adenoviral therapies , such as intravenous chem* ribavirin *chem , is clearly required to demonstrate the most effective and least toxic therapy .

column1: Eighteen hours after the overdose he had two generalised tonic - clonic seizures .
column2: Eighteen hours after the overdose he had two generalised tonic - clonic seizures .

column1: The patient remained unresponsive with junctional bradycardia , unrecordable blood pressure , and then became asystolic .
column2: The patient remained unresponsive with junctional bradycardia , unrecordable blood pressure , and then became asystolic .

column1: He required inotropic support and temporary pacing over the next 48 hours .
column2: He required inotropic support and temporary pacing over the next 48 hours .

column1: This case suggests there is a role for aggressive high dose intravenous calcium therapy in severe diltiazem overdose , particularly with the onset of asystole .

column1: It should be considered early in cases of cardiac arrest after diltiazem overdose .
column2: It should be considered early in cases of cardiac arrest after chem* diltiazem *chem overdose .

column1: DISCUSSION : Although there is increasing evidence of hepatotoxicity induced by bupropion , this is the first case of fatality that could have resulted from acute liver failure in a patient receiving bupropion while on concomitant treatment with carbimazole .

column1: Nephrotoxic effects in high - risk patients undergoing angiography .
column2: Nephrotoxic effects in high - risk patients undergoing angiography .

column1: BACKGROUND : The use of iodinated contrast medium can result in nephropathy .
column2: BACKGROUND : The use of iodinated contrast medium can result in nephropathy .

column1: Whether iso - osmolar contrast medium is less nephrotoxic than low - osmolar contrast medium in high - risk patients is uncertain .
column2: Whether iso - osmolar contrast medium is less nephrotoxic than low - osmolar contrast medium in high - risk patients is uncertain .

column1: METHODS : We conducted a randomized , double - blind , prospective , multicenter study comparing the nephrotoxic effects of an iso - osmolar , dimeric , nonionic contrast medium , iodixanol , with those of a low - osmolar , nonionic , monomeric contrast medium , iohexol .
column2: METHODS : We conducted a randomized , double - blind , prospective , multicenter study comparing the nephrotoxic effects of an iso - osmolar , dimeric , nonionic contrast medium , chem* iodixanol *chem , with those of a low - osmolar , nonionic , monomeric contrast medium , chem* iohexol *chem .

column1: The study involved 129 patients with diabetes with serum creatinine concentrations of 1 . 5 to 3 . 5 mg per deciliter who underwent coronary or aortofemoral angiography .
column2: The study involved 129 patients with diabetes with serum chem* creatinine *chem concentrations of 1 . 5 to 3 . 5 mg per deciliter who underwent coronary or aortofemoral angiography .

column1: The primary end point was the peak increase from base line in the creatinine concentration during the three days after angiography .
column2: The primary end point was the peak increase from base line in the chem* creatinine *chem concentration during the three days after angiography .

column1: Other end points were an increase in the creatinine concentration of 0 . 5 mg per deciliter or more , an increase of 1 . 0 mg per deciliter or more , and a change in the creatinine concentration from day 0 to day 7 .
column2: Other end points were an increase in the chem* creatinine *chem concentration of 0 . 5 mg per deciliter or more , an increase of 1 . 0 mg per deciliter or more , and a change in the chem* creatinine *chem concentration from day 0 to day 7 .

column1: RESULTS : The creatinine concentration increased significantly less in patients who received iodixanol .
column2: RESULTS : The chem* creatinine *chem concentration increased significantly less in patients who received chem* iodixanol *chem .

column1: From day 0 to day 3 , the mean peak increase in creatinine was 0 . 13 mg per deciliter in the iodixanol group and 0 . 55 mg per deciliter in the iohexol group ( P = 0 . 001 ; the increase with iodixanol minus the increase with iohexol , - 0 . 42 mg per deciliter [ 95 percent confidence interval , - 0 . 73 to - 0 . 22 ] ) .
column2: From day 0 to day 3 , the mean peak increase in chem* creatinine *chem was 0 . 13 mg per deciliter in the chem* iodixanol *chem group and 0 . 55 mg per deciliter in the chem* iohexol *chem group ( P = 0 . 001 ; the increase with chem* iodixanol *chem minus the increase with chem* iohexol *chem , - 0 . 42 mg per deciliter [ 95 percent confidence interval , - 0 . 73 to - 0 . 22 ] ) .

column1: Two of the 64 patients in the iodixanol group ( 3 percent ) had an increase in the creatinine concentration of 0 . 5 mg per deciliter or more , as compared with 17 of the 65 patients in the iohexol group ( 26 percent ) ( P = 0 . 002 ; odds ratio for such an increase in the iodixanol group , 0 . 09 [ 95 percent confidence interval , 0 . 02 to 0 . 41 ] ) .
column2: Two of the 64 patients in the chem* iodixanol *chem group ( 3 percent ) had an increase in the chem* creatinine *chem concentration of 0 . 5 mg per deciliter or more , as compared with 17 of the 65 patients in the chem* iohexol *chem group ( 26 percent ) ( P = 0 . 002 ; odds ratio for such an increase in the chem* iodixanol *chem group , 0 . 09 [ 95 percent confidence interval , 0 . 02 to 0 . 41 ] ) .

column1: No patient receiving iodixanol had an increase of 1 . 0 mg per deciliter or more , but 10 patients in the iohexol group ( 15 percent ) did .
column2: No patient receiving chem* iodixanol *chem had an increase of 1 . 0 mg per deciliter or more , but 10 patients in the chem* iohexol *chem group ( 15 percent ) did .

column1: The mean change in the creatinine concentration from day 0 to day 7 was 0 . 07 mg per deciliter in the iodixanol group and 0 . 24 mg per deciliter in the iohexol group ( P = 0 . 003 ; value in the iodixanol group minus the value in the iohexol group , - 0 . 17 mg per deciliter [ 95 percent confidence interval , - 0 . 34 to - 0 . 07 ] ) .
column2: The mean change in the chem* creatinine *chem concentration from day 0 to day 7 was 0 . 07 mg per deciliter in the chem* iodixanol *chem group and 0 . 24 mg per deciliter in the chem* iohexol *chem group ( P = 0 . 003 ; value in the chem* iodixanol *chem group minus the value in the chem* iohexol *chem group , - 0 . 17 mg per deciliter [ 95 percent confidence interval , - 0 . 34 to - 0 . 07 ] ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Nephropathy induced by contrast medium may be less likely to develop in high - risk patients when iodixanol is used rather than a low - osmolar , nonionic contrast medium .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Nephropathy induced by contrast medium may be less likely to develop in high - risk patients when chem* iodixanol *chem is used rather than a low - osmolar , nonionic contrast medium .

column1: Postoperative myalgia after succinylcholine : no evidence for an inflammatory origin .

column1: A common side effect associated with succinylcholine is postoperative myalgia .
column2: A common side effect associated with chem* succinylcholine *chem is postoperative myalgia .

column1: The pathogenesis of this myalgia is still unclear ; inflammation has been suggested but without convincing evidence .
column2: The pathogenesis of this myalgia is still unclear ; inflammation has been suggested but without convincing evidence .

column1: We designed the present study to investigate whether an inflammatory reaction contributes to this myalgia .
column2: We designed the present study to investigate whether an inflammatory reaction contributes to this myalgia .

column1: The incidence and severity of succinylcholine - associated myalgia was determined in 64 patients pretreated with saline or dexamethasone before succinylcholine ( n = 32 for each ) .

column1: Incidence and severity of myalgia did not differ significantly between the two groups : 15 patients in the dexamethasone group complained of myalgia compared with 18 patients in the saline group , and severe myalgia was reported by five patients and three patients , respectively ( not significant ) .
column2: Incidence and severity of myalgia did not differ significantly between the two groups : 15 patients in the chem* dexamethasone *chem group complained of myalgia compared with 18 patients in the saline group , and severe myalgia was reported by five patients and three patients , respectively ( not significant ) .

column2: In addition , interleukin - 6 ( IL - 6 ) as an early marker of inflammation was assessed in a subgroup of 10 patients pretreated with saline .

column1: In conclusion , there is no evidence for an inflammatory origin of succinylcholine - associated myalgia .

column1: Oral administration of lindane ( 2 . 5 , 5 , 10 and 15 mg / kg , body weight ) for 5 days was found to produce a dose - dependent increase in the activity of P450 dependent 7 - ethoxyresorufin - O - deethylase ( EROD ) , 7 - pentoxyresorufin - O - dealkylase ( PROD ) and N - nitrosodimethylamine demethylase ( NDMA - d ) in rat brain and liver .
column2: Oral administration of chem* lindane *chem ( 2 . 5 , 5 , 10 and 15 mg / kg , body weight ) for 5 days was found to produce a dose - dependent increase in the activity of P450 dependent 7 - ethoxyresorufin - O - deethylase ( EROD ) , 7 - pentoxyresorufin - O - dealkylase ( PROD ) and chem* N - nitrosodimethylamine *chem demethylase ( chem* NDMA *chem - d ) in rat brain and liver .

column1: A significant increase in the hepatic and brain P450 monooxygenases was also observed when the duration of exposure of low dose ( 2 . 5 mg / kg ) of lindane was increased from 5 days to 15 or 21 days .
column2: A significant increase in the hepatic and brain P450 monooxygenases was also observed when the duration of exposure of low dose ( 2 . 5 mg / kg ) of chem* lindane *chem was increased from 5 days to 15 or 21 days .

column1: As observed with different doses , the magnitude of induction in the activity of P450 monooxygenases was several fold higher in liver microsomes when compared with the brain .
column2: As observed with different doses , the magnitude of induction in the activity of P450 monooxygenases was several fold higher in liver microsomes when compared with the brain .

column1: Western blotting studies have indicated that the increase in the P450 enzymes could be due to the increase in the expression of P450 1A1 / 1A2 , 2B1 / 2B2 and 2E1 isoenzymes .
column2: Western blotting studies have indicated that the increase in the P450 enzymes could be due to the increase in the expression of P450 1A1 / 1A2 , 2B1 / 2B2 and 2E1 isoenzymes .

column1: In vitro studies using organic inhibitors specific for individual P450 isoenzymes and antibody inhibition experiments have further demonstrated that the increase in the activity of PROD , EROD and NDMA - d are due to the increase in the levels of P450 2B1 / 2B2 , 1A1 / 1A2 and 2E1 isoenzymes , respectively .
column2: In vitro studies using organic inhibitors specific for individual P450 isoenzymes and antibody inhibition experiments have further demonstrated that the increase in the activity of PROD , EROD and chem* NDMA *chem - d are due to the increase in the levels of P450 2B1 / 2B2 , 1A1 / 1A2 and 2E1 isoenzymes , respectively .

column1: Induction studies have further shown that while pretreatment of 3 - methylcholanthrene ( MC ) , an inducer of P4501A1 / 1A2 , did not produce any significant effect in the incidence of lindane induced convulsions , pretreatment with phenobarbital ( PB ) , an inducer of P450 2B1 / 2B2 or ethanol , an inducer of P450 2E1 catalysed reactions , significantly increased the incidence of lindane induced convulsions .
column2: Induction studies have further shown that while pretreatment of chem* 3 - methylcholanthrene *chem ( chem* MC *chem ) , an inducer of P4501A1 / 1A2 , did not produce any significant effect in the incidence of chem* lindane *chem induced convulsions , pretreatment with chem* phenobarbital *chem ( PB ) , an inducer of P450 2B1 / 2B2 or chem* ethanol *chem , an inducer of P450 2E1 catalysed reactions , significantly increased the incidence of chem* lindane *chem induced convulsions .

column1: Similarly , when the P450 - mediated metabolism of lindane was blocked by cobalt chloride incidence of convulsions was increased in animals treated with lindane indicating that lindane per se or its metabolites formed by PB or ethanol inducible P450 isoenzymes are involved in its neurobehavioral toxicity .
column2: Similarly , when the P450 - mediated metabolism of chem* lindane *chem was blocked by chem* cobalt chloride *chem incidence of convulsions was increased in animals treated with chem* lindane *chem indicating that chem* lindane *chem per se or its metabolites formed by PB or chem* ethanol *chem inducible P450 isoenzymes are involved in its neurobehavioral toxicity .

column1: Absolute and attributable risk of venous thromboembolism in women on combined cyproterone acetate and ethinylestradiol .
column2: Absolute and attributable risk of venous thromboembolism in women on combined chem* cyproterone acetate *chem and chem* ethinylestradiol *chem .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To achieve absolute risk estimates of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) among women on cyproterone acetate plus ethinylestradiol ( CPA / EE ) , and among women on combined oral contraceptives ( COCs ) .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To achieve absolute risk estimates of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) among women on chem* cyproterone acetate *chem plus chem* ethinylestradiol *chem ( chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem ) , and among women on chem* combined oral contraceptives *chem ( chem* COCs *chem ) .

column1: METHODS : From the Danish National Register of Patients ( NRP ) , 1996 to 1998 , the records of 1 . 1 million Danish women , ages 15 to 44 years , were searched for evidence of VTE .
column2: METHODS : From the Danish National Register of Patients ( NRP ) , 1996 to 1998 , the records of 1 . 1 million Danish women , ages 15 to 44 years , were searched for evidence of VTE .

column1: COC use was ascertained through mailed questionnaires .
column2: chem* COC *chem use was ascertained through mailed questionnaires .

column1: Sales statistics of COCs and CPA / EE were provided through Danish Drug Statistics .
column2: Sales statistics of chem* COCs *chem and chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem were provided through Danish Drug Statistics .

column1: RESULTS : During the time frame of the study , 330 women were found to have had VTE while on COCs .
column2: RESULTS : During the time frame of the study , 330 women were found to have had VTE while on chem* COCs *chem .

column1: Of these women , 67 were on levonorgestrel - containing COCs .
column2: Of these women , 67 were on chem* levonorgestrel *chem - containing chem* COCs *chem .

column1: Eleven were on CPA / EE .
column2: Eleven were on chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem .

column1: The corresponding absolute risk of VTE was 3 . 4 ( range , 3 . 1 - 3 . 8 ) per 10 000 women years among the women on COCs , 4 . 2 ( range , 3 . 2 - 5 . 2 ) per 10 000 women years among women on levonorgestrel - containing COCs , and 3 . 1 ( range , 1 . 3 - 4 . 9 ) per 10 000 women years among the women on CPA / EE .
column2: The corresponding absolute risk of VTE was 3 . 4 ( range , 3 . 1 - 3 . 8 ) per 10 000 women years among the women on chem* COCs *chem , 4 . 2 ( range , 3 . 2 - 5 . 2 ) per 10 000 women years among women on chem* levonorgestrel *chem - containing chem* COCs *chem , and 3 . 1 ( range , 1 . 3 - 4 . 9 ) per 10 000 women years among the women on chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem .

column1: CONCLUSION : Our results suggest the absolute risk of VTE among Danish women on COCs is similar to that among women taking CPA / EE .
column2: CONCLUSION : Our results suggest the absolute risk of VTE among Danish women on chem* COCs *chem is similar to that among women taking chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem .

column1: Comparison of developmental toxicology of aspirin ( acetylsalicylic acid ) in rats using selected dosing paradigms .
column2: Comparison of developmental toxicology of chem* aspirin *chem ( chem* acetylsalicylic acid *chem ) in rats using selected dosing paradigms .

column1: BACKGROUND : Analysis of the literature for nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) suggests that a low incidence of developmental anomalies occurs in rats given NSAIDs on specific days during organogenesis .
column2: BACKGROUND : Analysis of the literature for nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) suggests that a low incidence of developmental anomalies occurs in rats given NSAIDs on specific days during organogenesis .

column1: Aspirin ( acetylsalicylic acid [ ASA ] ) , an irreversible cyclooxygenase 1 and 2 inhibitor , induces developmental anomalies when administered to Wistar rats on gestational day ( GD ) 9 , 10 , or 11 ( Kimmel CA , Wilson JG , Schumacher HJ . Teratology 4 : 15 - 24 , 1971 ) .
column2: chem* Aspirin *chem ( chem* acetylsalicylic acid *chem [ chem* ASA *chem ] ) , an irreversible cyclooxygenase 1 and 2 inhibitor , induces developmental anomalies when administered to Wistar rats on gestational day ( GD ) 9 , 10 , or 11 ( Kimmel CA , Wilson JG , Schumacher HJ . Teratology 4 : 15 - 24 , 1971 ) .

column1: There are no published ASA studies using the multiple dosing paradigm of GDs 6 to 17 .
column2: There are no published chem* ASA *chem studies using the multiple dosing paradigm of GDs 6 to 17 .

column1: Objectives of the current study were to compare results between Sprague - Dawley ( SD ) and Wistar strains when ASA is administered on GD 9 , 10 , or 11 ; to compare the malformation patterns following single and multiple dosings during organogenesis in SD rats ; and to test the hypothesis that maternal gastrointestinal toxicity confounds the detection of low incidence malformations with ASA when a multiple dosing paradigm is used .
column2: Objectives of the current study were to compare results between Sprague - Dawley ( SD ) and Wistar strains when chem* ASA *chem is administered on GD 9 , 10 , or 11 ; to compare the malformation patterns following single and multiple dosings during organogenesis in SD rats ; and to test the hypothesis that maternal gastrointestinal toxicity confounds the detection of low incidence malformations with chem* ASA *chem when a multiple dosing paradigm is used .

column1: METHODS : ASA was administered as a single dose on GD 9 ( 0 , 250 , 500 , or 625 mg / kg ) , 10 ( 0 , 500 , 625 , or 750 mg / kg ) , or 11 ( 0 , 500 , 750 , or 1000 mg / kg ) and from GD 6 to GD 17 ( 0 , 50 , 125 , or 250 mg / kg a day ) in the multiple dose study to SD rats .
column2: METHODS : chem* ASA *chem was administered as a single dose on GD 9 ( 0 , 250 , 500 , or 625 mg / kg ) , 10 ( 0 , 500 , 625 , or 750 mg / kg ) , or 11 ( 0 , 500 , 750 , or 1000 mg / kg ) and from GD 6 to GD 17 ( 0 , 50 , 125 , or 250 mg / kg a day ) in the multiple dose study to SD rats .

column1: Animals were killed on GD 21 , and fetuses were examined viscerally .
column2: Animals were killed on GD 21 , and fetuses were examined viscerally .

column1: RESULTS : The literature evaluation suggested that NSAIDs induce ventricular septal defects ( VSDs ) and midline defects ( MDs ) in rats and diaphragmatic hernia ( DH ) , MDs , and VSDs in rabbits ( Cook JC et al . , 2003 ) ; hence , the present study focused on these malformations , even though ASA induces several other low - incidence malformations .
column2: RESULTS : The literature evaluation suggested that NSAIDs induce ventricular septal defects ( VSDs ) and midline defects ( MDs ) in rats and diaphragmatic hernia ( DH ) , MDs , and VSDs in rabbits ( Cook JC et al . , 2003 ) ; hence , the present study focused on these malformations , even though chem* ASA *chem induces several other low - incidence malformations .

column1: In single dose studies , DH , MD , and VSD were induced on GDs 9 and 10 .
column2: In single dose studies , DH , MD , and VSD were induced on GDs 9 and 10 .

column1: VSD also was noted following treatment on GD 11 .
column2: VSD also was noted following treatment on GD 11 .

column1: In contrast , DH and MD were noted in the multiple dose study design only in the high - dose group , and VSD was noted across all dose groups .
column2: In contrast , DH and MD were noted in the multiple dose study design only in the high - dose group , and VSD was noted across all dose groups .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : High concordance in major developmental anomalies between Wistar and SD rats were noted with the exception of VSD in the SD rats and hydrocephalus in the Wistar rats .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : High concordance in major developmental anomalies between Wistar and SD rats were noted with the exception of VSD in the SD rats and hydrocephalus in the Wistar rats .

column1: Variations and malformations were similar when ASA was administered as a single dose or during the period of organogenesis ( GDs 6 to 17 ) .
column2: Variations and malformations were similar when chem* ASA *chem was administered as a single dose or during the period of organogenesis ( GDs 6 to 17 ) .

column1: It was also evident that , by titrating the dose to achieve a maximum tolerated dose , malformations that normally occur at low incidence , as reported from previous single dose studies , could also be induced with ASA given at multiple doses .
column2: It was also evident that , by titrating the dose to achieve a maximum tolerated dose , malformations that normally occur at low incidence , as reported from previous single dose studies , could also be induced with chem* ASA *chem given at multiple doses .

column1: Reversal of central benzodiazepine effects by flumazenil after intravenous conscious sedation with diazepam and opioids : report of a double - blind multicenter study .

column1: After 5 minutes , 80 / 115 ( 70 % ) flumazenil - treated patients , compared with 21 / 63 ( 33 % ) placebo - treated patients , were completely awake and alert , as indicated by a score of 5 on the Observer ' s Assessment of Alertness / Sedation Scale .

column1: Conscious SHR ( male 300 - 350 g ) were subjected to 90 degrees head - up tilts for 60 s following acute administration of prazosin ( 0 . 1 mg kg - 1 i . p . ) or rauwolscine ( 3 mg kg - 1 i . v . ) .

column1: Does supplemental vitamin C increase cardiovascular disease risk in women with diabetes ?

column1: DESIGN : We studied the relation between vitamin C intake and mortality from total cardiovascular disease ( n = 281 ) , coronary artery disease ( n = 175 ) , and stroke ( n = 57 ) in 1923 postmenopausal women who reported being diabetic at baseline .

column1: RESULTS : After adjustment for cardiovascular disease risk factors , type of diabetes medication used , duration of diabetes , and intakes of folate , vitamin E , and beta - carotene , the adjusted relative risks of total cardiovascular disease mortality were 1 . 0 , 0 . 97 , 1 . 11 , 1 . 47 , and 1 . 84 ( P for trend < 0 . 01 ) across quintiles of total vitamin C intake from food and supplements .

column1: Adjusted relative risks of coronary artery disease were 1 . 0 , 0 . 81 , 0 . 99 , 1 . 26 , and 1 . 91 ( P for trend = 0 . 01 ) and of stroke were 1 . 0 , 0 . 52 , 1 . 23 , 2 . 22 , and 2 . 57 ( P for trend < 0 . 01 ) .

column1: A single dose of valproic acid ( VPA ) , which is a widely used antiepileptic drug , is associated with oxidative stress in rats , as recently demonstrated by elevated levels of 15 - F ( 2t ) - isoprostane ( 15 - F ( 2t ) - IsoP ) .

column1: To determine whether there was a temporal relationship between VPA - associated oxidative stress and hepatotoxicity , adult male Sprague - Dawley rats were treated ip with VPA ( 500 mg / kg ) or 0 . 9 % saline ( vehicle ) once daily for 2 , 4 , 7 , 10 , or 14 days .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To evaluate current performance on recommended perinatal hepatitis B and rubella prevention practices in New Hampshire .

column1: METHODS : Data were extracted from 2021 paired mother - infant records for the year 2000 birth cohort in New Hampshire ' s 25 delivery hospitals .
column2: METHODS : Data were extracted from 2021 paired mother - infant records for the year 2000 birth cohort in New Hampshire ' s 25 delivery hospitals .

column1: Assessment was done on the following : prenatal screening for hepatitis B and rubella , administration of the hepatitis B vaccine birth dose to all infants , administration of hepatitis B immune globulin to infants who were born to hepatitis B surface antigen - positive mothers , rubella immunity , and administration of in - hospital postpartum rubella vaccine to rubella nonimmune women .

column2: RESULTS : Prenatal screening rates for hepatitis B ( 98 . 8 % ) and rubella ( 99 . 4 % ) were high .

column1: Hepatitis B vaccine birth dose was administered to 76 . 2 % of all infants .
column2: Hepatitis B vaccine birth dose was administered to 76 . 2 % of all infants .

column2: Multivariate logistic regression showed that the month of delivery and infant birth weight were independent predictors of hepatitis B vaccination .

column1: The proportion of infants who were vaccinated in January and February 2000 ( 48 . 5 % and 67 . 5 % , respectively ) was less than any other months , whereas the proportion who were vaccinated in December 2000 ( 88 . 2 % ) was the highest .
column2: The proportion of infants who were vaccinated in January and February 2000 ( 48 . 5 % and 67 . 5 % , respectively ) was less than any other months , whereas the proportion who were vaccinated in December 2000 ( 88 . 2 % ) was the highest .

column1: Women who were born between 1971 and 1975 had the highest rate of rubella nonimmunity ( 9 . 5 % ) .
column2: Women who were born between 1971 and 1975 had the highest rate of rubella nonimmunity ( 9 . 5 % ) .

column1: In - hospital postpartum rubella vaccine administration was documented for 75 . 6 % of nonimmune women .
column2: In - hospital postpartum rubella vaccine administration was documented for 75 . 6 % of nonimmune women .

column1: CONCLUSION : This study documents good compliance in New Hampshire ' s birthing hospitals with national guidelines for perinatal hepatitis B and rubella prevention and highlights potential areas for improvement .
column2: CONCLUSION : This study documents good compliance in New Hampshire ' s birthing hospitals with national guidelines for perinatal hepatitis B and rubella prevention and highlights potential areas for improvement .

column1: PURPOSE : The anthracyclines daunorubicin and doxorubicin and the epipodophyllotoxin etoposide are potent DNA cleavage - enhancing drugs that are widely used in clinical oncology ; however , myelosuppression and cardiac toxicity limit their use .
column2: PURPOSE : The chem* anthracyclines chem* daunorubicin *chem and chem* doxorubicin *chem and the chem* epipodophyllotoxin chem* etoposide *chem are potent DNA cleavage - enhancing drugs that are widely used in clinical oncology ; however , myelosuppression and cardiac toxicity limit their use .

column1: Dexrazoxane ( ICRF - 187 ) is recommended for protection against anthracycline - induced cardiotoxicity .
column2: chem* Dexrazoxane *chem ( chem* ICRF - 187 *chem ) is recommended for protection against chem* anthracycline *chem - induced cardiotoxicity .

column1: EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN : Because of their widespread use , the hematologic toxicity following coadministration of dexrazoxane and these three structurally different DNA cleavage enhancers was investigated : Sensitivity of human and murine blood progenitor cells to etoposide , daunorubicin , and doxorubicin + / - dexrazoxane was determined in granulocyte - macrophage colony forming assays .
column2: EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN : Because of their widespread use , the hematologic toxicity following coadministration of chem* dexrazoxane *chem and these three structurally different DNA cleavage enhancers was investigated : Sensitivity of human and murine blood progenitor cells to chem* etoposide *chem , chem* daunorubicin *chem , and chem* doxorubicin *chem + / - chem* dexrazoxane *chem was determined in granulocyte - macrophage colony forming assays .

column1: Likewise , in vivo , B6D2F1 mice were treated with etoposide , daunorubicin , and doxorubicin , with or without dexrazoxane over a wide range of doses : posttreatment , a full hematologic evaluation was done .
column2: Likewise , in vivo , B6D2F1 mice were treated with chem* etoposide *chem , chem* daunorubicin *chem , and chem* doxorubicin *chem , with or without chem* dexrazoxane *chem over a wide range of doses : posttreatment , a full hematologic evaluation was done .

column1: RESULTS : Nontoxic doses of dexrazoxane reduced myelosuppression and weight loss from daunorubicin and etoposide in mice and antagonized their antiproliferative effects in the colony assay ; however , dexrazoxane neither reduced myelosuppression , weight loss , nor the in vitro cytotoxicity from doxorubicin .
column2: RESULTS : Nontoxic doses of chem* dexrazoxane *chem reduced myelosuppression and weight loss from chem* daunorubicin *chem and chem* etoposide *chem in mice and antagonized their antiproliferative effects in the colony assay ; however , chem* dexrazoxane *chem neither reduced myelosuppression , weight loss , nor the in vitro cytotoxicity from chem* doxorubicin *chem .

column1: CONCLUSION : Although our findings support the observation that dexrazoxane reduces neither hematologic activity nor antitumor activity from doxorubicin clinically , the potent antagonism of daunorubicin activity raises concern ; a possible interference with anticancer efficacy certainly would call for renewed attention .
column2: CONCLUSION : Although our findings support the observation that chem* dexrazoxane *chem reduces neither hematologic activity nor antitumor activity from chem* doxorubicin *chem clinically , the potent antagonism of chem* daunorubicin *chem activity raises concern ; a possible interference with anticancer efficacy certainly would call for renewed attention .

column1: At 1 - minute intervals during the procedural sedation , until the patient regained baseline mental status at the end of the procedure , a word from a standardized list was read aloud , and the patient was asked to immediately repeat the word to the investigator .
column2: At 1 - minute intervals during the procedural sedation , until the patient regained baseline mental status at the end of the procedure , a word from a standardized list was read aloud , and the patient was asked to immediately repeat the word to the investigator .

column1: The BIS score at the time the word was read and the patient ' s ability to repeat the word were recorded .
column2: The BIS score at the time the word was read and the patient ' s ability to repeat the word were recorded .

column1: After the procedure , the patient was asked to state all of the words from the list that he or she could recall , and to identify the last word recalled from prior to the start of the procedure and the first word recalled from after the procedure was completed .
column2: After the procedure , the patient was asked to state all of the words from the list that he or she could recall , and to identify the last word recalled from prior to the start of the procedure and the first word recalled from after the procedure was completed .

column2: RESULTS : Seventy - five consenting patients were enrolled ; one patient was excluded from data analysis for a protocol violation .

column1: No serious adverse events were noted during the procedural sedations .
column2: No serious adverse events were noted during the procedural sedations .

column2: The mean ( + / - standard deviation ) time of data collection was 16 . 4 minutes ( + / - 7 . 1 ; range 5 to 34 minutes ) .

column2: The mean BIS score corresponding to the first word recalled after the procedure was completed was 91 . 2 ( 95 % CI = 88 . 1 to 94 . 3 ) .

column2: All patients recalled at least one word that had been read to them during the protocol .

column1: The mean lowest BIS score for any recalled word was 91 . 5 ( + / - 11 . 1 ; range 79 to 98 ) , and no words were recalled when the corresponding BIS score was less than 90 .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : There is a range of BIS scores during which sedated patients are able to repeat words read to them but are not able to subsequently recall these words .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : There is a range of BIS scores during which sedated patients are able to repeat words read to them but are not able to subsequently recall these words .

column1: Amiodarone pulmonary toxicity .

column2: chem* Amiodarone *chem is an effective antiarrhythmic agent whose utility is limited by many side - effects , the most problematic being pneumonitis .

column1: While withdrawal of amiodarone leads to clinical improvement in majority of cases , this is not always possible or advisable .

column1: Possible azithromycin - associated hiccups .
column2: Possible chem* azithromycin *chem - associated hiccups .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To report a case of persistent hiccups associated by azithromycin therapy .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To report a case of persistent hiccups associated by chem* azithromycin *chem therapy .

column1: CASE SUMMARY : A 76 - year - old man presented with persistent hiccups after beginning azithromycin for the treatment of pharyngitis .
column2: CASE SUMMARY : A 76 - year - old man presented with persistent hiccups after beginning chem* azithromycin *chem for the treatment of pharyngitis .

column1: Hiccups were persistent and exhausting .
column2: Hiccups were persistent and exhausting .

column1: Discontinuation of azithromycin and therapy with baclofen finally resolved hiccups .
column2: Discontinuation of chem* azithromycin *chem and therapy with chem* baclofen *chem finally resolved hiccups .

column1: No organic cause of hiccups was identified despite extensive investigation .
column2: No organic cause of hiccups was identified despite extensive investigation .

column1: DISCUSSION : Pharmacotherapeutic agents have been uncommonly associated with hiccups .
column2: DISCUSSION : Pharmacotherapeutic agents have been uncommonly associated with hiccups .

column1: Corticosteroids ( dexamethasone and methylprednisolone ) , benzodiazepines ( midazolam ) and general anaesthesia have been the specific agents mentioned most frequently in the literature as being associated with the development of hiccups .
column2: Corticosteroids ( chem* dexamethasone *chem and chem* methylprednisolone *chem ) , chem* benzodiazepines *chem ( chem* midazolam *chem ) and general anaesthesia have been the specific agents mentioned most frequently in the literature as being associated with the development of hiccups .

column1: Few cases of drug - induced hiccups have been reported related to macrolide antimicrobials .
column2: Few cases of drug - induced hiccups have been reported related to chem* macrolide *chem antimicrobials .

column1: Using the Naranjo adverse effect reaction probability scale this event could be classified as possible ( score 5 points ) , mostly because of the close temporal sequence , previous reports on this reaction with other macrolides and the absence of any alternative explanation for hiccups .
column2: Using the Naranjo adverse effect reaction probability scale this event could be classified as possible ( score 5 points ) , mostly because of the close temporal sequence , previous reports on this reaction with other chem* macrolides *chem and the absence of any alternative explanation for hiccups .

column1: Our hypothesis is that a vagal mechanism mediated by azithromycin could be the pathogenesis of hiccups in our patient .
column2: Our hypothesis is that a vagal mechanism mediated by chem* azithromycin *chem could be the pathogenesis of hiccups in our patient .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Diagnosis of drug - induced hiccups is difficult and often achieved only by a process of elimination .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Diagnosis of drug - induced hiccups is difficult and often achieved only by a process of elimination .

column1: However , macrolide antimicrobials have been reported to be associated with hiccups and vagal mechanism could explain the development of this side - effect .

column1: Calcium carbonate toxicity : the updated milk - alkali syndrome ; report of 3 cases and review of the literature .
column2: chem* Calcium carbonate *chem toxicity : the updated milk - alkali syndrome ; report of 3 cases and review of the literature .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To describe 3 patients with calcium carbonate - induced hypercalcemia and gain insights into the cause and management of the milk - alkali syndrome .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To describe 3 patients with chem* calcium carbonate *chem - induced hypercalcemia and gain insights into the cause and management of the milk - alkali syndrome .

column1: METHODS : We report the clinical and laboratory data in 3 patients who presented with severe hypercalcemia ( corrected serum calcium > or = 14 mg / dL ) and review the pertinent literature on milk - alkali syndrome .
column2: METHODS : We report the clinical and laboratory data in 3 patients who presented with severe hypercalcemia ( corrected serum chem* calcium *chem > or = 14 mg / dL ) and review the pertinent literature on milk - alkali syndrome .

column1: RESULTS : The 3 patients had acute renal insufficiency , relative metabolic alkalosis , and low parathyroid hormone ( PTH ) , PTH - related peptide , and 1 , 25 - dihydroxyvitamin D concentrations .
column2: RESULTS : The 3 patients had acute renal insufficiency , relative metabolic alkalosis , and low parathyroid hormone ( PTH ) , PTH - related peptide , and chem* 1 , 25 - dihydroxyvitamin D *chem concentrations .

column1: No malignant lesion was found .
column2: No malignant lesion was found .

column1: Treatment included aggressive hydration and varied amounts of furosemide .
column2: Treatment included aggressive hydration and varied amounts of chem* furosemide *chem .

column1: The 2 patients with the higher serum calcium concentrations received pamidronate intravenously ( 60 and 30 mg , respectively ) , which caused severe hypocalcemia .
column2: The 2 patients with the higher serum chem* calcium *chem concentrations received chem* pamidronate *chem intravenously ( 60 and 30 mg , respectively ) , which caused severe hypocalcemia .

column1: Of the 3 patients , 2 were ingesting acceptable doses of elemental calcium ( 1 g and 2 g daily , respectively ) in the form of calcium carbonate .
column2: Of the 3 patients , 2 were ingesting acceptable doses of elemental chem* calcium *chem ( 1 g and 2 g daily , respectively ) in the form of chem* calcium carbonate *chem .

column1: In addition to our highlighted cases , we review the history , classification , pathophysiologic features , and treatment of milk - alkali syndrome and summarize the cases reported from early 1995 to November 2003 .
column2: In addition to our highlighted cases , we review the history , classification , pathophysiologic features , and treatment of milk - alkali syndrome and summarize the cases reported from early 1995 to November 2003 .

column1: CONCLUSION : Milk - alkali syndrome may be a common cause of unexplained hypercalcemia and can be precipitated by small amounts of orally ingested calcium carbonate in susceptible persons .
column2: CONCLUSION : Milk - alkali syndrome may be a common cause of unexplained hypercalcemia and can be precipitated by small amounts of orally ingested chem* calcium carbonate *chem in susceptible persons .

column1: Treatment with hydration , furosemide , and discontinuation of the calcium and vitamin D source is adequate .
column2: Treatment with hydration , chem* furosemide *chem , and discontinuation of the chem* calcium *chem and chem* vitamin D *chem source is adequate .

column1: Pamidronate treatment is associated with considerable risk for hypocalcemia , even in cases of initially severe hypercalcemia .
column2: chem* Pamidronate *chem treatment is associated with considerable risk for hypocalcemia , even in cases of initially severe hypercalcemia .

column1: Warfarin - induced leukocytoclastic vasculitis .
column2: chem* Warfarin *chem - induced leukocytoclastic vasculitis .

column1: Skin reactions associated with oral coumarin - derived anticoagulants are an uncommon occurrence .
column2: Skin reactions associated with oral chem* coumarin *chem - derived anticoagulants are an uncommon occurrence .

column1: Leukocytoclastic vasculitis ( LV ) is primarily a cutaneous small vessel vasculitis , though systemic involvement may be encountered .
column2: Leukocytoclastic vasculitis ( LV ) is primarily a cutaneous small vessel vasculitis , though systemic involvement may be encountered .

column1: We report 4 patients with late - onset LV probably due to warfarin .
column2: We report 4 patients with late - onset LV probably due to chem* warfarin *chem .

column1: All 4 patients presented with skin eruptions that developed after receiving warfarin for several years .
column2: All 4 patients presented with skin eruptions that developed after receiving chem* warfarin *chem for several years .

column1: The results of skin lesion biopsies were available in 3 patients , confirming LV Cutaneous lesions resolved in all patients after warfarin was discontinued .
column2: The results of skin lesion biopsies were available in 3 patients , confirming LV Cutaneous lesions resolved in all patients after chem* warfarin *chem was discontinued .

column2: In 2 of the 4 patients , rechallenge with chem* warfarin *chem led to recurrence of the lesions .

column1: LV may be a late - onset adverse reaction associated with warfarin therapy .
column2: LV may be a late - onset adverse reaction associated with chem* warfarin *chem therapy .

column1: Cocaine - induced brainstem seizures and behavior .
column2: chem* Cocaine *chem - induced brainstem seizures and behavior .

column1: A variety of abnormal sensory / motor behaviors associated with electrical discharges recorded from the bilateral brainstem were induced in adult WKY rats by mechanical ( electrode implants ) and DC electrical current stimulations and by acute and chronic administration of cocaine .
column2: A variety of abnormal sensory / motor behaviors associated with electrical discharges recorded from the bilateral brainstem were induced in adult WKY rats by mechanical ( electrode implants ) and DC electrical current stimulations and by acute and chronic administration of chem* cocaine *chem .

column1: The electrode implant implicated one side or the other of the reticular system of the brainstem but subjects were not incapacitated by the stimulations .
column2: The electrode implant implicated one side or the other of the reticular system of the brainstem but subjects were not incapacitated by the stimulations .

column1: Cocaine ( 40 mg / kg ) was injected subcutaneously for an acute experiment and subsequent 20 mg / kg doses twice daily for 3 days in a chronic study .
column2: chem* Cocaine *chem ( 40 mg / kg ) was injected subcutaneously for an acute experiment and subsequent 20 mg / kg doses twice daily for 3 days in a chronic study .

column1: Cocaine generated more abnormal behaviors in the brainstem perturbation group , especially the electrically perturbated subjects .
column2: chem* Cocaine *chem generated more abnormal behaviors in the brainstem perturbation group , especially the electrically perturbated subjects .

column1: The abnormal behaviors were yawning , retrocollis , hyperactivity , hypersensitivity , " beating drum " behavior , squealing , head bobbing , circling , sniffing , abnormal posturing , and facial twitching .
column2: The abnormal behaviors were yawning , retrocollis , hyperactivity , hypersensitivity , " beating drum " behavior , squealing , head bobbing , circling , sniffing , abnormal posturing , and facial twitching .

column1: Shifts in the power frequency spectra of the discharge patterns were noted between quiet and pacing behavioral states .
column2: Shifts in the power frequency spectra of the discharge patterns were noted between quiet and pacing behavioral states .

column1: Hypersensitivity to various auditory , tactile , and visual stimulation was present and shifts in the brainstem ambient power spectral frequency occurred in response to tactile stimulation .
column2: Hypersensitivity to various auditory , tactile , and visual stimulation was present and shifts in the brainstem ambient power spectral frequency occurred in response to tactile stimulation .

column1: These findings suggest that the brainstem generates and propagates pathological discharges that can be elicited by mechanical and DC electrical perturbation .
column2: These findings suggest that the brainstem generates and propagates pathological discharges that can be elicited by mechanical and DC electrical perturbation .

column1: Cocaine was found to activate the discharge system and thus induce abnormal behaviors that are generated at the discharge site and at distant sites to which the discharge propagates .
column2: chem* Cocaine *chem was found to activate the discharge system and thus induce abnormal behaviors that are generated at the discharge site and at distant sites to which the discharge propagates .

column1: Cognitive functions may also be involved since dopaminergic and serotonergic cellular elements at the brainstem level are also implicated .
column2: Cognitive functions may also be involved since dopaminergic and serotonergic cellular elements at the brainstem level are also implicated .

column1: rTMS at 1 Hz was observed to markedly reduce drug - induced dyskinesias , whereas 5 - Hz rTMS induced a slight but not significant increase .
column2: rTMS at 1 Hz was observed to markedly reduce drug - induced dyskinesias , whereas 5 - Hz rTMS induced a slight but not significant increase .

column1: Intracavitary chemotherapy ( paclitaxel / carboplatin liquid crystalline cubic phases ) for recurrent glioblastoma - - clinical observations .
column2: Intracavitary chemotherapy ( chem* paclitaxel *chem / chem* carboplatin *chem liquid crystalline cubic phases ) for recurrent glioblastoma - - clinical observations .

column1: Human malignant brain tumors have a poor prognosis in spite of surgery and radiation therapy .
column2: Human malignant brain tumors have a poor prognosis in spite of surgery and radiation therapy .

column1: Cubic phases consist of curved biocontinuous lipid bilayers , separating two congruent networks of water channels .
column2: Cubic phases consist of curved biocontinuous lipid bilayers , separating two congruent networks of water channels .

column1: Used as a host for cytotoxic drugs , the gel - like matrix can easily be applied to the walls of a surgical resection cavity .
column2: Used as a host for cytotoxic drugs , the gel - like matrix can easily be applied to the walls of a surgical resection cavity .

column1: For human glioblastoma recurrences , the feasibility , safety , and short - term effects of a surgical intracavitary application of paclitaxel and carboplatin encapsulated by liquid crystalline cubic phases are examined in a pilot study .
column2: For human glioblastoma recurrences , the feasibility , safety , and short - term effects of a surgical intracavitary application of chem* paclitaxel *chem and chem* carboplatin *chem encapsulated by liquid crystalline cubic phases are examined in a pilot study .

column1: A total of 12 patients with a recurrence of a glioblastoma multiforme underwent re - resection and received an intracavitary application of paclitaxel and carboplatin cubic phases in different dosages .
column2: A total of 12 patients with a recurrence of a glioblastoma multiforme underwent re - resection and received an intracavitary application of chem* paclitaxel *chem and chem* carboplatin *chem cubic phases in different dosages .

column1: Six of the patients received more than 15 mg paclitaxel and suffered from moderate to severe brain edema , while the remaining patients received only a total of 15 mg paclitaxel .
column2: Six of the patients received more than 15 mg chem* paclitaxel *chem and suffered from moderate to severe brain edema , while the remaining patients received only a total of 15 mg chem* paclitaxel *chem .

column1: In the latter group , brain edema was markedly reduced and dealt medically .
column2: In the latter group , brain edema was markedly reduced and dealt medically .

column1: Intracavitary chemotherapy in recurrent glioblastoma using cubic phases is feasible and safe , yet the clinical benefit remains to be examined in a clinical phase II study .

column1: Lamotrigine associated with exacerbation or de novo myoclonus in idiopathic generalized epilepsies .

column2: Five patients with idiopathic generalized epilepsies ( IGE ) treated with chem* lamotrigine *chem ( chem* LTG *chem ) experienced exacerbation or de novo appearance of myoclonic jerks ( MJ ) .

column1: In three patients , LTG exacerbated MJ in a dose - dependent manner with early aggravation during titration .
column2: In three patients , chem* LTG *chem exacerbated MJ in a dose - dependent manner with early aggravation during titration .

column1: MJ disappeared when LTG dose was decreased by 25 to 50 % .
column2: MJ disappeared when chem* LTG *chem dose was decreased by 25 to 50 % .

column1: Absence of acute cerebral vasoconstriction after cocaine - associated subarachnoid hemorrhage .
column2: Absence of acute cerebral vasoconstriction after chem* cocaine *chem - associated subarachnoid hemorrhage .

column1: INTRODUCTION : Cocaine use has been associated with neurovascular complications , including arterial vasoconstriction and vasculitis .
column2: INTRODUCTION : chem* Cocaine *chem use has been associated with neurovascular complications , including arterial vasoconstriction and vasculitis .

column1: However , there are few studies of angiographic effects of cocaine on human cerebral arteries .
column2: However , there are few studies of angiographic effects of chem* cocaine *chem on human cerebral arteries .

column1: Information on these effects could be obtained from angiograms of patients with cocaine - associated subarachnoid hemorrhage ( SAH ) who underwent angiography shortly after cocaine use .
column2: Information on these effects could be obtained from angiograms of patients with chem* cocaine *chem - associated subarachnoid hemorrhage ( SAH ) who underwent angiography shortly after chem* cocaine *chem use .

column1: METHODS : We screened patients with SAH retrospectively and identified those with positive urine toxicology for cocaine or its metabolites .
column2: METHODS : We screened patients with SAH retrospectively and identified those with positive urine toxicology for chem* cocaine *chem or its metabolites .

column1: Quantitative arterial diameter measurements from angiograms of these patients were compared to measurements from control patients with SAH who were matched for factors known to influence arterial diameter .
column2: Quantitative arterial diameter measurements from angiograms of these patients were compared to measurements from control patients with SAH who were matched for factors known to influence arterial diameter .

column1: Qualitative comparisons of small artery changes also were made .
column2: Qualitative comparisons of small artery changes also were made .

column1: RESULTS : Thirteen patients with positive cocaine toxicology were compared to 26 controls .
column2: RESULTS : Thirteen patients with positive chem* cocaine *chem toxicology were compared to 26 controls .

column1: There were no significant differences between groups in the mean diameters of the intradural internal carotid , sphenoidal segment of the middle cerebral , precommunicating segment of the anterior cerebral , or basilar arteries ( p greater than 0 . 05 for all comparisons , unpaired t - tests ) .
column2: There were no significant differences between groups in the mean diameters of the intradural internal carotid , sphenoidal segment of the middle cerebral , precommunicating segment of the anterior cerebral , or basilar arteries ( p greater than 0 . 05 for all comparisons , unpaired t - tests ) .

column1: There also were no significant differences between groups when expressing diameters as the sum of the precommunicating segment of the anterior cerebral + sphenoidal segment of the middle cerebral + supraclinoid internal carotid artery + basilar artery divided by the diameter of the petrous internal carotid artery ( p greater than 0 . 05 , unpaired t - tests ) .
column2: There also were no significant differences between groups when expressing diameters as the sum of the precommunicating segment of the anterior cerebral + sphenoidal segment of the middle cerebral + supraclinoid internal carotid artery + basilar artery divided by the diameter of the petrous internal carotid artery ( p greater than 0 . 05 , unpaired t - tests ) .

column1: Qualitative assessments showed two arterial irregularities in the distal vasculature in each group .
column2: Qualitative assessments showed two arterial irregularities in the distal vasculature in each group .

column1: CONCLUSION : No quantitative evidence for narrowing of large cerebral arteries or qualitative angiographic evidence for distal narrowing or vasculitis could be found in patients who underwent angiography after aneurysmal SAH associated with cocaine use .
column2: CONCLUSION : No quantitative evidence for narrowing of large cerebral arteries or qualitative angiographic evidence for distal narrowing or vasculitis could be found in patients who underwent angiography after aneurysmal SAH associated with chem* cocaine *chem use .

column1: Methamphetamine causes alterations in the MAP kinase - related pathways in the brains of mice that display increased aggressiveness .
column2: chem* Methamphetamine *chem causes alterations in the MAP kinase - related pathways in the brains of mice that display increased aggressiveness .

column1: Aggressive behaviors have been reported in patients who suffer from some psychiatric disorders , and are common in methamphetamine ( METH ) abusers .
column2: Aggressive behaviors have been reported in patients who suffer from some psychiatric disorders , and are common in chem* methamphetamine *chem ( chem* METH *chem ) abusers .

column1: Herein , we report that multiple ( but not single ) injections of METH significantly increased aggressiveness in male CD - 1 mice .
column2: Herein , we report that multiple ( but not single ) injections of chem* METH *chem significantly increased aggressiveness in male CD - 1 mice .

column1: This increase in aggressiveness was not secondary to METH - induced hyperactivity .
column2: This increase in aggressiveness was not secondary to chem* METH *chem - induced hyperactivity .

column1: Analysis of protein expression using antibody microarrays and Western blotting revealed differential changes in MAP kinase - related pathways after multiple and single METH injections .
column2: Analysis of protein expression using antibody microarrays and Western blotting revealed differential changes in MAP kinase - related pathways after multiple and single chem* METH *chem injections .

column1: There were statistically significant ( p < 0 . 05 ) decreases in MEK1 , Erk2p , GSK3alpha , 14 - 3 - 3e , and MEK7 in the striata of mice after multiple injections of METH .
column2: There were statistically significant ( p < 0 . 05 ) decreases in MEK1 , Erk2p , GSK3alpha , 14 - 3 - 3e , and MEK7 in the striata of mice after multiple injections of chem* METH *chem .

column1: MEK1 was significantly decreased also after a single injection of METH , but to a much lesser degree than after multiple injections of METH .
column2: MEK1 was significantly decreased also after a single injection of chem* METH *chem , but to a much lesser degree than after multiple injections of chem* METH *chem .

column1: In the frontal cortex , there was a statistically significant decrease in GSK3alpha after multiple ( but not single ) injections of METH .
column2: In the frontal cortex , there was a statistically significant decrease in GSK3alpha after multiple ( but not single ) injections of chem* METH *chem .

column1: These findings suggest that alterations in MAP kinase - related pathways in the prefronto - striatal circuitries might be involved in the manifestation of aggressive behaviors in mice .
column2: These findings suggest that alterations in MAP kinase - related pathways in the prefronto - striatal circuitries might be involved in the manifestation of aggressive behaviors in mice .

column1: Amisulpride related tic - like symptoms in an adolescent schizophrenic .
column2: chem* Amisulpride *chem related tic - like symptoms in an adolescent schizophrenic .

column1: Tic disorders can be effectively treated by atypical antipsychotics such as risperidone , olanzapine and ziprasidone .
column2: Tic disorders can be effectively treated by atypical antipsychotics such as chem* risperidone *chem , chem* olanzapine *chem and chem* ziprasidone *chem .

column1: However , there are two case reports that show tic - like symptoms , including motor and phonic variants , occurring during treatment with quetiapine or clozapine .
column2: However , there are two case reports that show tic - like symptoms , including motor and phonic variants , occurring during treatment with chem* quetiapine *chem or chem* clozapine *chem .

column1: We present a 15 - year - old girl schizophrenic who developed frequent involuntary eye - blinking movements after 5 months of amisulpride treatment ( 1000 mg per day ) .
column2: We present a 15 - year - old girl schizophrenic who developed frequent involuntary eye - blinking movements after 5 months of chem* amisulpride *chem treatment ( 1000 mg per day ) .

column1: The tic - like symptoms resolved completely after we reduced the dose of amisulpride down to 800 mg per day .
column2: The tic - like symptoms resolved completely after we reduced the dose of chem* amisulpride *chem down to 800 mg per day .

column1: However , her psychosis recurred after the dose reduction .
column2: However , her psychosis recurred after the dose reduction .

column1: We then placed her on an additional 100 mg per day of quetiapine .
column2: We then placed her on an additional 100 mg per day of chem* quetiapine *chem .

column1: She has been in complete remission under the combined medications for more than one year and maintains a fair role function .
column2: She has been in complete remission under the combined medications for more than one year and maintains a fair role function .

column1: No more tic - like symptoms or other side effects have been reported .

column1: We investigated changes in urinary NGF and PGs in women with OAB .
column2: We investigated changes in urinary NGF and chem* PGs *chem in women with OAB .

column1: MATERIALS AND METHODS : The study groups included 65 women with OAB and 20 without bladder symptoms who served as controls .

column2: Urine samples were collected .

column1: In addition , correlations between urinary NGF and PG , and urodynamic parameters in patients with OAB were examined .
column2: In addition , correlations between urinary NGF and chem* PG *chem , and urodynamic parameters in patients with OAB were examined .

column1: RESULTS : Urinary NGF , PGE2 and PGF2alpha were significantly increased in patients with OAB compared with controls ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: RESULTS : Urinary NGF , chem* PGE2 *chem and chem* PGF2alpha *chem were significantly increased in patients with OAB compared with controls ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: However , urinary PGI2 was not different between controls and patients with OAB .
column2: However , urinary chem* PGI2 *chem was not different between controls and patients with OAB .

column1: In patients with OAB urinary PGE2 positively correlated with volume at first desire to void and maximum cystometric capacity ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: In patients with OAB urinary chem* PGE2 *chem positively correlated with volume at first desire to void and maximum cystometric capacity ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: Urinary NGF , PGF2alpha and PGI2 did not correlate with urodynamic parameters in patients with OAB .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : NGF and PGs have important roles in the development of OAB symptoms in female patients .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : NGF and chem* PGs *chem have important roles in the development of OAB symptoms in female patients .

column1: Definition and management of anemia in patients infected with hepatitis C virus .

column1: The current best treatment for HCV infection is combination therapy with pegylated interferon and ribavirin .

column1: Although this regimen produces sustained virologic responses ( SVRs ) in approximately 50 % of patients , it can be associated with a potentially dose - limiting hemolytic anemia .
column2: Although this regimen produces sustained virologic responses ( SVRs ) in approximately 50 % of patients , it can be associated with a potentially dose - limiting hemolytic anemia .

column2: Hemoglobin concentrations decrease mainly as a result of chem* ribavirin *chem - induced hemolysis , and this anemia can be problematic in patients with HCV infection , especially those who have comorbid renal or cardiovascular disorders .

column1: BACKGROUND : More than 3 decades after Jones and Smith ( 1973 ) reported on the devastation caused by alcohol exposure on fetal development , the rates of heavy drinking during pregnancy remain relatively unchanged .

column1: Early identification of fetal alcohol exposure and maternal abstinence led to better infant outcomes .

column1: This study examined the utility of biometry for detecting alcohol - related fetal growth impairment .
column2: This study examined the utility of biometry for detecting chem* alcohol *chem - related fetal growth impairment .

column2: METHODS : We obtained fetal ultrasound measures from routine ultrasound examinations for 167 pregnant hazardous drinkers who were enrolled in a brief chem* alcohol *chem intervention study .

column2: Analyses of covariance were used to determine whether there were differences between groups after controlling for influences of gestational age and drug abuse .

column1: RESULTS : Nearly half of the pregnant drinkers abstained after learning of their pregnancies .
column2: RESULTS : Nearly half of the pregnant drinkers abstained after learning of their pregnancies .

column2: When women reportedly quit drinking early in their pregnancies , fetal growth measures were not significantly different from a non - chem* alcohol *chem - exposed group , regardless of prior drinking patterns .

column2: Any chem* alcohol *chem consumption postpregnancy recognition among the heavy drinkers resulted in reduced cerebellar growth as well as decreased cranial to body growth in comparison with women who either quit drinking or who were nondrinkers .

column1: Ethambutol - associated optic neuropathy .

column1: INTRODUCTION : Ethambutol is used in the treatment of tuberculosis , which is still prevalent in Southeast Asia , and can be associated with permanent visual loss .
column2: INTRODUCTION : chem* Ethambutol *chem is used in the treatment of tuberculosis , which is still prevalent in Southeast Asia , and can be associated with permanent visual loss .

column1: The visual field loss had a bitemporal flavour , suggesting involvement of the optic chiasm .
column2: The visual field loss had a bitemporal flavour , suggesting involvement of the optic chiasm .

column2: In the third case , visual acuity and colour vision normalised but the optic discs were pale .

column1: OUTCOME : All 3 patients had some permanent loss of visual function .
column2: OUTCOME : All 3 patients had some permanent loss of visual function .

column1: Digitalis arrhythmia , which is suppressed by Na channel blockers , was induced by intermittent intravenous ( i . v . ) injection of ouabain in pentobarbital - anesthetized dogs .

column1: Ten and 5 mg / kg i . v . ( + ) - cibenzoline suppressed digitalis - and adrenaline - induced arrhythmias , respectively .
column2: Ten and 5 mg / kg i . v . ( + ) - chem* cibenzoline *chem suppressed chem* digitalis *chem - and chem* adrenaline *chem - induced arrhythmias , respectively .

column1: The minimum effective plasma concentrations of ( + ) - cibenzoline for digitalis - and adrenaline - induced arrhythmias were 1 . 4 + / - 0 . 4 and 2 . 0 + / - 0 . 6 micrograms / ml , respectively ( mean + / - SD , n = 6 ) .
column2: The minimum effective plasma concentrations of ( + ) - chem* cibenzoline *chem for chem* digitalis *chem - and chem* adrenaline *chem - induced arrhythmias were 1 . 4 + / - 0 . 4 and 2 . 0 + / - 0 . 6 micrograms / ml , respectively ( mean + / - SD , n = 6 ) .

column2: The minimum effective plasma concentrations of ( - ) - chem* cibenzoline *chem for chem* digitalis *chem - and chem* adrenaline *chem - induced arrhythmia were 0 . 06 + / - 0 . 04 and 0 . 7 + / - 0 . 1 micrograms / ml , respectively ( mean + / - SD , n = 6 ) .

column1: The stronger antiarrhythmic effect of ( - ) - cibenzoline indicates that ( - ) - isomer may have an effect nearly 5 - 20 times stronger in suppressing Na channels , but effects of both drugs on Ca channels may be almost equipotent .
