column1: Passage of mannitol into the brain around gliomas : a potential cause of rebound phenomenon .
column2: Passage of chem* mannitol *chem into the brain around gliomas : a potential cause of rebound phenomenon .

column1: A study on 21 patients .
column2: A study on 21 patients .

column1: AIM : Widespread use of mannitol to reduce brain edema and lower elevated ICP in brain tumor patients continues to be afflicted by the so - called rebound phenomenon .
column2: AIM : Widespread use of chem* mannitol *chem to reduce brain edema and lower elevated ICP in brain tumor patients continues to be afflicted by the so - called rebound phenomenon .

column1: Leakage of mannitol into the brain parenchyma through an altered BBB and secondary reversal of osmotic gradient is considered the major cause of rebound .
column2: Leakage of chem* mannitol *chem into the brain parenchyma through an altered BBB and secondary reversal of osmotic gradient is considered the major cause of rebound .

column1: This has only been demonstrated experimentally in animals .
column2: This has only been demonstrated experimentally in animals .

column1: As a contribution to this issue we decided to research the possible passage of mannitol into the brain after administration to 21 brain tumor patients .
column2: As a contribution to this issue we decided to research the possible passage of chem* mannitol *chem into the brain after administration to 21 brain tumor patients .

column1: METHODS : Mannitol ( 18 % solution ; 1 g / kg ) was administered as a bolus to patients ( ten had malignant glioma , seven brain metastases and four meningioma ) about 30 minutes before craniotomy .
column2: METHODS : chem* Mannitol *chem ( 18 % solution ; 1 g / kg ) was administered as a bolus to patients ( ten had malignant glioma , seven brain metastases and four meningioma ) about 30 minutes before craniotomy .

column1: During resection , a sample of the surrounding edematous white matter was taken at the same time as a 10 ml venous blood sample .
column2: During resection , a sample of the surrounding edematous white matter was taken at the same time as a 10 ml venous blood sample .

column1: Mannitol concentrations were measured in plasma and white matter by a modified version of the enzyme assay of Blonquist et al .
column2: chem* Mannitol *chem concentrations were measured in plasma and white matter by a modified version of the enzyme assay of Blonquist et al .

column1: RESULTS : In most glioma patients , mannitol concentrations in white matter were 2 to 6 times higher than in plasma ( mean 3 . 5 times ) .
column2: RESULTS : In most glioma patients , chem* mannitol *chem concentrations in white matter were 2 to 6 times higher than in plasma ( mean 3 . 5 times ) .

column1: In meningioma and metastases patients plasma concentrations of mannitol were higher than white matter concentrations except in three cases with infiltration by neoplastic cells .
column2: In meningioma and metastases patients plasma concentrations of chem* mannitol *chem were higher than white matter concentrations except in three cases with infiltration by neoplastic cells .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : The results of our study show that even after a single bolus , mannitol may leak through the altered BBB near gliomas , reversing the initial plasma - to - blood osmotic gradient , aggravating peritumoral edema and promoting rebound of ICP .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : The results of our study show that even after a single bolus , chem* mannitol *chem may leak through the altered BBB near gliomas , reversing the initial plasma - to - blood osmotic gradient , aggravating peritumoral edema and promoting rebound of ICP .

column1: Placebo - level incidence of extrapyramidal symptoms ( EPS ) with quetiapine in controlled studies of patients with bipolar mania .
column2: Placebo - level incidence of extrapyramidal symptoms ( EPS ) with chem* quetiapine *chem in controlled studies of patients with bipolar mania .

column1: OBJECTIVES : To evaluate extrapyramidal symptoms ( EPS ) , including akathisia , with quetiapine in patients with bipolar mania .
column2: OBJECTIVES : To evaluate extrapyramidal symptoms ( EPS ) , including akathisia , with chem* quetiapine *chem in patients with bipolar mania .

column1: METHODS : Data were analyzed from four similarly designed , randomized , double - blind , 3 - to 12 - week studies .
column2: METHODS : Data were analyzed from four similarly designed , randomized , double - blind , 3 - to 12 - week studies .

column1: Two studies evaluated quetiapine monotherapy ( up to 800 mg / day ) ( n = 209 ) versus placebo ( n = 198 ) , with lithium or haloperidol monotherapy as respective active controls .
column2: Two studies evaluated chem* quetiapine *chem monotherapy ( up to 800 mg / day ) ( n = 209 ) versus placebo ( n = 198 ) , with chem* lithium *chem or chem* haloperidol *chem monotherapy as respective active controls .

column1: Two studies evaluated quetiapine ( up to 800 mg / day ) in combination with a mood stabilizer ( lithium or divalproex , QTP + Li / DVP ) ( n = 196 ) compared to placebo and mood stabilizer ( PBO + Li / DVP ) ( n = 203 ) .
column2: Two studies evaluated chem* quetiapine *chem ( up to 800 mg / day ) in combination with a mood stabilizer ( chem* lithium *chem or chem* divalproex *chem , chem* QTP *chem + chem* Li *chem / chem* DVP *chem ) ( n = 196 ) compared to placebo and mood stabilizer ( PBO + chem* Li *chem / chem* DVP *chem ) ( n = 203 ) .

column1: Extrapyramidal symptoms were evaluated using the Simpson - Angus Scale ( SAS ) , the Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale ( BARS ) , adverse event reports and anticholinergic drug usage .
column2: Extrapyramidal symptoms were evaluated using the Simpson - Angus Scale ( SAS ) , the Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale ( BARS ) , adverse event reports and anticholinergic drug usage .

column1: RESULTS : The incidence of EPS - related adverse events , including akathisia , was no different with quetiapine monotherapy ( 12 . 9 % ) than with placebo ( 13 . 1 % ) .
column2: RESULTS : The incidence of EPS - related adverse events , including akathisia , was no different with chem* quetiapine *chem monotherapy ( 12 . 9 % ) than with placebo ( 13 . 1 % ) .

column1: Similarly , EPS - related adverse events with QTP + Li / DVP ( 21 . 4 % ) were no different than with PBO + Li / DVP ( 19 . 2 % ) .
column2: Similarly , EPS - related adverse events with chem* QTP *chem + chem* Li *chem / chem* DVP *chem ( 21 . 4 % ) were no different than with PBO + chem* Li *chem / chem* DVP *chem ( 19 . 2 % ) .

column1: Adverse events related to EPS occurred in 59 . 6 % of patients treated with haloperidol ( n = 99 ) monotherapy , whereas 26 . 5 % of patients treated with lithium ( n = 98 ) monotherapy experienced adverse events related to EPS .
column2: Adverse events related to EPS occurred in 59 . 6 % of patients treated with chem* haloperidol *chem ( n = 99 ) monotherapy , whereas 26 . 5 % of patients treated with chem* lithium *chem ( n = 98 ) monotherapy experienced adverse events related to EPS .

column1: The incidence of akathisia was low and similar with quetiapine monotherapy ( 3 . 3 % ) and placebo ( 6 . 1 % ) , and with QTP + Li / DVP ( 3 . 6 % ) and PBO + Li / DVP ( 4 . 9 % ) .
column2: The incidence of akathisia was low and similar with chem* quetiapine *chem monotherapy ( 3 . 3 % ) and placebo ( 6 . 1 % ) , and with chem* QTP *chem + chem* Li *chem / chem* DVP *chem ( 3 . 6 % ) and PBO + chem* Li *chem / chem* DVP *chem ( 4 . 9 % ) .

column1: Lithium was associated with a significantly higher incidence ( p < 0 . 05 ) of tremor ( 18 . 4 % ) than quetiapine ( 5 . 6 % ) ; cerebellar tremor , which is a known adverse effect of lithium , may have contributed to the elevated rate of tremor in patients receiving lithium therapy .
column2: chem* Lithium *chem was associated with a significantly higher incidence ( p < 0 . 05 ) of tremor ( 18 . 4 % ) than chem* quetiapine *chem ( 5 . 6 % ) ; cerebellar tremor , which is a known adverse effect of chem* lithium *chem , may have contributed to the elevated rate of tremor in patients receiving chem* lithium *chem therapy .

column1: Haloperidol induced a significantly higher incidence ( p < 0 . 001 ) of akathisia ( 33 . 3 % versus 5 . 9 % ) , tremor ( 30 . 3 % versus 7 . 8 % ) , and extrapyramidal syndrome ( 35 . 4 % versus 5 . 9 % ) than quetiapine .
column2: chem* Haloperidol *chem induced a significantly higher incidence ( p < 0 . 001 ) of akathisia ( 33 . 3 % versus 5 . 9 % ) , tremor ( 30 . 3 % versus 7 . 8 % ) , and extrapyramidal syndrome ( 35 . 4 % versus 5 . 9 % ) than chem* quetiapine *chem .

column1: No significant differences were observed between quetiapine and placebo on SAS and BARS scores .
column2: No significant differences were observed between chem* quetiapine *chem and placebo on SAS and BARS scores .

column1: Anticholinergic use was low and similar with quetiapine or placebo .
column2: Anticholinergic use was low and similar with chem* quetiapine *chem or placebo .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : In bipolar mania , the incidence of EPS , including akathisia , with quetiapine therapy is similar to that with placebo .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : In bipolar mania , the incidence of EPS , including akathisia , with chem* quetiapine *chem therapy is similar to that with placebo .

column1: Is phenytoin administration safe in a hypothermic child ?
column2: Is chem* phenytoin *chem administration safe in a hypothermic child ?

column1: A male neonate with a Chiari malformation and a leaking myelomeningocoele underwent ventriculoperitoneal shunt insertion followed by repair of myelomeningocoele .
column2: A male neonate with a Chiari malformation and a leaking myelomeningocoele underwent ventriculoperitoneal shunt insertion followed by repair of myelomeningocoele .

column1: During anaesthesia and surgery , he inadvertently became moderately hypothermic .
column2: During anaesthesia and surgery , he inadvertently became moderately hypothermic .

column1: Intravenous phenytoin was administered during the later part of the surgery for seizure prophylaxis .
column2: Intravenous chem* phenytoin *chem was administered during the later part of the surgery for seizure prophylaxis .

column1: Following phenytoin administration , the patient developed acute severe bradycardia , refractory to atropine and adrenaline .
column2: Following chem* phenytoin *chem administration , the patient developed acute severe bradycardia , refractory to chem* atropine *chem and chem* adrenaline *chem .

column1: The cardiac depressant actions of phenytoin and hypothermia can be additive .
column2: The cardiac depressant actions of chem* phenytoin *chem and hypothermia can be additive .

column1: Administration of phenytoin in the presence of hypothermia may lead to an adverse cardiac event in children .
column2: Administration of chem* phenytoin *chem in the presence of hypothermia may lead to an adverse cardiac event in children .

column1: As phenytoin is a commonly used drug , clinicians need to be aware of this interaction .
column2: As chem* phenytoin *chem is a commonly used drug , clinicians need to be aware of this interaction .

column1: Valproate - induced chorea and encephalopathy in atypical nonketotic hyperglycinemia .

column1: Nonketotic hyperglycinemia is a disorder of amino acid metabolism in which a defect in the glycine cleavage system leads to an accumulation of glycine in the brain and other body compartments .
column2: Nonketotic hyperglycinemia is a disorder of amino acid metabolism in which a defect in the chem* glycine *chem cleavage system leads to an accumulation of chem* glycine *chem in the brain and other body compartments .

column1: In the classical form it presents as neonatal apnea , intractable seizures , and hypotonia , followed by significant psychomotor retardation .
column2: In the classical form it presents as neonatal apnea , intractable seizures , and hypotonia , followed by significant psychomotor retardation .

column1: An important subset of children with nonketotic hyperglycinemia are atypical variants who present in a heterogeneous manner .
column2: An important subset of children with nonketotic hyperglycinemia are atypical variants who present in a heterogeneous manner .

column1: Delayed institution of hypertension during focal cerebral ischemia : effect on brain edema .
column2: Delayed institution of hypertension during focal cerebral ischemia : effect on brain edema .

column1: The effect of induced hypertension instituted after a 2 - h delay following middle cerebral artery occlusion ( MCAO ) on brain edema formation and histochemical injury was studied .
column2: The effect of induced hypertension instituted after a 2 - h delay following middle cerebral artery occlusion ( MCAO ) on brain edema formation and histochemical injury was studied .

column1: Under isoflurane anesthesia , the MCA of 14 spontaneously hypertensive rats was occluded .
column2: Under chem* isoflurane *chem anesthesia , the MCA of 14 spontaneously hypertensive rats was occluded .

column1: In the control group ( n = 7 ) , the mean arterial pressure ( MAP ) was not manipulated .
column2: In the control group ( n = 7 ) , the mean arterial pressure ( MAP ) was not manipulated .

column1: In the hypertensive group ( n = 7 ) , the MAP was elevated by 25 - 30 mm Hg beginning 2 h after MCAO .
column2: In the hypertensive group ( n = 7 ) , the MAP was elevated by 25 - 30 mm Hg beginning 2 h after MCAO .

column1: Four hours after MCAO , the rats were killed and the brains harvested .
column2: Four hours after MCAO , the rats were killed and the brains harvested .

column1: The brains were sectioned along coronal planes spanning the distribution of ischemia produced by MCAO .
column2: The brains were sectioned along coronal planes spanning the distribution of ischemia produced by MCAO .

column1: Specific gravity ( SG ) was determined in the subcortex and in two sites in the cortex ( core and periphery of the ischemic territory ) .
column2: Specific gravity ( SG ) was determined in the subcortex and in two sites in the cortex ( core and periphery of the ischemic territory ) .

column1: The extent of neuronal injury was determined by 2 , 3 , 5 - triphenyltetrazolium staining .
column2: The extent of neuronal injury was determined by chem* 2 , 3 , 5 - triphenyltetrazolium *chem staining .

column1: In the ischemic core , there was no difference in SG in the subcortex and cortex in the two groups .
column2: In the ischemic core , there was no difference in SG in the subcortex and cortex in the two groups .

column1: In the periphery of the ischemic territory , SG in the cortex was greater ( less edema accumulation ) in the hypertensive group ( 1 . 041 + / - 0 . 001 vs 1 . 039 + / - 0 . 001 , P less than 0 . 05 ) .
column2: In the periphery of the ischemic territory , SG in the cortex was greater ( less edema accumulation ) in the hypertensive group ( 1 . 041 + / - 0 . 001 vs 1 . 039 + / - 0 . 001 , P less than 0 . 05 ) .

column1: The area of histochemical injury ( as a percent of the cross - sectional area of the hemisphere ) was less in the hypertensive group ( 33 + / - 3 % vs 21 + / - 2 % , P less than 0 . 05 ) .
column2: The area of histochemical injury ( as a percent of the cross - sectional area of the hemisphere ) was less in the hypertensive group ( 33 + / - 3 % vs 21 + / - 2 % , P less than 0 . 05 ) .

column1: The data indicate that phenylephrine - induced hypertension instituted 2 h after MCAO does not aggravate edema in the ischemic core , that it improves edema in the periphery of the ischemic territory , and that it reduces the area of histochemical neuronal dysfunction .
column2: The data indicate that chem* phenylephrine *chem - induced hypertension instituted 2 h after MCAO does not aggravate edema in the ischemic core , that it improves edema in the periphery of the ischemic territory , and that it reduces the area of histochemical neuronal dysfunction .

column1: Behavioral effects of pubertal anabolic androgenic steroid exposure in male rats with low serotonin .

column1: The goal of this study was to assess the interactive effects of chronic anabolic androgenic steroid ( AAS ) exposure and brain serotonin ( 5 - hydroxytryptamine , 5 - HT ) depletion on behavior of pubertal male rats .

column2: chem* Serotonin *chem was depleted beginning on postnatal day 26 with chem* parachlorophenylalanine *chem ( chem* PCPA *chem 100 mg / kg , every other day ) ; controls received saline .

column1: At puberty ( P40 ) , half the PCPA - treated rats and half the saline - treated rats began treatment with testosterone ( T , 5 mg / kg , 5 days / week ) .
column2: At puberty ( P40 ) , half the chem* PCPA *chem - treated rats and half the saline - treated rats began treatment with chem* testosterone *chem ( chem* T *chem , 5 mg / kg , 5 days / week ) .

column2: Behavioral measures included locomotion , irritability , copulation , partner preference , and aggression .

column1: Animals were tested for aggression in their home cage , both with and without physical provocation ( mild tail pinch ) .
column2: Animals were tested for aggression in their home cage , both with and without physical provocation ( mild tail pinch ) .

column1: Brain levels of 5 - HT and its metabolite , 5 - hydroxyindoleacetic acid ( 5 - HIAA ) , were determined using HPLC .
column2: Brain levels of chem* 5 - HT *chem and its metabolite , chem* 5 - hydroxyindoleacetic acid *chem ( chem* 5 - HIAA *chem ) , were determined using HPLC .

column1: PCPA significantly and substantially depleted 5 - HT and 5 - HIAA in all brain regions examined .
column2: chem* PCPA *chem significantly and substantially depleted chem* 5 - HT *chem and chem* 5 - HIAA *chem in all brain regions examined .

column1: Chronic T treatment significantly decreased 5 - HT and 5 - HIAA in certain brain areas , but to a much lesser extent than PCPA .
column2: Chronic chem* T *chem treatment significantly decreased chem* 5 - HT *chem and chem* 5 - HIAA *chem in certain brain areas , but to a much lesser extent than chem* PCPA *chem .

column1: Chronic exposure to PCPA alone significantly decreased locomotor activity and increased irritability but had no effect on sexual behavior , partner preference , or aggression .
column2: Chronic exposure to chem* PCPA *chem alone significantly decreased locomotor activity and increased irritability but had no effect on sexual behavior , partner preference , or aggression .

column1: T alone had no effect on locomotion , irritability , or sexual behavior but increased partner preference and aggression .
column2: chem* T *chem alone had no effect on locomotion , irritability , or sexual behavior but increased partner preference and aggression .

column1: The most striking effect of combining T + PCPA was a significant increase in attack frequency as well as a significant decrease in the latency to attack , particularly following physical provocation .
column2: The most striking effect of combining chem* T *chem + chem* PCPA *chem was a significant increase in attack frequency as well as a significant decrease in the latency to attack , particularly following physical provocation .

column1: Based on these data , it can be speculated that pubertal AAS users with low central 5 - HT may be especially prone to exhibit aggressive behavior .
column2: Based on these data , it can be speculated that pubertal AAS users with low central chem* 5 - HT *chem may be especially prone to exhibit aggressive behavior .

column1: Effects of UMB24 and ( + / - ) - SM 21 , putative sigma2 - preferring antagonists , on behavioral toxic and stimulant effects of cocaine in mice .

column2: Earlier studies have demonstrated that antagonism of sigma1 receptors attenuates the convulsive , lethal , locomotor stimulatory and rewarding actions of chem* cocaine *chem in mice .

column1: In contrast , the contribution of sigma2 receptors is unclear because experimental tools to selectively target this subtype are unavailable .
column2: In contrast , the contribution of sigma2 receptors is unclear because experimental tools to selectively target this subtype are unavailable .

column1: To begin addressing this need , we characterized UMB24 ( 1 - ( 2 - phenethyl ) - 4 - ( 2 - pyridyl ) - piperazine ) and ( + / - ) - SM 21 ( 3alpha - tropanyl - 2 - ( 4 - chorophenoxy ) butyrate ) in receptor binding and behavioral studies .

column2: Receptor binding studies confirmed that chem* UMB24 *chem and ( + / - ) - chem* SM 21 *chem display preferential affinity for sigma2 over sigma1 receptors .

column2: In behavioral studies , pretreatment of Swiss Webster mice with chem* UMB24 *chem or ( + / - ) - chem* SM 21 *chem significantly attenuated chem* cocaine *chem - induced convulsions and locomotor activity , but not lethality .

column2: When administered alone , ( + / - ) - chem* SM 21 *chem produced no significant effects compared to control injections of saline , but chem* UMB24 *chem had locomotor depressant actions .

column1: Clonidine is a frequently administered alpha2 - adrenergic agonist which can decrease heart rate and blood pressure .

column1: Topical IOP - lowering medication was administered in 74 . 8 % of implanted eyes , and IOP - lowering surgeries , most of which were trabeculectomies ( 76 . 2 % ) , were performed on 36 . 6 % of implanted eyes .
column2: Topical IOP - lowering medication was administered in 74 . 8 % of implanted eyes , and IOP - lowering surgeries , most of which were trabeculectomies ( 76 . 2 % ) , were performed on 36 . 6 % of implanted eyes .

column1: Intraocular pressure - lowering surgeries were considered a success ( postoperative IOP of 6 - 21 mm Hg with or without additional IOP - lowering medication ) in 85 . 1 % of eyes at 1 year .
column2: Intraocular pressure - lowering surgeries were considered a success ( postoperative IOP of 6 - 21 mm Hg with or without additional IOP - lowering medication ) in 85 . 1 % of eyes at 1 year .

column1: The rate of hypotony ( IOP < / = 5 mm Hg ) following IOP - lowering surgery ( 42 . 5 % ) was not different from that of implanted eyes not subjected to surgery ( 35 . 4 % ) ( P = . 09 ) .
column2: The rate of hypotony ( IOP < / = 5 mm Hg ) following IOP - lowering surgery ( 42 . 5 % ) was not different from that of implanted eyes not subjected to surgery ( 35 . 4 % ) ( P = . 09 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : Elevated IOP is a significant complication with the FA intravitreal implant but may be controlled with medication and surgery .
column2: CONCLUSION : Elevated IOP is a significant complication with the FA intravitreal implant but may be controlled with medication and surgery .

column1: Myocardial Fas ligand expression increases susceptibility to AZT - induced cardiomyopathy .
column2: Myocardial Fas ligand expression increases susceptibility to chem* AZT *chem - induced cardiomyopathy .

column1: BACKGROUND : Dilated cardiomyopathy ( DCM ) and myocarditis occur in many HIV - infected individuals , resulting in symptomatic heart failure in up to 5 % of patients .
column2: BACKGROUND : Dilated cardiomyopathy ( DCM ) and myocarditis occur in many HIV - infected individuals , resulting in symptomatic heart failure in up to 5 % of patients .

column1: Highly active antiretroviral therapy ( HAART ) has significantly reduced morbidity and mortality of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) , but has resulted in an increase in cardiac and skeletal myopathies .
column2: Highly active antiretroviral therapy ( HAART ) has significantly reduced morbidity and mortality of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) , but has resulted in an increase in cardiac and skeletal myopathies .

column1: METHODS AND RESULTS : In order to investigate whether the HAART component zidovudine ( 3 ' - azido - 2 ' , 3 ' - deoxythymidine ; AZT ) triggers the Fas - dependent cell - death pathway and cause cytoskeletal disruption in a murine model of DCM , 8 - week - old transgenic ( expressing Fas ligand in the myocardium : FasL Tg ) and non - transgenic ( NTg ) mice received water ad libitum containing different concentrations of AZT ( 0 , 0 . 07 , 0 . 2 , and 0 . 7 mg / ml ) .
column2: METHODS AND RESULTS : In order to investigate whether the HAART component chem* zidovudine *chem ( chem* 3 ' - azido - 2 ' , 3 ' - deoxythymidine *chem ; chem* AZT *chem ) triggers the Fas - dependent cell - death pathway and cause cytoskeletal disruption in a murine model of DCM , 8 - week - old transgenic ( expressing Fas ligand in the myocardium : FasL Tg ) and non - transgenic ( NTg ) mice received water ad libitum containing different concentrations of chem* AZT *chem ( 0 , 0 . 07 , 0 . 2 , and 0 . 7 mg / ml ) .

column1: After 6 weeks , cardiac function was assessed by echocardiography and morphology was assessed by histopathologic and immunohistochemical methods .
column2: After 6 weeks , cardiac function was assessed by echocardiography and morphology was assessed by histopathologic and immunohistochemical methods .

column1: NTg and untreated FasL Tg mice showed little or no change in cardiac structure or function .
column2: NTg and untreated FasL Tg mice showed little or no change in cardiac structure or function .

column1: In contrast , AZT - treated FasL Tg mice developed cardiac dilation and depressed cardiac function in a dose - dependent manner , with concomitant inflammatory infiltration of both ventricles .
column2: In contrast , chem* AZT *chem - treated FasL Tg mice developed cardiac dilation and depressed cardiac function in a dose - dependent manner , with concomitant inflammatory infiltration of both ventricles .

column1: These changes were associated with an increased sarcolemmal expression of Fas and FasL , as well as increased activation of caspase 3 , translocation of calpain 1 to the sarcolemma and sarcomere , and increased numbers of cells undergoing apoptosis .
column2: These changes were associated with an increased sarcolemmal expression of Fas and FasL , as well as increased activation of caspase 3 , translocation of calpain 1 to the sarcolemma and sarcomere , and increased numbers of cells undergoing apoptosis .

column1: These were associated with changes in dystrophin and cardiac troponin I localization , as well as loss of sarcolemmal integrity .
column2: These were associated with changes in dystrophin and cardiac troponin I localization , as well as loss of sarcolemmal integrity .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : The expression of Fas ligand in the myocardium , as identified in HIV - positive patients , might increase the susceptibility to HAART - induced cardiomyopathy due to activation of apoptotic pathways , resulting in cardiac dilation and dysfunction .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : The expression of Fas ligand in the myocardium , as identified in HIV - positive patients , might increase the susceptibility to HAART - induced cardiomyopathy due to activation of apoptotic pathways , resulting in cardiac dilation and dysfunction .

column1: Gastrointestinal tolerability of etoricoxib in rheumatoid arthritis patients : results of the etoricoxib vs diclofenac sodium gastrointestinal tolerability and effectiveness trial ( EDGE - II ) .
column2: Gastrointestinal tolerability of chem* etoricoxib *chem in rheumatoid arthritis patients : results of the chem* etoricoxib *chem vs chem* diclofenac sodium *chem gastrointestinal tolerability and effectiveness trial ( EDGE - II ) .

column1: OBJECTIVE : A randomised , double - blind study to compare the gastrointestinal ( GI ) tolerability , safety and efficacy of etoricoxib and diclofenac in patients with rheumatoid arthritis ( RA ) .
column2: OBJECTIVE : A randomised , double - blind study to compare the gastrointestinal ( GI ) tolerability , safety and efficacy of chem* etoricoxib *chem and chem* diclofenac *chem in patients with rheumatoid arthritis ( RA ) .

column1: PATIENTS AND METHODS : A total of 4086 patients ( mean age 60 . 8 years ) diagnosed with RA were enrolled and received etoricoxib 90 mg daily ( n = 2032 ) or diclofenac 75 mg twice daily ( n = 2054 ) .
column2: PATIENTS AND METHODS : A total of 4086 patients ( mean age 60 . 8 years ) diagnosed with RA were enrolled and received chem* etoricoxib *chem 90 mg daily ( n = 2032 ) or chem* diclofenac *chem 75 mg twice daily ( n = 2054 ) .

column1: Use of gastroprotective agents and low - dose aspirin was allowed .
column2: Use of gastroprotective agents and low - dose chem* aspirin *chem was allowed .

column1: The prespecified primary end point consisted of the cumulative rate of patient discontinuations due to clinical and laboratory GI adverse experiences ( AEs ) .
column2: The prespecified primary end point consisted of the cumulative rate of patient discontinuations due to clinical and laboratory GI adverse experiences ( AEs ) .

column1: General safety was also assessed , including adjudicated thrombotic cardiovascular event data .
column2: General safety was also assessed , including adjudicated thrombotic cardiovascular event data .

column1: Efficacy was evaluated using the Patient Global Assessment of Disease Status ( PGADS ; 0 - 4 point scale ) .
column2: Efficacy was evaluated using the Patient Global Assessment of Disease Status ( PGADS ; 0 - 4 point scale ) .

column1: RESULTS : Mean ( SD ; maximum ) duration of treatment was 19 . 3 ( 10 . 3 ; 32 . 9 ) and 19 . 1 ( 10 . 4 ; 33 . 1 ) months in the etoricoxib and diclofenac groups , respectively .
column2: RESULTS : Mean ( SD ; maximum ) duration of treatment was 19 . 3 ( 10 . 3 ; 32 . 9 ) and 19 . 1 ( 10 . 4 ; 33 . 1 ) months in the chem* etoricoxib *chem and chem* diclofenac *chem groups , respectively .

column1: The cumulative discontinuation rate due to GI AEs was significantly lower with etoricoxib than diclofenac ( 5 . 2 vs 8 . 5 events per 100 patient - years , respectively ; hazard ratio 0 . 62 ( 95 % CI : 0 . 47 , 0 . 81 ; p < or = 0 . 001 ) ) .
column2: The cumulative discontinuation rate due to GI AEs was significantly lower with chem* etoricoxib *chem than chem* diclofenac *chem ( 5 . 2 vs 8 . 5 events per 100 patient - years , respectively ; hazard ratio 0 . 62 ( 95 % CI : 0 . 47 , 0 . 81 ; p < or = 0 . 001 ) ) .

column1: The incidence of discontinuations for hypertension - related and oedema - related AEs were significantly higher with etoricoxib ( 2 . 5 % and 1 . 1 % respectively ) compared with diclofenac ( 1 . 5 % and 0 . 4 % respectively ; p < 0 . 001 for hypertension and p < 0 . 01 for oedema ) .
column2: The incidence of discontinuations for hypertension - related and oedema - related AEs were significantly higher with chem* etoricoxib *chem ( 2 . 5 % and 1 . 1 % respectively ) compared with chem* diclofenac *chem ( 1 . 5 % and 0 . 4 % respectively ; p < 0 . 001 for hypertension and p < 0 . 01 for oedema ) .

column1: Etoricoxib and diclofenac treatment resulted in similar efficacy ( PGADS mean changes from baseline - 0 . 62 vs - 0 . 58 , respectively ) .
column2: chem* Etoricoxib *chem and chem* diclofenac *chem treatment resulted in similar efficacy ( PGADS mean changes from baseline - 0 . 62 vs - 0 . 58 , respectively ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Etoricoxib 90 mg demonstrated a significantly lower risk for discontinuing treatment due to GI AEs compared with diclofenac 150 mg .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* Etoricoxib *chem 90 mg demonstrated a significantly lower risk for discontinuing treatment due to GI AEs compared with chem* diclofenac *chem 150 mg .

column1: Discontinuations from renovascular AEs , although less common than discontinuations from GI AEs , were significantly higher with etoricoxib .
column2: Discontinuations from renovascular AEs , although less common than discontinuations from GI AEs , were significantly higher with chem* etoricoxib *chem .

column1: Anxiogenic potential of ciprofloxacin and norfloxacin in rats .
column2: Anxiogenic potential of chem* ciprofloxacin *chem and chem* norfloxacin *chem in rats .

column1: INTRODUCTION : The possible anxiogenic effects of fluoroquinolones , namely ciprofloxacin and norfloxacin , were investigated in adult Charles Foster albino rats of either sex , weighing 150 - 200 g .
column2: INTRODUCTION : The possible anxiogenic effects of chem* fluoroquinolones *chem , namely chem* ciprofloxacin *chem and chem* norfloxacin *chem , were investigated in adult Charles Foster albino rats of either sex , weighing 150 - 200 g .

column1: METHODS : The drugs were given orally , in doses of 50 mg / kg for five consecutive days and the experiments were performed on the fifth day .
column2: METHODS : The drugs were given orally , in doses of 50 mg / kg for five consecutive days and the experiments were performed on the fifth day .

column1: The tests included open - field exploratory behaviour , elevated plus maze and elevated zero maze , social interaction and novelty - suppressed feeding latency behaviour .
column2: The tests included open - field exploratory behaviour , elevated plus maze and elevated zero maze , social interaction and novelty - suppressed feeding latency behaviour .

column1: RESULTS : The results indicate that ciprofloxacin - and norfloxacin - treated rats showed anxious behaviour in comparison to control rats in all the parameters studied .
column2: RESULTS : The results indicate that chem* ciprofloxacin *chem - and chem* norfloxacin *chem - treated rats showed anxious behaviour in comparison to control rats in all the parameters studied .

column1: However , ciprofloxacin - and norfloxacin - treated rats did not differ significantly from each other in various behavioural parameters .
column2: However , chem* ciprofloxacin *chem - and chem* norfloxacin *chem - treated rats did not differ significantly from each other in various behavioural parameters .

column1: CONCLUSION : The present experimental findings substantiate the clinically observed anxiogenic potential of ciprofloxacin and norfloxacin .
column2: CONCLUSION : The present experimental findings substantiate the clinically observed anxiogenic potential of chem* ciprofloxacin *chem and chem* norfloxacin *chem .

column1: Reduction of pain during induction with target - controlled propofol and remifentanil .
column2: Reduction of pain during induction with target - controlled chem* propofol *chem and chem* remifentanil *chem .

column1: BACKGROUND : Pain on injection of propofol is unpleasant .
column2: BACKGROUND : Pain on injection of chem* propofol *chem is unpleasant .

column1: We hypothesized that propofol infusion pain might be prevented by infusing remifentanil before starting the propofol infusion in a clinical setting where target - controlled infusions ( TCI ) of both drugs were used .
column2: We hypothesized that chem* propofol *chem infusion pain might be prevented by infusing chem* remifentanil *chem before starting the chem* propofol *chem infusion in a clinical setting where target - controlled infusions ( TCI ) of both drugs were used .

column1: A prospective , randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial was performed to determine the effect - site concentration ( Ce ) of remifentanil to prevent the pain without producing complications .
column2: A prospective , randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial was performed to determine the effect - site concentration ( Ce ) of chem* remifentanil *chem to prevent the pain without producing complications .

column1: METHODS : A total of 128 patients undergoing general surgery were randomly allocated to receive normal saline ( control ) or remifentanil to a target Ce of 2 ng ml ( - 1 ) ( R2 ) , 4 ng ml ( - 1 ) ( R4 ) , or 6 ng ml ( - 1 ) ( R6 ) administered via TCI .
column2: METHODS : A total of 128 patients undergoing general surgery were randomly allocated to receive normal saline ( control ) or chem* remifentanil *chem to a target Ce of 2 ng ml ( - 1 ) ( R2 ) , 4 ng ml ( - 1 ) ( R4 ) , or 6 ng ml ( - 1 ) ( R6 ) administered via TCI .

column1: After the target Ce was achieved , the infusion of propofol was started .
column2: After the target Ce was achieved , the infusion of chem* propofol *chem was started .

column1: Remifentanil - related complications were assessed during the remifentanil infusion , and pain caused by propofol was evaluated using a four - point scale during the propofol infusion .
column2: chem* Remifentanil *chem - related complications were assessed during the chem* remifentanil *chem infusion , and pain caused by chem* propofol *chem was evaluated using a four - point scale during the chem* propofol *chem infusion .

column1: RESULTS : The incidence of pain was significantly lower in Groups R4 and R6 than in the control and R2 groups ( 12 / 32 and 6 / 31 vs 26 / 31 and 25 / 32 , respectively , P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: RESULTS : The incidence of pain was significantly lower in Groups R4 and R6 than in the control and R2 groups ( 12 / 32 and 6 / 31 vs 26 / 31 and 25 / 32 , respectively , P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Pain was less severe in Groups R4 and R6 than in the control and R2 groups ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: Pain was less severe in Groups R4 and R6 than in the control and R2 groups ( P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: However , both incidence and severity of pain were not different between Groups R4 and R6 .
column2: However , both incidence and severity of pain were not different between Groups R4 and R6 .

column1: No significant complications were observed during the study .
column2: No significant complications were observed during the study .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : During induction of anaesthesia with TCI of propofol and remifentanil , a significant reduction in propofol infusion pain was achieved without significant complications by prior administration of remifentanil at a target Ce of 4 ng ml ( - 1 ) .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : During induction of anaesthesia with TCI of chem* propofol *chem and chem* remifentanil *chem , a significant reduction in chem* propofol *chem infusion pain was achieved without significant complications by prior administration of chem* remifentanil *chem at a target Ce of 4 ng ml ( - 1 ) .

column1: Dexmedetomidine and cardiac protection for non - cardiac surgery : a meta - analysis of randomised controlled trials .
column2: chem* Dexmedetomidine *chem and cardiac protection for non - cardiac surgery : a meta - analysis of randomised controlled trials .

column1: We conducted a systematic review of the effects of dexmedetomidine on cardiac outcomes following non - cardiac surgery .
column2: We conducted a systematic review of the effects of chem* dexmedetomidine *chem on cardiac outcomes following non - cardiac surgery .

column1: We included prospective , randomised peri - operative studies of dexmedetomidine that reported mortality , cardiac morbidity or adverse drug events .
column2: We included prospective , randomised peri - operative studies of chem* dexmedetomidine *chem that reported mortality , cardiac morbidity or adverse drug events .

column1: A PubMed Central and EMBASE search was conducted up to July 2007 .
column2: A PubMed Central and EMBASE search was conducted up to July 2007 .

column1: The reference lists of identified papers were examined for further trials .
column2: The reference lists of identified papers were examined for further trials .

column1: Of 425 studies identified , 20 were included in the meta - analysis ( 840 patients ) .
column2: Of 425 studies identified , 20 were included in the meta - analysis ( 840 patients ) .

column1: Dexmedetomidine was associated with a trend towards improved cardiac outcomes ; all - cause mortality ( OR 0 . 27 , 95 % CI 0 . 01 - 7 . 13 , p = 0 . 44 ) , non - fatal myocardial infarction ( OR 0 . 26 , 95 % CI 0 . 04 - 1 . 60 , p = 0 . 14 ) , and myocardial ischaemia ( OR 0 . 65 , 95 % CI 0 . 26 - 1 . 63 , p = 0 . 36 ) .
column2: chem* Dexmedetomidine *chem was associated with a trend towards improved cardiac outcomes ; all - cause mortality ( OR 0 . 27 , 95 % CI 0 . 01 - 7 . 13 , p = 0 . 44 ) , non - fatal myocardial infarction ( OR 0 . 26 , 95 % CI 0 . 04 - 1 . 60 , p = 0 . 14 ) , and myocardial ischaemia ( OR 0 . 65 , 95 % CI 0 . 26 - 1 . 63 , p = 0 . 36 ) .

column1: Peri - operative hypotension ( 26 % , OR 3 . 80 , 95 % CI 1 . 91 - 7 . 54 , p = 0 . 0001 ) and bradycardia ( 17 % , OR 5 . 45 , 95 % CI 2 . 98 - 9 . 95 , p < 0 . 00001 ) were significantly increased .
column2: Peri - operative hypotension ( 26 % , OR 3 . 80 , 95 % CI 1 . 91 - 7 . 54 , p = 0 . 0001 ) and bradycardia ( 17 % , OR 5 . 45 , 95 % CI 2 . 98 - 9 . 95 , p < 0 . 00001 ) were significantly increased .

column1: An anticholinergic did not reduce the incidence of bradycardia ( p = 0 . 43 ) .
column2: An anticholinergic did not reduce the incidence of bradycardia ( p = 0 . 43 ) .

column1: A randomised placebo - controlled trial of dexmedetomidine is warranted .
column2: A randomised placebo - controlled trial of chem* dexmedetomidine *chem is warranted .

column1: Myocardial infarction in pregnancy associated with clomiphene citrate for ovulation induction : a case report .
column2: Myocardial infarction in pregnancy associated with chem* clomiphene citrate *chem for ovulation induction : a case report .

column1: BACKGROUND : Clomiphene citrate ( CC ) is commonly prescribed for ovulation induction .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Clomiphene citrate *chem ( chem* CC *chem ) is commonly prescribed for ovulation induction .

column1: It is considered safe , with minimal side effects .
column2: It is considered safe , with minimal side effects .

column1: Thromboembolism is a rare but life - threatening complication that has been reported after ovulation induction with CC .
column2: Thromboembolism is a rare but life - threatening complication that has been reported after ovulation induction with chem* CC *chem .

column1: Spontaneous coronary thrombosis or thromboembolism with subsequent clot lysis has been suggested as one of the most common causes of myocardial infarction ( MI ) during pregnancy , with a subsequently normal coronary angiogram .
column2: Spontaneous coronary thrombosis or thromboembolism with subsequent clot lysis has been suggested as one of the most common causes of myocardial infarction ( MI ) during pregnancy , with a subsequently normal coronary angiogram .

column1: CASE : A 33 - year - old woman with a 5 - week gestation had recently received CC for ovulation induction and presented with chest pain .
column2: CASE : A 33 - year - old woman with a 5 - week gestation had recently received chem* CC *chem for ovulation induction and presented with chest pain .

column1: An electrocardiogram showed a lateral and anterior wall myocardial infarction .
column2: An electrocardiogram showed a lateral and anterior wall myocardial infarction .

column1: Cardiac enzymes showed a peak rise in troponin I to 9 . 10 ng / mL .
column2: Cardiac enzymes showed a peak rise in troponin I to 9 . 10 ng / mL .

column1: An initial exercise stress test was normal .
column2: An initial exercise stress test was normal .

column1: At the time of admission , the patient was at high risk of radiation injury to the fetus , so a coronary angiogram was postponed until the second trimester .
column2: At the time of admission , the patient was at high risk of radiation injury to the fetus , so a coronary angiogram was postponed until the second trimester .

column1: It showed normal coronary vessels .
column2: It showed normal coronary vessels .

column1: CONCLUSION : This appears to be the first reported case documenting a possible association between CC and myocardial infarction .
column2: CONCLUSION : This appears to be the first reported case documenting a possible association between chem* CC *chem and myocardial infarction .

column1: Thrombosis might be a rare but hazardous complication of CC .
column2: Thrombosis might be a rare but hazardous complication of chem* CC *chem .

column1: Given this life - threatening complication , appropriate prophylactic measures should be used in high - risk woman undergoing ovarian stimulation .
column2: Given this life - threatening complication , appropriate prophylactic measures should be used in high - risk woman undergoing ovarian stimulation .

column1: Reverse or inverted left ventricular apical ballooning syndrome ( reverse Takotsubo cardiomyopathy ) in a young woman in the setting of amphetamine use .
column2: Reverse or inverted left ventricular apical ballooning syndrome ( reverse Takotsubo cardiomyopathy ) in a young woman in the setting of chem* amphetamine *chem use .

column1: Transient left ventricular apical ballooning syndrome was first described in Japan as " Takotsubo cardiomyopathy . " This syndrome has been identified in many other countries .
column2: Transient left ventricular apical ballooning syndrome was first described in Japan as " Takotsubo cardiomyopathy . " This syndrome has been identified in many other countries .

column1: Many variations of this syndrome have been recently described in the literature .
column2: Many variations of this syndrome have been recently described in the literature .

column1: One of the rarest is the reverse type of this syndrome , with hyperdynamic apex and complete akinesia of the base ( as opposed to the classic apical ballooning ) .
column2: One of the rarest is the reverse type of this syndrome , with hyperdynamic apex and complete akinesia of the base ( as opposed to the classic apical ballooning ) .

column1: In this article , we report an interesting case of a young woman who presented with this rare type of reverse apical ballooning syndrome occurring after amphetamine use .
column2: In this article , we report an interesting case of a young woman who presented with this rare type of reverse apical ballooning syndrome occurring after chem* amphetamine *chem use .

column1: This report is followed by review of the literature .
column2: This report is followed by review of the literature .

column1: Results of a comparative , phase III , 12 - week , multicenter , prospective , randomized , double - blind assessment of the efficacy and tolerability of a fixed - dose combination of telmisartan and amlodipine versus amlodipine monotherapy in Indian adults with stage II hypertension .
column2: Results of a comparative , phase III , 12 - week , multicenter , prospective , randomized , double - blind assessment of the efficacy and tolerability of a fixed - dose combination of chem* telmisartan *chem and chem* amlodipine *chem versus chem* amlodipine *chem monotherapy in Indian adults with stage II hypertension .

column1: OBJECTIVE : The aim of this study was to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of a new fixed - dose combination ( FDC ) of telmisartan 40 mg + amlodipine 5 mg ( T + A ) compared with amlodipine 5 - mg monotherapy ( A ) in adult Indian patients with stage II hypertension .
column2: OBJECTIVE : The aim of this study was to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of a new fixed - dose combination ( FDC ) of chem* telmisartan *chem 40 mg + chem* amlodipine *chem 5 mg ( T + A ) compared with chem* amlodipine *chem 5 - mg monotherapy ( A ) in adult Indian patients with stage II hypertension .

column1: METHODS : This comparative , Phase III , 12 - week , multicenter , prospective , randomized , double - blind study was conducted in Indian patients aged 18 to 65 years with established stage II hypertension .
column2: METHODS : This comparative , Phase III , 12 - week , multicenter , prospective , randomized , double - blind study was conducted in Indian patients aged 18 to 65 years with established stage II hypertension .

column1: Patients were treated with oral FDC of T + A or A QD before breakfast for 12 weeks ; blood pressure ( BP ) and heart rate were measured in the sitting position .
column2: Patients were treated with oral FDC of T + A or A QD before breakfast for 12 weeks ; blood pressure ( BP ) and heart rate were measured in the sitting position .

column1: Primary efficacy end points were reduction in clinical systolic BP ( SBP ) / diastolic BP ( DBP ) from baseline to study end and number of responders ( ie , patients who achieved target SBP / DBP < 130 / < 80 mm Hg ) at end of study .
column2: Primary efficacy end points were reduction in clinical systolic BP ( SBP ) / diastolic BP ( DBP ) from baseline to study end and number of responders ( ie , patients who achieved target SBP / DBP < 130 / < 80 mm Hg ) at end of study .

column1: Tolerability was assessed by treatment - emergent adverse events , identified using physical examination , laboratory analysis , and electrocardiography .
column2: Tolerability was assessed by treatment - emergent adverse events , identified using physical examination , laboratory analysis , and electrocardiography .

column1: RESULTS : A total of 210 patients were enrolled in the study ; 203 patients ( 143 men , 60 women ) completed the study while 7 were lost to follow - up ( 4 patients in the T + A group and 3 in the A group ) and considered with - drawn .
column2: RESULTS : A total of 210 patients were enrolled in the study ; 203 patients ( 143 men , 60 women ) completed the study while 7 were lost to follow - up ( 4 patients in the T + A group and 3 in the A group ) and considered with - drawn .

column1: At study end , statistically significant percentage reductions from baseline within groups and between groups were observed in SBP ( T + A [ - 27 . 4 % ] ; A [ - 16 . 6 % ] ) and DBP ( T + A [ - 20 . 1 % ] ; A [ - 13 . 3 % ] ) ( all , P < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: At study end , statistically significant percentage reductions from baseline within groups and between groups were observed in SBP ( T + A [ - 27 . 4 % ] ; A [ - 16 . 6 % ] ) and DBP ( T + A [ - 20 . 1 % ] ; A [ - 13 . 3 % ] ) ( all , P < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: Response rates were 87 . 3 % ( 89 / 102 ) in the T + A group and 69 . 3 % ( 70 / 101 ) in the A group ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: Response rates were 87 . 3 % ( 89 / 102 ) in the T + A group and 69 . 3 % ( 70 / 101 ) in the A group ( P < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: The prevalences of adverse events were not significantly different between the 2 treatment groups ( T + A , 16 . 0 % [ 17 / 106 ] ; A , 15 . 4 % [ 16 / 104 ] ) .
column2: The prevalences of adverse events were not significantly different between the 2 treatment groups ( T + A , 16 . 0 % [ 17 / 106 ] ; A , 15 . 4 % [ 16 / 104 ] ) .

column1: Peripheral edema was reported in 8 . 5 % patients ( 9 / 106 ) in the T + A group compared with 13 . 5 % ( 14 / 104 ) in the A group , and cough was reported in 3 . 8 % patients ( 4 / 106 ) in the T + A group and 1 . 0 % ( 1 / 104 ) patients in the A group ; these differences did not reach statistical significance .
column2: Peripheral edema was reported in 8 . 5 % patients ( 9 / 106 ) in the T + A group compared with 13 . 5 % ( 14 / 104 ) in the A group , and cough was reported in 3 . 8 % patients ( 4 / 106 ) in the T + A group and 1 . 0 % ( 1 / 104 ) patients in the A group ; these differences did not reach statistical significance .

column1: The incidences of headache , dizziness , and diarrhea were similar between the 2 groups .
column2: The incidences of headache , dizziness , and diarrhea were similar between the 2 groups .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Among these Indian patients with stage II hypertension , the FDC of T + A was found to be significantly more effective , with regard to BP reductions , than A , and both treatments were well tolerated .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Among these Indian patients with stage II hypertension , the FDC of T + A was found to be significantly more effective , with regard to BP reductions , than A , and both treatments were well tolerated .

column1: Increased mental slowing associated with the APOE epsilon4 allele after trihexyphenidyl oral anticholinergic challenge in healthy elderly .
column2: Increased mental slowing associated with the APOE epsilon4 allele after chem* trihexyphenidyl *chem oral anticholinergic challenge in healthy elderly .

column1: OBJECTIVES : The objectives of this study were to examine the relationship between APOE epsilon4 and subjective effects of trihexyphenidyl on measures reflecting sedation and confusion and to investigate the relationship between trihexyphenidyl - induced subjective effects and objective memory performance .
column2: OBJECTIVES : The objectives of this study were to examine the relationship between APOE epsilon4 and subjective effects of chem* trihexyphenidyl *chem on measures reflecting sedation and confusion and to investigate the relationship between chem* trihexyphenidyl *chem - induced subjective effects and objective memory performance .

column1: METHODS : This study comprised 24 cognitively intact , health elderly adults ( 12 APOE epsilon4 carriers ) at an outpatient geriatric psychiatry research clinic .
column2: METHODS : This study comprised 24 cognitively intact , health elderly adults ( 12 APOE epsilon4 carriers ) at an outpatient geriatric psychiatry research clinic .

column1: This was a randomized , double blind , placebo - controlled , three - way , crossover experimental design .
column2: This was a randomized , double blind , placebo - controlled , three - way , crossover experimental design .

column1: All participants received 1 . 0 mg or 2 . 0 mg trihexyphenidyl or placebo administered in counterbalanced sequences over a period of three consecutive weeks .
column2: All participants received 1 . 0 mg or 2 . 0 mg chem* trihexyphenidyl *chem or placebo administered in counterbalanced sequences over a period of three consecutive weeks .

column1: Bond and Lader ' s visual analog scales and alternate versions of the Buschke Selective Reminding Test were administered in a repeated measures design at baseline , 1 , 2 . 5 , and 5 hours postdrug administration .
column2: Bond and Lader ' s visual analog scales and alternate versions of the Buschke Selective Reminding Test were administered in a repeated measures design at baseline , 1 , 2 . 5 , and 5 hours postdrug administration .

column1: RESULTS : A 2 . 0 - mg oral dose of trihexyphenidyl resulted in increased subjective ratings of mental slowness in carriers of the APOE epsilon4 allele only .

column1: High dose dexmedetomidine as the sole sedative for pediatric MRI .

column1: OBJECTIVE : This large - scale retrospective review evaluates the sedation profile of dexmedetomidine .

column1: AIM : To determine the hemodynamic responses , efficacy and adverse events associated with the use of high dose dexmedetomidine as the sole sedative for magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) studies .
column2: AIM : To determine the hemodynamic responses , efficacy and adverse events associated with the use of high dose chem* dexmedetomidine *chem as the sole sedative for magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) studies .

column1: BACKGROUND : Dexmedetomidine has been used at our institution since 2005 to provide sedation for pediatric radiological imaging studies .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Dexmedetomidine *chem has been used at our institution since 2005 to provide sedation for pediatric radiological imaging studies .

column1: METHODS / MATERIALS : As part of the ongoing Quality Assurance process , data on all sedations are reviewed monthly and protocols modified as needed .
column2: METHODS / MATERIALS : As part of the ongoing Quality Assurance process , data on all sedations are reviewed monthly and protocols modified as needed .

column1: RESULTS : Since 2005 , the 10 - min loading dose of our dexmedetomidine protocol increased from 2 to 3 microg . kg ( - 1 ) , and the infusion rate increased from 1 to 1 . 5 to 2 microg . kg ( - 1 ) . h ( - 1 ) .
column2: RESULTS : Since 2005 , the 10 - min loading dose of our chem* dexmedetomidine *chem protocol increased from 2 to 3 microg . kg ( - 1 ) , and the infusion rate increased from 1 to 1 . 5 to 2 microg . kg ( - 1 ) . h ( - 1 ) .

column1: The current sedation protocol progressively increased the rate of successful sedation ( able to complete the imaging study ) when using dexmedetomidine alone from 91 . 8 % to 97 . 6 % ( P = 0 . 009 ) , reducing the requirement for adjuvant pentobarbital in the event of sedation failure with dexmedetomidine alone and decreased the mean recovery time by 10 min ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: The current sedation protocol progressively increased the rate of successful sedation ( able to complete the imaging study ) when using chem* dexmedetomidine *chem alone from 91 . 8 % to 97 . 6 % ( P = 0 . 009 ) , reducing the requirement for adjuvant chem* pentobarbital *chem in the event of sedation failure with chem* dexmedetomidine *chem alone and decreased the mean recovery time by 10 min ( P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Although dexmedetomidine sedation was associated with a 16 % incidence of bradycardia , all concomitant mean arterial blood pressures were within 20 % of age - adjusted normal range and oxygen saturations were 95 % or higher .
column2: Although chem* dexmedetomidine *chem sedation was associated with a 16 % incidence of bradycardia , all concomitant mean arterial blood pressures were within 20 % of age - adjusted normal range and chem* oxygen *chem saturations were 95 % or higher .

column1: CONCLUSION : Dexmedetomidine in high doses provides adequate sedation for pediatric MRI studies .
column2: CONCLUSION : chem* Dexmedetomidine *chem in high doses provides adequate sedation for pediatric MRI studies .

column1: While use of high dose dexmedetomidine is associated with decreases in heart rate and blood pressure outside the established ' awake ' norms , this deviation is generally within 20 % of norms , and is not associated with adverse sequelae .
column2: While use of high dose chem* dexmedetomidine *chem is associated with decreases in heart rate and blood pressure outside the established ' awake ' norms , this deviation is generally within 20 % of norms , and is not associated with adverse sequelae .

column1: Dexmedetomidine is useful as the sole sedative for pediatric MRI .

column1: Long term hormone therapy for perimenopausal and postmenopausal women .

column1: BACKGROUND : Hormone therapy ( HT ) is widely used for controlling menopausal symptoms and has also been used for the management and prevention of cardiovascular disease , osteoporosis and dementia in older women .
column2: BACKGROUND : Hormone therapy ( HT ) is widely used for controlling menopausal symptoms and has also been used for the management and prevention of cardiovascular disease , osteoporosis and dementia in older women .

column1: This is an updated version of the original Cochrane review first published in 2005 .
column2: This is an updated version of the original Cochrane review first published in 2005 .

column1: OBJECTIVES : To assess the effect of long - term HT on mortality , cardiovascular outcomes , cancer , gallbladder disease , cognition , fractures and quality of life .
column2: OBJECTIVES : To assess the effect of long - term HT on mortality , cardiovascular outcomes , cancer , gallbladder disease , cognition , fractures and quality of life .

column1: SEARCH STRATEGY : We searched the following databases to November 2007 : Trials Register of the Cochrane Menstrual Disorders and Subfertility Group , Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials , MEDLINE , EMBASE , Biological Abstracts .

column2: DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS : Two authors independently assessed trial quality and extracted data .

column1: MAIN RESULTS : Nineteen trials involving 41 , 904 women were included .
column2: MAIN RESULTS : Nineteen trials involving 41 , 904 women were included .

column1: In relatively healthy women , combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism or coronary event ( after one year ' s use ) , stroke ( after three years ) , breast cancer and gallbladder disease .
column2: In relatively healthy women , combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism or coronary event ( after one year ' s use ) , stroke ( after three years ) , breast cancer and gallbladder disease .

column1: Long - term oestrogen - only HT significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism , stroke and gallbladder disease ( after one to two years , three years and seven years ' use respectively ) , but did not significantly increase the risk of breast cancer .
column2: Long - term chem* oestrogen *chem - only HT significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism , stroke and gallbladder disease ( after one to two years , three years and seven years ' use respectively ) , but did not significantly increase the risk of breast cancer .

column2: The only statistically significant benefits of HT were a decreased incidence of fractures and ( for combined HT ) colon cancer , with long - term use .

column1: Among women aged over 65 who were relatively healthy ( i . e . generally fit , without overt disease ) and taking continuous combined HT , there was a statistically significant increase in the incidence of dementia .
column2: Among women aged over 65 who were relatively healthy ( i . e . generally fit , without overt disease ) and taking continuous combined HT , there was a statistically significant increase in the incidence of dementia .

column1: Among women with cardiovascular disease , long - term use of combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism . One trial analysed subgroups of 2839 relatively healthy 50 to 59 year old women taking combined continuous HT and 1637 taking oestrogen - only HT , versus similar - sized placebo groups .
column2: Among women with cardiovascular disease , long - term use of combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism . column1: Seizures associated with levofloxacin : case presentation and literature review .

column1: PURPOSE : We present a case of a patient who developed seizures shortly after initiating treatment with levofloxacin and to discuss the potential drug - drug interactions related to the inhibition of cytochrome P450 ( CYP ) 1A2 in this case , as well as in other cases , of levofloxacin - induced seizures .
column2: PURPOSE : We present a case of a patient who developed seizures shortly after initiating treatment with chem* levofloxacin *chem and to discuss the potential drug - drug interactions related to the inhibition of cytochrome P450 ( CYP ) 1A2 in this case , as well as in other cases , of chem* levofloxacin *chem - induced seizures .

column1: The main search terms utilized were case report and levofloxacin .
column2: The main search terms utilized were case report and chem* levofloxacin *chem .

column1: The search was limited to studies published in English .
column2: The search was limited to studies published in English .

column1: RESULTS : Six cases of levofloxacin - induced seizures have been reported in the literature .
column2: RESULTS : Six cases of chem* levofloxacin *chem - induced seizures have been reported in the literature .

column1: Drug - drug interactions related to the inhibition of CYP1A2 by levofloxacin are likely involved in the clinical outcome of these cases .
column2: Drug - drug interactions related to the inhibition of CYP1A2 by chem* levofloxacin *chem are likely involved in the clinical outcome of these cases .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Clinicians are exhorted to pay close attention when initiating levofloxacin therapy in patients taking medications with epileptogenic properties that are CYP1A2 substrates .

column1: Reversible myocardial hypertrophy induced by tacrolimus in a pediatric heart transplant recipient : case report .

column1: Tacrolimus is a potent immunosuppressant that is frequently used in organ transplantation .
column2: chem* Tacrolimus *chem is a potent immunosuppressant that is frequently used in organ transplantation .

column1: However , adverse effects include cardiac toxicity .
column2: However , adverse effects include cardiac toxicity .

column1: Herein we describe transient myocardial hypertrophy induced by tacrolimus after heart transplantation .
column2: Herein we describe transient myocardial hypertrophy induced by chem* tacrolimus *chem after heart transplantation .

column1: The hypertrophy caused no clinical symptoms but was noted because of elevation of plasma brain natriuretic peptide concentration and confirmed at echocardiography .
column2: The hypertrophy caused no clinical symptoms but was noted because of elevation of plasma brain natriuretic peptide concentration and confirmed at echocardiography .

column1: Initially , allograft rejection was feared ; however , myocardial biopsy samples revealed only interstitial edema and mild myocardial hypertrophy ; neither cellular nor humoral rejection was detected .
column2: Initially , allograft rejection was feared ; however , myocardial biopsy samples revealed only interstitial edema and mild myocardial hypertrophy ; neither cellular nor humoral rejection was detected .

column1: The blood tacrolimus concentration was higher than usual at that time ; thus , tacrolimus dosage was reduced .
column2: The blood chem* tacrolimus *chem concentration was higher than usual at that time ; thus , chem* tacrolimus *chem dosage was reduced .

column1: Myocardial hypertrophy completely resolved upon reducing the target concentration of tacrolimus and did not recur , as confirmed at echocardiography and myocardial biopsy .
column2: Myocardial hypertrophy completely resolved upon reducing the target concentration of chem* tacrolimus *chem and did not recur , as confirmed at echocardiography and myocardial biopsy .

column1: Thus , we conclude that tacrolimus induces reversible myocardial hypertrophy .

column1: In patients receiving tacrolimus therapy , blood concentration should be carefully controlled and extreme attention paid to cardiac involvement .
column2: In patients receiving chem* tacrolimus *chem therapy , blood concentration should be carefully controlled and extreme attention paid to cardiac involvement .

column1: Nimodipine prevents memory impairment caused by nitroglycerin - induced hypotension in adult mice .
column2: chem* Nimodipine *chem prevents memory impairment caused by chem* nitroglycerin *chem - induced hypotension in adult mice .

column1: BACKGROUND : Hypotension and a resultant decrease in cerebral blood flow have been implicated in the development of cognitive dysfunction .
column2: BACKGROUND : Hypotension and a resultant decrease in cerebral blood flow have been implicated in the development of cognitive dysfunction .

column1: We tested the hypothesis that nimodipine ( NIMO ) administered at the onset of nitroglycerin ( NTG ) - induced hypotension would preserve long - term associative memory .
column2: We tested the hypothesis that chem* nimodipine *chem ( chem* NIMO *chem ) administered at the onset of chem* nitroglycerin *chem ( chem* NTG *chem ) - induced hypotension would preserve long - term associative memory .

column1: METHODS : The passive avoidance ( PA ) paradigm was used to assess memory retention .
column2: METHODS : The passive avoidance ( PA ) paradigm was used to assess memory retention .

column1: For PA training , latencies ( seconds ) were recorded for entry from a suspended platform into a Plexiglas tube where a shock was automatically delivered .
column2: For PA training , latencies ( seconds ) were recorded for entry from a suspended platform into a Plexiglas tube where a shock was automatically delivered .

column1: Latencies were recorded 48 h later for a testing trial .
column2: Latencies were recorded 48 h later for a testing trial .

column1: Ninety - six Swiss - Webster mice ( 30 - 35 g , 6 - 8 wk ) , were randomized into 6 groups 1 ) saline ( control ) , 2 ) NTG immediately after learning , 3 ) NTG 3 h after learning , 4 ) NTG and NIMO , 5 ) vehicle , and 6 ) NIMO alone .
column2: Ninety - six Swiss - Webster mice ( 30 - 35 g , 6 - 8 wk ) , were randomized into 6 groups 1 ) saline ( control ) , 2 ) chem* NTG *chem immediately after learning , 3 ) chem* NTG *chem 3 h after learning , 4 ) chem* NTG *chem and chem* NIMO *chem , 5 ) vehicle , and 6 ) chem* NIMO *chem alone .

column1: The extent of hypotension and changes in brain tissue oxygenation ( PbtO ( 2 ) ) and in cerebral blood flow were studied in a separate group of animals .
column2: The extent of hypotension and changes in brain tissue oxygenation ( PbtO ( 2 ) ) and in cerebral blood flow were studied in a separate group of animals .

column1: RESULTS : All groups exhibited similar training latencies ( 17 . 0 + / - 4 . 6 s ) .
column2: RESULTS : All groups exhibited similar training latencies ( 17 . 0 + / - 4 . 6 s ) .

column1: Mice subjected to hypotensive episodes showed a significant decrease in latency time ( 178 + / - 156 s ) compared with those injected with saline , NTG + NIMO , or delayed NTG ( 580 + / - 81 s , 557 + / - 67 s , and 493 + / - 146 s , respectively ) .
column2: Mice subjected to hypotensive episodes showed a significant decrease in latency time ( 178 + / - 156 s ) compared with those injected with saline , chem* NTG *chem + chem* NIMO *chem , or delayed chem* NTG *chem ( 580 + / - 81 s , 557 + / - 67 s , and 493 + / - 146 s , respectively ) .

column1: A Kruskal - Wallis 1 - way analysis of variance indicated a significant difference among the 4 treatment groups ( H = 15 . 34 ; P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: A Kruskal - Wallis 1 - way analysis of variance indicated a significant difference among the 4 treatment groups ( H = 15 . 34 ; P < 0 . 001 ) .

column2: In a separate group of mice not subjected to behavioral studies , the same dose of chem* NTG *chem ( n = 3 ) and chem* NTG *chem + chem* NIMO *chem ( n = 3 ) caused mean arterial blood pressure to decrease from 85 . 9 + / - 3 . 8 mm Hg sem to 31 . 6 + / - 0 . 8 mm Hg sem and from 86 . 2 + / - 3 . 7 mm Hg sem to 32 . 6 + / - 0 . 2 mm Hg sem , respectively .

column2: Mean arterial blood pressure in mice treated with chem* NIMO *chem alone decreased from 88 . 1 + / - 3 . 8 mm Hg to 80 . 0 + / - 2 . 9 mm Hg .

column1: The intergroup difference was statistically significant ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: The intergroup difference was statistically significant ( P < 0 . 05 ) .

column2: PbtO ( 2 ) decreased from 51 . 7 + / - 4 . 5 mm Hg sem to 33 . 8 + / - 5 . 2 mm Hg sem in the chem* NTG *chem group and from 38 . 6 + / - 6 . 1 mm Hg sem to 25 . 4 + / - 2 . 0 mm Hg sem in the chem* NTG *chem + chem* NIMO *chem groups , respectively .

column1: There were no significant differences among groups .
column2: There were no significant differences among groups .

column1: CONCLUSION : In a PA retention paradigm , the injection of NTG immediately after learning produced a significant impairment of long - term associative memory in mice , whereas delayed induced hypotension had no effect .
column2: CONCLUSION : In a PA retention paradigm , the injection of chem* NTG *chem immediately after learning produced a significant impairment of long - term associative memory in mice , whereas delayed induced hypotension had no effect .

column1: Metabotropic glutamate 7 receptor subtype modulates motor symptoms in rodent models of Parkinson ' s disease .

column1: Metabotropic glutamate ( mGlu ) receptors modulate synaptic transmission in the central nervous system and represent promising therapeutic targets for symptomatic treatment of Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) .
column2: Metabotropic chem* glutamate *chem ( mGlu ) receptors modulate synaptic transmission in the central nervous system and represent promising therapeutic targets for symptomatic treatment of Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) .

column1: Among the eight mGlu receptor subtypes , mGlu7 receptor is prominently expressed in the basal ganglia , but its role in restoring motor function in animal models of PD is not known .
column2: Among the eight mGlu receptor subtypes , mGlu7 receptor is prominently expressed in the basal ganglia , but its role in restoring motor function in animal models of PD is not known .

column1: The effects of N , N ' - dibenzhydrylethane - 1 , 2 - diamine dihydrochloride ( AMN082 ) , the first selective allosteric activator of mGlu7 receptors , were thus tested in different rodent models of PD .
column2: The effects of chem* N , N ' - dibenzhydrylethane - 1 , 2 - diamine dihydrochloride *chem ( chem* AMN082 *chem ) , the first selective allosteric activator of mGlu7 receptors , were thus tested in different rodent models of PD .

column1: Here , we show that oral ( 5 mg / kg ) or intrastriatal administration ( 0 . 1 and 0 . 5 nmol ) of AMN082 reverses haloperidol - induced catalepsy in rats .
column2: Here , we show that oral ( 5 mg / kg ) or intrastriatal administration ( 0 . 1 and 0 . 5 nmol ) of chem* AMN082 *chem reverses chem* haloperidol *chem - induced catalepsy in rats .

column2: chem* AMN082 *chem ( 2 . 5 and 5 mg / kg ) reduces chem* apomorphine *chem - induced rotations in unilateral chem* 6 - hydroxydopamine *chem ( chem* 6 - OHDA *chem ) - lesioned rats .

column2: In a more complex task commonly used to evaluate major akinetic symptoms of PD patients , 5 mg / kg chem* AMN082 *chem reverses the increased reaction time to respond to a cue of bilateral chem* 6 - OHDA *chem - lesioned rats .

column1: In addition , AMN082 reduces the duration of haloperidol - induced catalepsy in a mGlu7 receptor - dependent manner in wild - type but not mGlu7 receptor knockout mice .
column2: In addition , chem* AMN082 *chem reduces the duration of chem* haloperidol *chem - induced catalepsy in a mGlu7 receptor - dependent manner in wild - type but not mGlu7 receptor knockout mice .

column1: Higher doses of AMN082 ( 10 and 20 mg / kg p . o . ) have no effect on the same models of PD .
column2: Higher doses of chem* AMN082 *chem ( 10 and 20 mg / kg p . o . ) have no effect on the same models of PD .

column1: Overall these findings suggest that mGlu7 receptor activation can reverse motor dysfunction associated with reduced dopamine activity .
column2: Overall these findings suggest that mGlu7 receptor activation can reverse motor dysfunction associated with reduced chem* dopamine *chem activity .

column1: Selective ligands of mGlu7 receptor subtypes may thus be considered as promising compounds for the development of antiparkinsonian therapeutic strategies .
column2: Selective ligands of mGlu7 receptor subtypes may thus be considered as promising compounds for the development of antiparkinsonian therapeutic strategies .

column2: No evidence of brain ischemic , metabolic , or hyperthermia - induced causes for their seizures was apparent .

column1: Sedation depth during spinal anesthesia and the development of postoperative delirium in elderly patients undergoing hip fracture repair .
column2: Sedation depth during spinal anesthesia and the development of postoperative delirium in elderly patients undergoing hip fracture repair .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To determine whether limiting intraoperative sedation depth during spinal anesthesia for hip fracture repair in elderly patients can decrease the prevalence of postoperative delirium .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To determine whether limiting intraoperative sedation depth during spinal anesthesia for hip fracture repair in elderly patients can decrease the prevalence of postoperative delirium .

column1: PATIENTS AND METHODS : We performed a double - blind , randomized controlled trial at an academic medical center of elderly patients ( > or = 65 years ) without preoperative delirium or severe dementia who underwent hip fracture repair under spinal anesthesia with propofol sedation .
column2: PATIENTS AND METHODS : We performed a double - blind , randomized controlled trial at an academic medical center of elderly patients ( > or = 65 years ) without preoperative delirium or severe dementia who underwent hip fracture repair under spinal anesthesia with chem* propofol *chem sedation .

column1: Sedation depth was titrated using processed electroencephalography with the bispectral index ( BIS ) , and patients were randomized to receive either deep ( BIS , approximately 50 ) or light ( BIS , > or = 80 ) sedation .
column2: Sedation depth was titrated using processed electroencephalography with the bispectral index ( BIS ) , and patients were randomized to receive either deep ( BIS , approximately 50 ) or light ( BIS , > or = 80 ) sedation .

column1: Postoperative delirium was assessed as defined by Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders ( Third Edition Revised ) criteria using the Confusion Assessment Method beginning at any time from the second day after surgery .
column2: Postoperative delirium was assessed as defined by Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders ( Third Edition Revised ) criteria using the Confusion Assessment Method beginning at any time from the second day after surgery .

column1: RESULTS : From April 2 , 2005 , through October 30 , 2008 , a total of 114 patients were randomized .
column2: RESULTS : From April 2 , 2005 , through October 30 , 2008 , a total of 114 patients were randomized .

column1: The prevalence of postoperative delirium was significantly lower in the light sedation group ( 11 / 57 [ 19 % ] vs 23 / 57 [ 40 % ] in the deep sedation group ; P = . 02 ) , indicating that 1 incident of delirium will be prevented for every 4 . 7 patients treated with light sedation .
column2: The prevalence of postoperative delirium was significantly lower in the light sedation group ( 11 / 57 [ 19 % ] vs 23 / 57 [ 40 % ] in the deep sedation group ; P = . 02 ) , indicating that 1 incident of delirium will be prevented for every 4 . 7 patients treated with light sedation .

column1: The mean + / - SD number of days of delirium during hospitalization was lower in the light sedation group than in the deep sedation group ( 0 . 5 + / - 1 . 5 days vs 1 . 4 + / - 4 . 0 days ; P = . 01 ) .
column2: The mean + / - SD number of days of delirium during hospitalization was lower in the light sedation group than in the deep sedation group ( 0 . 5 + / - 1 . 5 days vs 1 . 4 + / - 4 . 0 days ; P = . 01 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : The use of light propofol sedation decreased the prevalence of postoperative delirium by 50 % compared with deep sedation .
column2: CONCLUSION : The use of light chem* propofol *chem sedation decreased the prevalence of postoperative delirium by 50 % compared with deep sedation .

column1: Limiting depth of sedation during spinal anesthesia is a simple , safe , and cost - effective intervention for preventing postoperative delirium in elderly patients that could be widely and readily adopted .
column2: Limiting depth of sedation during spinal anesthesia is a simple , safe , and cost - effective intervention for preventing postoperative delirium in elderly patients that could be widely and readily adopted .

column1: RESEARCH DESIGN AND METHODS : We explore the protective role of Nrf2 against diabetic nephropathy using human kidney biopsy tissues from diabetic nephropathy patients , a streptozotocin - induced diabetic nephropathy model in Nrf2 ( - / - ) mice , and cultured human mesangial cells .

column2: Mechanistic studies in both in vivo and in vitro systems showed that the Nrf2 - mediated protection against diabetic nephropathy is , at least , partially through inhibition of transforming growth factor - beta1 ( TGF - beta1 ) and reduction of extracellular matrix production .
