column2: Furthermore , activation or overexpression of Nrf2 inhibited the promoter activity of TGF - beta1 in a dose - dependent manner , whereas knockdown of Nrf2 by siRNA enhanced TGF - beta1 transcription and fibronectin production .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : This work clearly indicates a protective role of Nrf2 in diabetic nephropathy , suggesting that dietary or therapeutic activation of Nrf2 could be used as a strategy to prevent or slow down the progression of diabetic nephropathy .

column1: Fear - potentiated startle , but not light - enhanced startle , is enhanced by anxiogenic drugs .
column2: Fear - potentiated startle , but not light - enhanced startle , is enhanced by anxiogenic drugs .

column1: RATIONALE AND OBJECTIVES : The light - enhanced startle paradigm ( LES ) is suggested to model anxiety , because of the non - specific cue and the long - term effect .
column2: RATIONALE AND OBJECTIVES : The light - enhanced startle paradigm ( LES ) is suggested to model anxiety , because of the non - specific cue and the long - term effect .

column1: In contrast , the fear - potentiated startle ( FPS ) is suggested to model conditioned fear .
column2: In contrast , the fear - potentiated startle ( FPS ) is suggested to model conditioned fear .

column1: However , the pharmacological profiles of these two paradigms are very similar .
column2: However , the pharmacological profiles of these two paradigms are very similar .

column1: The present study investigated the effects of putative anxiogenic drugs on LES and FPS and aimed at determining the sensitivity of LES for anxiogenic drugs and to potentially showing a pharmacological differentiation between these two paradigms .
column2: The present study investigated the effects of putative anxiogenic drugs on LES and FPS and aimed at determining the sensitivity of LES for anxiogenic drugs and to potentially showing a pharmacological differentiation between these two paradigms .

column1: METHODS : Male Wistar rats received each dose of the alpha ( 2 ) - adrenoceptor antagonist yohimbine ( 0 . 25 - 1 . 0mg / kg ) , the 5 - HT ( 2C ) receptor agonist m - chlorophenylpiperazine ( mCPP , 0 . 5 - 2 . 0mg / kg ) or the GABA ( A ) inverse receptor agonist pentylenetetrazole ( PTZ , 3 - 30mg / kg ) and were subsequently tested in either LES or FPS .
column2: METHODS : Male Wistar rats received each dose of the alpha ( 2 ) - adrenoceptor antagonist chem* yohimbine *chem ( 0 . 25 - 1 . 0mg / kg ) , the chem* 5 - HT *chem ( 2C ) receptor agonist chem* m - chlorophenylpiperazine *chem ( chem* mCPP *chem , 0 . 5 - 2 . 0mg / kg ) or the chem* GABA *chem ( A ) inverse receptor agonist chem* pentylenetetrazole *chem ( chem* PTZ *chem , 3 - 30mg / kg ) and were subsequently tested in either LES or FPS .

column1: RESULTS : None of the drugs enhanced LES , whereas mCPP increased percentage FPS and yohimbine increased absolute FPS values .
column2: RESULTS : None of the drugs enhanced LES , whereas chem* mCPP *chem increased percentage FPS and chem* yohimbine *chem increased absolute FPS values .

column1: Furthermore , yohimbine increased baseline startle amplitude in the LES , while mCPP suppressed baseline startle in both the LES and FPS and PTZ suppressed baseline startle in the FPS .
column2: Furthermore , chem* yohimbine *chem increased baseline startle amplitude in the LES , while chem* mCPP *chem suppressed baseline startle in both the LES and FPS and chem* PTZ *chem suppressed baseline startle in the FPS .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : In contrast to findings in the FPS paradigm , none of the drugs were able to exacerbate the LES response .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : In contrast to findings in the FPS paradigm , none of the drugs were able to exacerbate the LES response .

column1: Thus , a clear pharmacological differentiation was found between LES and FPS .
column2: Thus , a clear pharmacological differentiation was found between LES and FPS .

column1: Dopamine is not essential for the development of methamphetamine - induced neurotoxicity .

column1: It is widely believed that dopamine ( DA ) mediates methamphetamine ( METH ) - induced toxicity to brain dopaminergic neurons , because drugs that interfere with DA neurotransmission decrease toxicity , whereas drugs that increase DA neurotransmission enhance toxicity .
column2: It is widely believed that chem* dopamine *chem ( chem* DA *chem ) mediates chem* methamphetamine *chem ( chem* METH *chem ) - induced toxicity to brain dopaminergic neurons , because drugs that interfere with chem* DA *chem neurotransmission decrease toxicity , whereas drugs that increase chem* DA *chem neurotransmission enhance toxicity .

column1: However , temperature effects of drugs that have been used to manipulate brain DA neurotransmission confound interpretation of the data .
column2: However , temperature effects of drugs that have been used to manipulate brain chem* DA *chem neurotransmission confound interpretation of the data .

column1: Here we show that the recently reported ability of L - dihydroxyphenylalanine to reverse the protective effect of alpha - methyl - para - tyrosine on METH - induced DA neurotoxicity is also confounded by drug effects on body temperature .
column2: Here we show that the recently reported ability of chem* L - dihydroxyphenylalanine *chem to reverse the protective effect of chem* alpha - methyl - para - tyrosine *chem on chem* METH *chem - induced chem* DA *chem neurotoxicity is also confounded by drug effects on body temperature .

column1: Further , we show that mice genetically engineered to be deficient in brain DA develop METH neurotoxicity , as long as the thermic effects of METH are preserved .
column2: Further , we show that mice genetically engineered to be deficient in brain chem* DA *chem develop chem* METH *chem neurotoxicity , as long as the thermic effects of chem* METH *chem are preserved .

column1: In addition , we demonstrate that mice genetically engineered to have unilateral brain DA deficits develop METH - induced dopaminergic deficits that are of comparable magnitude on both sides of the brain .
column2: In addition , we demonstrate that mice genetically engineered to have unilateral brain chem* DA *chem deficits develop chem* METH *chem - induced dopaminergic deficits that are of comparable magnitude on both sides of the brain .

column1: Taken together , these findings demonstrate that DA is not essential for the development of METH - induced dopaminergic neurotoxicity and suggest that mechanisms independent of DA warrant more intense investigation .
column2: Taken together , these findings demonstrate that chem* DA *chem is not essential for the development of chem* METH *chem - induced dopaminergic neurotoxicity and suggest that mechanisms independent of chem* DA *chem warrant more intense investigation .

column1: CASE : A 49 - year - old patient experienced chest discomfort while swallowing .

column2: On electrocardiogram , episodes of atrial tachyarrhythmia were recorded immediately after swallowing ; 24 - hour Holter monitoring recorded several events .

column1: The patient noticed that before these episodes he had been using an inhalator of salbutamol .
column2: The patient noticed that before these episodes he had been using an inhalator of chem* salbutamol *chem .

column1: After stopping the beta - agonist , and after a week with the atenolol , the arrhythmia disappeared .

column1: DISCUSSION : Swallowing - induced atrial tachyarrhythmia ( SIAT ) is a rare phenomenon .
column2: DISCUSSION : Swallowing - induced atrial tachyarrhythmia ( SIAT ) is a rare phenomenon .

column1: Fewer than 50 cases of SIAT have been described in the literature .
column2: Fewer than 50 cases of SIAT have been described in the literature .

column1: This article summarizes all the cases published , creating a comprehensive review of the current knowledge and approach to SIAT .
column2: This article summarizes all the cases published , creating a comprehensive review of the current knowledge and approach to SIAT .

column1: It discusses demographics , clinical characteristics and types of arrhythmia , postulated mechanisms of SIAT , and different treatment possibilities such as medications , surgery , and radiofrequency catheter ablation ( RFCA ) .
column2: It discusses demographics , clinical characteristics and types of arrhythmia , postulated mechanisms of SIAT , and different treatment possibilities such as medications , surgery , and radiofrequency catheter ablation ( RFCA ) .

column1: Although it is difficult to define causality in a case report , it is logical to think that a beta - agonist like salbutamol ( known to induce tachycardia ) may be the trigger of adrenergic reflexes originating in the esophagus while swallowing and that a beta - blocker such as atenolol ( that blocks the adrenergic activity ) may relieve it .

column2: To our knowledge and after reviewing the literature there is one case report of myxedema coma during long term chem* amiodarone *chem therapy .

column1: Myxedema coma is a life threatening condition that carries a mortality reaching as high as 20 % with treatment .

column1: The condition is treated with intravenous thyroxine ( T4 ) or intravenous tri - iodo - thyronine ( T3 ) .

column2: METHOD : Using five tagging SNPs ( rs6693503 , rs1805054 , rs4912138 , rs3790757 and rs9659997 ) , we conducted a genetic association analysis of case - control samples ( 197 chem* METH *chem - induced psychosis patients and 337 controls ) in the Japanese population .

column1: The age and sex of the control subjects did not differ from those of the methamphetamine dependence patients .
column2: The age and sex of the control subjects did not differ from those of the chem* methamphetamine *chem dependence patients .

column1: RESULTS : rs6693503 was associated with METH - induced psychosis patients in the allele / genotype - wise analysis .
column2: RESULTS : rs6693503 was associated with chem* METH *chem - induced psychosis patients in the allele / genotype - wise analysis .

column1: Moreover , this association remained significant after Bonferroni correction .
column2: Moreover , this association remained significant after Bonferroni correction .

column1: In the haplotype - wise analysis , we detected an association between two markers ( rs6693503 and rs1805054 ) and three markers ( rs6693503 , rs1805054 and rs4912138 ) in HTR6 and METH - induced psychosis patients , respectively .
column2: In the haplotype - wise analysis , we detected an association between two markers ( rs6693503 and rs1805054 ) and three markers ( rs6693503 , rs1805054 and rs4912138 ) in HTR6 and chem* METH *chem - induced psychosis patients , respectively .

column1: CONCLUSION : HTR6 may play an important role in the pathophysiology of METH - induced psychosis in the Japanese population .
column2: CONCLUSION : HTR6 may play an important role in the pathophysiology of chem* METH *chem - induced psychosis in the Japanese population .

column1: Neural correlates of S - ketamine induced psychosis during overt continuous verbal fluency .

column1: The glutamatergic N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) receptor has been implicated in the pathophysiology of schizophrenia .
column2: The glutamatergic chem* N - methyl - D - aspartate *chem ( chem* NMDA *chem ) receptor has been implicated in the pathophysiology of schizophrenia .

column1: Administered to healthy volunteers , a subanesthetic dose of the non - competitive NMDA receptor antagonist ketamine leads to psychopathological symptoms similar to those observed in schizophrenia .
column2: Administered to healthy volunteers , a subanesthetic dose of the non - competitive chem* NMDA *chem receptor antagonist chem* ketamine *chem leads to psychopathological symptoms similar to those observed in schizophrenia .

column1: In patients with schizophrenia , ketamine exacerbates the core symptoms of illness , supporting the hypothesis of a glutamatergic dysfunction .
column2: In patients with schizophrenia , chem* ketamine *chem exacerbates the core symptoms of illness , supporting the hypothesis of a glutamatergic dysfunction .

column1: In a counterbalanced , placebo - controlled , double - blind study design , healthy subjects were administered a continuous subanesthetic S - ketamine infusion while differences in BOLD responses measured with fMRI were detected .
column2: In a counterbalanced , placebo - controlled , double - blind study design , healthy subjects were administered a continuous subanesthetic chem* S - ketamine *chem infusion while differences in BOLD responses measured with fMRI were detected .

column1: During the scanning period , subjects performed continuous overt verbal fluency tasks ( phonological , lexical and semantic ) .
column2: During the scanning period , subjects performed continuous overt verbal fluency tasks ( phonological , lexical and semantic ) .

column1: Ketamine - induced psychopathological symptoms were assessed with the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale ( PANSS ) .
column2: chem* Ketamine *chem - induced psychopathological symptoms were assessed with the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale ( PANSS ) .

column1: Ketamine elicited psychosis like psychopathology .
column2: chem* Ketamine *chem elicited psychosis like psychopathology .

column1: Post - hoc t - tests revealed significant differences between placebo and ketamine for the amounts of words generated during lexical and semantic verbal fluency , while the phonological domain remained unaffected .
column2: Post - hoc t - tests revealed significant differences between placebo and chem* ketamine *chem for the amounts of words generated during lexical and semantic verbal fluency , while the phonological domain remained unaffected .

column1: Ketamine led to enhanced cortical activations in supramarginal and frontal brain regions for phonological and lexical verbal fluency , but not for semantic verbal fluency .
column2: chem* Ketamine *chem led to enhanced cortical activations in supramarginal and frontal brain regions for phonological and lexical verbal fluency , but not for semantic verbal fluency .

column1: Ketamine induces activation changes in healthy subjects similar to those observed in patients with schizophrenia , particularly in frontal and temporal brain regions .
column2: chem* Ketamine *chem induces activation changes in healthy subjects similar to those observed in patients with schizophrenia , particularly in frontal and temporal brain regions .

column1: Our results provide further support for the hypothesis of an NMDA receptor dysfunction in the pathophysiology of schizophrenia .
column2: Our results provide further support for the hypothesis of an chem* NMDA *chem receptor dysfunction in the pathophysiology of schizophrenia .

column1: Long - term prognosis for transplant - free survivors of paracetamol - induced acute liver failure .
column2: Long - term prognosis for transplant - free survivors of chem* paracetamol *chem - induced acute liver failure .

column1: BACKGROUND : The prognosis for transplant - free survivors of paracetamol - induced acute liver failure remains unknown .
column2: BACKGROUND : The prognosis for transplant - free survivors of chem* paracetamol *chem - induced acute liver failure remains unknown .

column1: AIM : To examine whether paracetamol - induced acute liver failure increases long - term mortality .
column2: AIM : To examine whether chem* paracetamol *chem - induced acute liver failure increases long - term mortality .

column1: METHODS : We followed up all transplant - free survivors of paracetamol - induced acute liver injury , hospitalized in a Danish national referral centre during 1984 - 2004 .
column2: METHODS : We followed up all transplant - free survivors of chem* paracetamol *chem - induced acute liver injury , hospitalized in a Danish national referral centre during 1984 - 2004 .

column1: We compared age - specific mortality rates from 1 year post - discharge through 2008 between those in whom the liver injury led to an acute liver failure and those in whom it did not .
column2: We compared age - specific mortality rates from 1 year post - discharge through 2008 between those in whom the liver injury led to an acute liver failure and those in whom it did not .

column1: RESULTS : We included 641 patients .
column2: RESULTS : We included 641 patients .

column1: On average , age - specific mortality rates were slightly higher for the 101 patients whose paracetamol - induced liver injury had caused an acute liver failure ( adjusted mortality rate ratio = 1 . 70 , 95 % CI 1 . 02 - 2 . 85 ) , but the association was age - dependent , and no survivors of acute liver failure died of liver disease , whereas suicides were frequent in both groups .
column2: On average , age - specific mortality rates were slightly higher for the 101 patients whose chem* paracetamol *chem - induced liver injury had caused an acute liver failure ( adjusted mortality rate ratio = 1 . 70 , 95 % CI 1 . 02 - 2 . 85 ) , but the association was age - dependent , and no survivors of acute liver failure died of liver disease , whereas suicides were frequent in both groups .

column1: These observations speak against long - term effects of acute liver failure .
column2: These observations speak against long - term effects of acute liver failure .

column1: More likely , the elevated mortality rate ratio resulted from incomplete adjustment for the greater prevalence of substance abuse among survivors of acute liver failure .
column2: More likely , the elevated mortality rate ratio resulted from incomplete adjustment for the greater prevalence of substance abuse among survivors of acute liver failure .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Paracetamol - induced acute liver failure did not affect long - term mortality .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* Paracetamol *chem - induced acute liver failure did not affect long - term mortality .

column1: Clinical follow - up may be justified by the cause of the liver failure , but not by the liver failure itself .
column2: Clinical follow - up may be justified by the cause of the liver failure , but not by the liver failure itself .

column1: In vivo characterization of a dual adenosine A2A / A1 receptor antagonist in animal models of Parkinson ' s disease .
column2: In vivo characterization of a dual chem* adenosine A2A / A1 receptor antagonist *chem in animal models of Parkinson ' s disease .

column2: The in vivo characterization of a dual chem* adenosine A ( 2A ) / A ( 1 ) receptor antagonist *chem in several animal models of Parkinson ' s disease is described .

column1: Discovery and scale - up syntheses of compound 1 are described in detail , highlighting optimization steps that increased the overall yield of 1 from 10 . 0 % to 30 . 5 % .
column2: Discovery and scale - up syntheses of compound 1 are described in detail , highlighting optimization steps that increased the overall yield of 1 from 10 . 0 % to 30 . 5 % .

column1: Compound 1 is a potent A ( 2A ) / A ( 1 ) receptor antagonist in vitro ( A ( 2A ) K ( i ) = 4 . 1 nM ; A ( 1 ) K ( i ) = 17 . 0 nM ) that has excellent activity , after oral administration , across a number of animal models of Parkinson ' s disease including mouse and rat models of haloperidol - induced catalepsy , mouse model of reserpine - induced akinesia , rat 6 - hydroxydopamine ( 6 - OHDA ) lesion model of drug - induced rotation , and MPTP - treated non - human primate model .
column2: Compound 1 is a potent A ( 2A ) / A ( 1 ) receptor antagonist in vitro ( A ( 2A ) K ( i ) = 4 . 1 nM ; A ( 1 ) K ( i ) = 17 . 0 nM ) that has excellent activity , after oral administration , across a number of animal models of Parkinson ' s disease including mouse and rat models of chem* haloperidol *chem - induced catalepsy , mouse model of chem* reserpine *chem - induced akinesia , rat chem* 6 - hydroxydopamine *chem ( chem* 6 - OHDA *chem ) lesion model of drug - induced rotation , and chem* MPTP *chem - treated non - human primate model .

column1: Effects of the hippocampal deep brain stimulation on cortical epileptic discharges in penicillin - induced epilepsy model in rats .
column2: Effects of the hippocampal deep brain stimulation on cortical epileptic discharges in chem* penicillin *chem - induced epilepsy model in rats .

column1: AIM : Experimental and clinical studies have revealed that hippocampal DBS can control epileptic activity , but the mechanism of action is obscure and optimal stimulation parameters are not clearly defined .
column2: AIM : Experimental and clinical studies have revealed that hippocampal DBS can control epileptic activity , but the mechanism of action is obscure and optimal stimulation parameters are not clearly defined .

column1: The aim was to evaluate the effects of high frequency hippocampal stimulation on cortical epileptic activity in penicillin - induced epilepsy model .
column2: The aim was to evaluate the effects of high frequency hippocampal stimulation on cortical epileptic activity in chem* penicillin *chem - induced epilepsy model .

column1: MATERIAL AND METHODS : Twenty - five Sprague - Dawley rats were implanted DBS electrodes .
column2: MATERIAL AND METHODS : Twenty - five Sprague - Dawley rats were implanted DBS electrodes .

column1: In group - 1 ( n = 10 ) hippocampal DBS was off and in the group - 2 ( n = 10 ) hippocampal DBS was on ( 185 Hz , 0 . 5V , 1V , 2V , and 5V for 60 sec ) following penicillin G injection intracortically .
column2: In group - 1 ( n = 10 ) hippocampal DBS was off and in the group - 2 ( n = 10 ) hippocampal DBS was on ( 185 Hz , 0 . 5V , 1V , 2V , and 5V for 60 sec ) following chem* penicillin G *chem injection intracortically .

column1: In the control group hippocampal DBS was on following 8 l saline injection intracortically .
column2: In the control group hippocampal DBS was on following 8 l saline injection intracortically .

column1: EEG recordings were obtained before and 15 minutes following penicillin - G injection , and at 10th minutes following each stimulus for analysis in terms of frequency , amplitude , and power spectrum .
column2: EEG recordings were obtained before and 15 minutes following chem* penicillin - G *chem injection , and at 10th minutes following each stimulus for analysis in terms of frequency , amplitude , and power spectrum .

column1: RESULTS : High frequency hippocampal DBS suppressed the acute penicillin - induced cortical epileptic activity independent from stimulus intensity .
column2: RESULTS : High frequency hippocampal DBS suppressed the acute chem* penicillin *chem - induced cortical epileptic activity independent from stimulus intensity .

column1: In the control group , hippocampal stimulation alone lead only to diffuse slowing of cerebral bioelectrical activity at 5V stimulation .
column2: In the control group , hippocampal stimulation alone lead only to diffuse slowing of cerebral bioelectrical activity at 5V stimulation .

column1: CONCLUSION : Our results revealed that continuous high frequency stimulation of the hippocampus suppressed acute cortical epileptic activity effectively without causing secondary epileptic discharges .
column2: CONCLUSION : Our results revealed that continuous high frequency stimulation of the hippocampus suppressed acute cortical epileptic activity effectively without causing secondary epileptic discharges .

column1: These results are important in terms of defining the optimal parameters of hippocampal DBS in patients with epilepsy .
column2: These results are important in terms of defining the optimal parameters of hippocampal DBS in patients with epilepsy .

column1: CCNU ( lomustine ) toxicity in dogs : a retrospective study ( 2002 - 07 ) .
column2: chem* CCNU *chem ( chem* lomustine *chem ) toxicity in dogs : a retrospective study ( 2002 - 07 ) .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To describe the incidence of haematological , renal , hepatic and gastrointestinal toxicities in tumour - bearing dogs receiving 1 - ( 2 - chloroethyl ) - 3 - cyclohexyl - 1 - nitrosourea ( CCNU ) .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To describe the incidence of haematological , renal , hepatic and gastrointestinal toxicities in tumour - bearing dogs receiving chem* 1 - ( 2 - chloroethyl ) - 3 - cyclohexyl - 1 - nitrosourea *chem ( chem* CCNU *chem ) .

column1: DESIGN : The medical records of 206 dogs that were treated with CCNU at the Melbourne Veterinary Specialist Centre between February 2002 and December 2007 were retrospectively evaluated .
column2: DESIGN : The medical records of 206 dogs that were treated with chem* CCNU *chem at the Melbourne Veterinary Specialist Centre between February 2002 and December 2007 were retrospectively evaluated .

column1: RESULTS : Of the 206 dogs treated with CCNU , 185 met the inclusion criteria for at least one class of toxicity .
column2: RESULTS : Of the 206 dogs treated with chem* CCNU *chem , 185 met the inclusion criteria for at least one class of toxicity .

column1: CCNU was used most commonly in the treatment of lymphoma , mast cell tumour , brain tumour , histiocytic tumours and epitheliotropic lymphoma .
column2: chem* CCNU *chem was used most commonly in the treatment of lymphoma , mast cell tumour , brain tumour , histiocytic tumours and epitheliotropic lymphoma .

column1: Throughout treatment , 56 . 9 % of dogs experienced neutropenia , 34 . 2 % experienced anaemia and 14 . 2 % experienced thrombocytopenia .
column2: Throughout treatment , 56 . 9 % of dogs experienced neutropenia , 34 . 2 % experienced anaemia and 14 . 2 % experienced thrombocytopenia .

column1: Gastrointestinal toxicosis was detected in 37 . 8 % of dogs , the most common sign of which was vomiting ( 24 . 3 % ) .
column2: Gastrointestinal toxicosis was detected in 37 . 8 % of dogs , the most common sign of which was vomiting ( 24 . 3 % ) .

column1: Potential renal toxicity and elevated alanine transaminase ( ALT ) concentration were reported in 12 . 2 % and 48 . 8 % of dogs , respectively .
column2: Potential renal toxicity and elevated chem* alanine *chem transaminase ( ALT ) concentration were reported in 12 . 2 % and 48 . 8 % of dogs , respectively .

column1: The incidence of hepatic failure was 1 . 2 % .
column2: The incidence of hepatic failure was 1 . 2 % .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : CCNU - associated toxicity in dogs is common , but is usually not life threatening .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* CCNU *chem - associated toxicity in dogs is common , but is usually not life threatening .

column1: Central vein thrombosis and topical dipivalyl epinephrine .
column2: Central vein thrombosis and topical chem* dipivalyl epinephrine *chem .

column2: chem* Benzylacyclouridine *chem reverses chem* azidothymidine *chem - induced marrow suppression without impairment of anti - human immunodeficiency virus activity .

column1: Increased extracellular concentrations of uridine ( Urd ) have been reported to reduce , in vitro , azidothymidine ( AZT ) - induced inhibition of human granulocyte - macrophage progenitor cells without impairment of its antihuman immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) activity .
column2: Increased extracellular concentrations of chem* uridine *chem ( chem* Urd *chem ) have been reported to reduce , in vitro , chem* azidothymidine *chem ( chem* AZT *chem ) - induced inhibition of human granulocyte - macrophage progenitor cells without impairment of its antihuman immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) activity .

column1: Because of the clinical toxicities associated with chronic Urd administration , the ability of benzylacyclouridine ( BAU ) to effect , in vivo , AZT - induced anemia and leukopenia was assessed .
column2: Because of the clinical toxicities associated with chronic chem* Urd *chem administration , the ability of chem* benzylacyclouridine *chem ( chem* BAU *chem ) to effect , in vivo , chem* AZT *chem - induced anemia and leukopenia was assessed .

column2: This agent inhibits chem* Urd *chem catabolism and , in vivo , increases the plasma concentration of chem* Urd *chem in a dose - dependent manner , without chem* Urd *chem - related toxicity .

column1: In mice rendered anemic and leukopenic by the administration of AZT for 28 days in drinking water ( 1 . 5 mg / mL ) , the continued administration of AZT plus daily BAU ( 300 mg / kg , orally ) partially reversed AZT - induced anemia and leukopenia ( P less than . 05 ) , increased peripheral reticulocytes ( to 4 . 9 % , P less than . 01 ) , increased cellularity in the marrow , and improved megaloblastosis .
column2: In mice rendered anemic and leukopenic by the administration of chem* AZT *chem for 28 days in drinking water ( 1 . 5 mg / mL ) , the continued administration of chem* AZT *chem plus daily chem* BAU *chem ( 300 mg / kg , orally ) partially reversed chem* AZT *chem - induced anemia and leukopenia ( P less than . 05 ) , increased peripheral reticulocytes ( to 4 . 9 % , P less than . 01 ) , increased cellularity in the marrow , and improved megaloblastosis .

column2: When coadministered with chem* AZT *chem from the onset of drug administration , chem* BAU *chem reduced chem* AZT *chem - induced marrow toxicity .

column1: Lethal anuria complicating high dose ifosfamide chemotherapy in a breast cancer patient with an impaired renal function .
column2: Lethal anuria complicating high dose chem* ifosfamide *chem chemotherapy in a breast cancer patient with an impaired renal function .

column1: A sixty - year - old woman with advanced breast cancer , previously treated with cisplatin , developed an irreversible lethal renal failure with anuria , the day after 5 g / m2 bolus ifosfamide .
column2: A sixty - year - old woman with advanced breast cancer , previously treated with chem* cisplatin *chem , developed an irreversible lethal renal failure with anuria , the day after 5 g / m2 bolus chem* ifosfamide *chem .

column1: Postrenal failure was excluded by echography .
column2: Postrenal failure was excluded by echography .

column1: A prerenal component could have contributed to renal failure because of a transient hypotension , due to an increasing ascitis , occurring just before anuria .
column2: A prerenal component could have contributed to renal failure because of a transient hypotension , due to an increasing ascitis , occurring just before anuria .

column1: However , correction of the hemodynamic parameters did not improve renal function .
column2: However , correction of the hemodynamic parameters did not improve renal function .

column1: Ifosfamide is a known nephrotoxic drug with demonstrated tubulopathies .
column2: chem* Ifosfamide *chem is a known nephrotoxic drug with demonstrated tubulopathies .

column2: We strongly suspect that this lethal anuria was mainly due to chem* ifosfamide *chem , occurring in a patient having received previous chem* cisplatin *chem chemotherapy and with poor kidney perfusion due to transient hypotension .

column1: We recommend careful use of ifosfamide in patients pretreated with nephrotoxic chemotherapy and inadequate renal perfusion .
column2: We recommend careful use of chem* ifosfamide *chem in patients pretreated with nephrotoxic chemotherapy and inadequate renal perfusion .

column1: Nociceptive effects induced by intrathecal administration of prostaglandin D2 , E2 , or F2 alpha to conscious mice .
column2: Nociceptive effects induced by intrathecal administration of chem* prostaglandin D2 , E2 , or F2 alpha *chem to conscious mice .

column1: The effects of intrathecal administration of prostaglandins on pain responses in conscious mice were evaluated by using hot plate and acetic acid writhing tests .
column2: The effects of intrathecal administration of chem* prostaglandins *chem on pain responses in conscious mice were evaluated by using hot plate and chem* acetic acid *chem writhing tests .

column1: Prostaglandin D2 ( 0 . 5 - 3 ng / mouse ) had a hyperalgesic action on the response to a hot plate during a 3 - 60 min period after injection .
column2: chem* Prostaglandin D2 *chem ( 0 . 5 - 3 ng / mouse ) had a hyperalgesic action on the response to a hot plate during a 3 - 60 min period after injection .

column1: Prostaglandin E2 showed a hyperalgesic effect at doses of 1 pg to 10 ng / mouse , but the effect lasted shorter ( 3 - 30 min ) than that of prostaglandin D2 .
column2: chem* Prostaglandin E2 *chem showed a hyperalgesic effect at doses of 1 chem* pg *chem to 10 ng / mouse , but the effect lasted shorter ( 3 - 30 min ) than that of chem* prostaglandin D2 *chem .

column2: Similar results were obtained by chem* acetic acid *chem writhing tests .

column1: The hyperalgesic effect of prostaglandin D2 was blocked by simultaneous injection of a substance P antagonist ( greater than or equal to 100 ng ) but not by AH6809 , a prostanoid EP1 - receptor antagonist .
column2: The hyperalgesic effect of chem* prostaglandin D2 *chem was blocked by simultaneous injection of a substance P antagonist ( greater than or equal to 100 ng ) but not by chem* AH6809 *chem , a prostanoid EP1 - receptor antagonist .

column1: D - penicillamine in the treatment of localized scleroderma .
column2: chem* D - penicillamine *chem in the treatment of localized scleroderma .

column1: Localized scleroderma has no recognized internal organ involvement but may be disfiguring and disabling when the cutaneous lesions are extensive or affect children .
column2: Localized scleroderma has no recognized internal organ involvement but may be disfiguring and disabling when the cutaneous lesions are extensive or affect children .

column1: There is no accepted or proven treatment for localized scleroderma .
column2: There is no accepted or proven treatment for localized scleroderma .

column1: Case reports of 11 patients with severe , extensive localized scleroderma who were treated with D - penicillamine are summarized in this article .
column2: Case reports of 11 patients with severe , extensive localized scleroderma who were treated with chem* D - penicillamine *chem are summarized in this article .

column1: This drug was judged to have a favorable effect on the disease course in 7 ( 64 % ) of 11 patients .
column2: This drug was judged to have a favorable effect on the disease course in 7 ( 64 % ) of 11 patients .

column1: Improvement began within 3 to 6 months and consisted of cessation of active cutaneous lesions in all 7 patients , skin softening in 5 , and more normal growth of the affected limb in 2 of 3 children .
column2: Improvement began within 3 to 6 months and consisted of cessation of active cutaneous lesions in all 7 patients , skin softening in 5 , and more normal growth of the affected limb in 2 of 3 children .

column1: Joint stiffness and contractures also improved .
column2: Joint stiffness and contractures also improved .

column1: The dose of D - penicillamine associated with a favorable response was as low as 2 to 5 mg / kg per day given over a period ranging from 15 to 53 months .
column2: The dose of chem* D - penicillamine *chem associated with a favorable response was as low as 2 to 5 mg / kg per day given over a period ranging from 15 to 53 months .

column1: D - Penicillamine caused nephrotic syndrome in 1 patient and milder reversible proteinuria in 3 other patients ; none developed renal insufficiency .
column2: chem* D - Penicillamine *chem caused nephrotic syndrome in 1 patient and milder reversible proteinuria in 3 other patients ; none developed renal insufficiency .

column1: These data suggest that D - penicillamine may be effective in severe cases of localized scleroderma .

column1: Midline B3 serotonin nerves in rat medulla are involved in hypotensive effect of methyldopa .
column2: Midline B3 chem* serotonin *chem nerves in rat medulla are involved in hypotensive effect of chem* methyldopa *chem .

column1: Previous experiments in this laboratory have shown that microinjection of methyldopa onto the ventrolateral cells of the B3 serotonin neurons in the medulla elicits a hypotensive response mediated by a projection descending into the spinal cord .
column2: Previous experiments in this laboratory have shown that microinjection of chem* methyldopa *chem onto the ventrolateral cells of the B3 chem* serotonin *chem neurons in the medulla elicits a hypotensive response mediated by a projection descending into the spinal cord .

column1: In spontaneously hypertensive , stroke - prone rats , microinjection of methyldopa into the area of the midline B3 serotonin cell group in the ventral medulla caused a potent hypotension of 30 - 40 mm Hg , which was maximal 2 - 3 h after administration and was abolished by the serotonin neurotoxin 5 , 7 - dihydroxytryptamine ( 5 , 7 - DHT ) injected intracerebroventricularly .
column2: In spontaneously hypertensive , stroke - prone rats , microinjection of chem* methyldopa *chem into the area of the midline B3 chem* serotonin *chem cell group in the ventral medulla caused a potent hypotension of 30 - 40 mm Hg , which was maximal 2 - 3 h after administration and was abolished by the chem* serotonin *chem neurotoxin chem* 5 , 7 - dihydroxytryptamine *chem ( chem* 5 , 7 - DHT *chem ) injected intracerebroventricularly .

column1: However , intraspinal injection of 5 , 7 - DHT to produce a more selective lesion of only descending serotonin projections in the spinal cord did not affect this hypotension .

column1: Mechanisms of myocardial ischemia induced by epinephrine : comparison with exercise - induced ischemia .

column1: The role of epinephrine in eliciting myocardial ischemia was examined in patients with coronary artery disease .
column2: The role of chem* epinephrine *chem in eliciting myocardial ischemia was examined in patients with coronary artery disease .

column1: Objective signs of ischemia and factors increasing myocardial oxygen consumption were compared during epinephrine infusion and supine bicycle exercise .
column2: Objective signs of ischemia and factors increasing myocardial chem* oxygen *chem consumption were compared during chem* epinephrine *chem infusion and supine bicycle exercise .

column1: Both epinephrine and exercise produced myocardial ischemia as evidenced by ST segment depression and angina .
column2: Both chem* epinephrine *chem and exercise produced myocardial ischemia as evidenced by ST segment depression and angina .

column1: However , the mechanisms of myocardial ischemia induced by epinephrine were significantly different from those of exercise .
column2: However , the mechanisms of myocardial ischemia induced by chem* epinephrine *chem were significantly different from those of exercise .

column1: Exercise - induced myocardial ischemia was marked predominantly by increased heart rate and rate - pressure product with a minor contribution of end - diastolic volume , while epinephrine - induced ischemia was characterized by a marked increase in contractility and a less pronounced increase in heart rate and rate - pressure product .
column2: Exercise - induced myocardial ischemia was marked predominantly by increased heart rate and rate - pressure product with a minor contribution of end - diastolic volume , while chem* epinephrine *chem - induced ischemia was characterized by a marked increase in contractility and a less pronounced increase in heart rate and rate - pressure product .

column1: These findings indicate that ischemia produced by epinephrine , as may occur during states of emotional distress , has a mechanism distinct from that due to physical exertion .
column2: These findings indicate that ischemia produced by chem* epinephrine *chem , as may occur during states of emotional distress , has a mechanism distinct from that due to physical exertion .

column1: Respiratory failure rapidly ensued and both patients expired in spite of efforts at resuscitation .

column1: Experimental cyclosporine nephrotoxicity : risk of concomitant chemotherapy .
column2: Experimental chem* cyclosporine *chem nephrotoxicity : risk of concomitant chemotherapy .

column1: The role of cyclosporine ( CSA ) alone or in combination with various chemotherapeutics in the development of renal toxicity was evaluated in rats .
column2: The role of chem* cyclosporine *chem ( chem* CSA *chem ) alone or in combination with various chemotherapeutics in the development of renal toxicity was evaluated in rats .

column1: Administration of 20 mg / kg / day CSA for 4 weeks caused renal functional and structural changes similar to those reported in man .
column2: Administration of 20 mg / kg / day chem* CSA *chem for 4 weeks caused renal functional and structural changes similar to those reported in man .

column1: The combined administration of CSA and various chemotherapeutic drugs with a nephrotoxic potential , such as gentamicin ( at therapeutic doses ) , amphothericin B and ketoconazole , which are frequently used in immunosuppressed patients , did not aggravate the CSA induced toxicity in the rat model .
column2: The combined administration of chem* CSA *chem and various chemotherapeutic drugs with a nephrotoxic potential , such as chem* gentamicin *chem ( at therapeutic doses ) , chem* amphothericin B *chem and chem* ketoconazole *chem , which are frequently used in immunosuppressed patients , did not aggravate the chem* CSA *chem induced toxicity in the rat model .

column1: Gentamicin at toxic doses , however , increased CSA nephrotoxicity .
column2: chem* Gentamicin *chem at toxic doses , however , increased chem* CSA *chem nephrotoxicity .

column1: Thus , the nephrotoxicity induced by CSA has a different pathogenetic mechanism .
column2: Thus , the nephrotoxicity induced by chem* CSA *chem has a different pathogenetic mechanism .

column1: Diuretics , potassium and arrhythmias in hypertensive coronary disease .
column2: Diuretics , chem* potassium *chem and arrhythmias in hypertensive coronary disease .

column1: It has been proposed that modest changes in plasma potassium can alter the tendency towards cardiac arrhythmias .
column2: It has been proposed that modest changes in plasma chem* potassium *chem can alter the tendency towards cardiac arrhythmias .

column1: If this were so , patients with coronary artery disease might be especially susceptible .
column2: If this were so , patients with coronary artery disease might be especially susceptible .

column1: Thus , myocardial electrical excitability was measured in patients with mild essential hypertension and known coronary artery disease after 8 weeks of treatment with a potassium - conserving diuretic ( amiloride ) and a similar period on a potassium - losing diuretic ( chlorthalidone ) in a randomised study .
column2: Thus , myocardial electrical excitability was measured in patients with mild essential hypertension and known coronary artery disease after 8 weeks of treatment with a chem* potassium *chem - conserving diuretic ( chem* amiloride *chem ) and a similar period on a chem* potassium *chem - losing diuretic ( chem* chlorthalidone *chem ) in a randomised study .

column1: Plasma potassium concentrations were on average 1 mmol / L lower during the chlorthalidone phase compared to amiloride therapy .
column2: Plasma chem* potassium *chem concentrations were on average 1 mmol / L lower during the chem* chlorthalidone *chem phase compared to chem* amiloride *chem therapy .

column1: Blood pressure and volume states as assessed by bodyweight , plasma renin and noradrenaline ( norepinephrine ) concentrations were similar on the 2 regimens .
column2: Blood pressure and volume states as assessed by bodyweight , plasma renin and chem* noradrenaline *chem ( chem* norepinephrine *chem ) concentrations were similar on the 2 regimens .

column1: Compared to amiloride treatment , the chlorthalidone phase was associated with an increased frequency of ventricular ectopic beats ( 24 - hour Holter monitoring ) and a higher Lown grading , increased upslope and duration of the monophasic action potential , prolonged ventricular effective refractory period , and increased electrical instability during programmed ventricular stimulation .
column2: Compared to chem* amiloride *chem treatment , the chem* chlorthalidone *chem phase was associated with an increased frequency of ventricular ectopic beats ( 24 - hour Holter monitoring ) and a higher Lown grading , increased upslope and duration of the monophasic action potential , prolonged ventricular effective refractory period , and increased electrical instability during programmed ventricular stimulation .

column1: The above results indicate that because potassium - losing diuretic therapy can increase myocardial electrical excitability in patients with ischaemic heart disease , even minor falls in plasma potassium concentrations are probably best avoided in such patients .
column2: The above results indicate that because chem* potassium *chem - losing diuretic therapy can increase myocardial electrical excitability in patients with ischaemic heart disease , even minor falls in plasma chem* potassium *chem concentrations are probably best avoided in such patients .

column1: Transketolase abnormality in tolazamide - induced Wernicke ' s encephalopathy .

column1: We studied a thiamine - dependent enzyme , transketolase , from fibroblasts of a diabetic patient who developed Wernicke ' s encephalopathy when treated with tolazamide , in order to delineate if this patient also had transketolase abnormality [ high Km for thiamine pyrophosphate ( TPP ) ] , as previously reported in postalcoholic Wernicke - Korsakoff syndrome .

column1: In addition to this patient , we also studied this enzyme from three diabetic kindreds without any history of Wernicke ' s encephalopathy and from four normal controls .
column2: In addition to this patient , we also studied this enzyme from three diabetic kindreds without any history of Wernicke ' s encephalopathy and from four normal controls .

column1: We found that the above - mentioned patient and one of the diabetic kindreds with no history of Wernicke ' s encephalopathy had abnormal transketolase as determined by its Km for TPP .
column2: We found that the above - mentioned patient and one of the diabetic kindreds with no history of Wernicke ' s encephalopathy had abnormal transketolase as determined by its Km for chem* TPP *chem .

column1: These data suggest a similarity between postalcoholic Wernicke - Korsakoff syndrome and the patient with tolazamide - induced Wernicke ' s encephalopathy from the standpoint of transketolase abnormality .

column1: Effects of the novel compound aniracetam ( Ro 13 - 5057 ) upon impaired learning and memory in rodents .

column1: The effect of aniracetam ( Ro 13 - 5057 , 1 - anisoyl - 2 - pyrrolidinone ) was studied on various forms of experimentally impaired cognitive functions ( learning and memory ) in rodents and produced the following effects : ( 1 ) almost complete prevention of the incapacity to learn a discrete escape response in rats exposed to sublethal hypercapnia immediately before the acquisition session ; ( 2 ) partial ( rats ) or complete ( mice ) prevention of the scopolamine - induced short - term amnesia for a passive avoidance task ; ( 3 ) complete protection against amnesia for a passive avoidance task in rats submitted to electroconvulsive shock immediately after avoidance acquisition ; ( 4 ) prevention of the long - term retention - or retrieval - deficit for a passive avoidance task induced in rats and mice by chloramphenicol or cycloheximide administered immediately after acquisition ; ( 5 ) reversal , when administered as late as 1 h before the retention test , of the deficit in retention or retrieval of a passive avoidance task induced by cycloheximide injected 2 days previously ; ( 6 ) prevention of the deficit in the retrieval of an active avoidance task induced in mice by subconvulsant electroshock or hypercapnia applied immediately before retrieval testing ( 24 h after acquisition ) .
column2: The effect of chem* aniracetam *chem ( chem* Ro 13 - 5057 *chem , chem* 1 - anisoyl - 2 - pyrrolidinone *chem ) was studied on various forms of experimentally impaired cognitive functions ( learning and memory ) in rodents and produced the following effects : ( 1 ) almost complete prevention of the incapacity to learn a discrete escape response in rats exposed to sublethal hypercapnia immediately before the acquisition session ; ( 2 ) partial ( rats ) or complete ( mice ) prevention of the chem* scopolamine *chem - induced short - term amnesia for a passive avoidance task ; ( 3 ) complete protection against amnesia for a passive avoidance task in rats submitted to electroconvulsive shock immediately after avoidance acquisition ; ( 4 ) prevention of the long - term retention - or retrieval - deficit for a passive avoidance task induced in rats and mice by chem* chloramphenicol *chem or chem* cycloheximide *chem administered immediately after acquisition ; ( 5 ) reversal , when administered as late as 1 h before the retention test , of the deficit in retention or retrieval of a passive avoidance task induced by chem* cycloheximide *chem injected 2 days previously ; ( 6 ) prevention of the deficit in the retrieval of an active avoidance task induced in mice by subconvulsant electroshock or hypercapnia applied immediately before retrieval testing ( 24 h after acquisition ) .

column1: These improvements or normalizations of impaired cognitive functions were seen at oral aniracetam doses of 10 - 100 mg / kg .

column1: Generally , the dose - response curves were bell - shaped .

column2: The mechanisms underlying the activity of chem* aniracetam *chem and its ' therapeutic window ' are unknown .

column2: In normal rats , 2 / 6 rats given free chem* doxorubicin *chem ( chem* DX *chem ) ( 5 mg / kg ) died within one week , whereas all control animals and all rats having received free NP or DXNP survived .

column2: Rats treated by unloaded NP behaved as controls .

column1: Prostaglandin E2 - induced bladder hyperactivity in normal , conscious rats : involvement of tachykinins ?
column2: chem* Prostaglandin E2 *chem - induced bladder hyperactivity in normal , conscious rats : involvement of chem* tachykinins *chem ?

column1: In normal conscious rats investigated by continuous cystometry , intravesically instilled prostaglandin ( PG ) E2 facilitated micturition and increased basal intravesical pressure .
column2: In normal conscious rats investigated by continuous cystometry , intravesically instilled chem* prostaglandin ( PG ) E2 *chem facilitated micturition and increased basal intravesical pressure .

column1: The effect was attenuated by both the NK1 receptor selective antagonist RP 67 , 580 and the NK2 receptor selective antagonist SR 48 , 968 , given intra - arterially , suggesting that it was mediated by stimulation of both NK1 and NK2 receptors .
column2: The effect was attenuated by both the NK1 receptor selective antagonist chem* RP 67 , 580 *chem and the NK2 receptor selective antagonist chem* SR 48 , 968 *chem , given intra - arterially , suggesting that it was mediated by stimulation of both NK1 and NK2 receptors .

column1: Intra - arterially given PGE2 produced a distinct increase in bladder pressure before initiating a micturition reflex , indicating that the PG had a direct contractant effect on the detrusor smooth muscle .
column2: Intra - arterially given chem* PGE2 *chem produced a distinct increase in bladder pressure before initiating a micturition reflex , indicating that the chem* PG *chem had a direct contractant effect on the detrusor smooth muscle .

column1: The effect of intra - arterial PGE2 could not be blocked by intra - arterial RP 67 , 580 or SR 48 , 968 , which opens the possibility that the micturition reflex elicited by intra - arterial PGE2 was mediated by pathways other than the reflex initiated when the PG was given intravesically .
column2: The effect of intra - arterial chem* PGE2 *chem could not be blocked by intra - arterial chem* RP 67 , 580 *chem or chem* SR 48 , 968 *chem , which opens the possibility that the micturition reflex elicited by intra - arterial chem* PGE2 *chem was mediated by pathways other than the reflex initiated when the chem* PG *chem was given intravesically .

column1: The present results thus suggest that intra - arterial PGE2 , given near the bladder , may initiate micturition in the normal rat chiefly by directly contracting the smooth muscle of the detrusor .
column2: The present results thus suggest that intra - arterial chem* PGE2 *chem , given near the bladder , may initiate micturition in the normal rat chiefly by directly contracting the smooth muscle of the detrusor .

column1: However , when given intravesically , PGE2 may stimulate micturition by releasing tachykinins from nerves in and / or immediately below the urothelium .
column2: However , when given intravesically , chem* PGE2 *chem may stimulate micturition by releasing chem* tachykinins *chem from nerves in and / or immediately below the urothelium .

column1: These tachykinins , in turn , initiate a micturition reflex by stimulating NK1 and NK2 receptors .
column2: These chem* tachykinins *chem , in turn , initiate a micturition reflex by stimulating NK1 and NK2 receptors .

column1: Protective effect of misoprostol on indomethacin induced renal dysfunction in elderly patients .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To evaluate the possible protective effects of misoprostol on renal function in hospitalized elderly patients treated with indomethacin .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To evaluate the possible protective effects of chem* misoprostol *chem on renal function in hospitalized elderly patients treated with chem* indomethacin *chem .

column1: METHODS : Forty - five hospitalized elderly patients ( > 65 years old ) who required therapy with nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs ( NSAID ) were randomly assigned to receive either indomethacin , 150 mg / day ( Group A ) , or indomethacin 150 mg / day plus misoprostol at 0 . 6 mg / day ( Group B ) .
column2: METHODS : Forty - five hospitalized elderly patients ( > 65 years old ) who required therapy with nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs ( NSAID ) were randomly assigned to receive either chem* indomethacin *chem , 150 mg / day ( Group A ) , or chem* indomethacin *chem 150 mg / day plus chem* misoprostol *chem at 0 . 6 mg / day ( Group B ) .

column1: Laboratory variables of renal function [ serum creatinine , blood urea nitrogen ( BUN ) and electrolytes ] were evaluated before initiation of therapy and every 2 days , until termination of the study ( a period of at least 6 days ) .
column2: Laboratory variables of renal function [ serum chem* creatinine *chem , chem* blood urea nitrogen *chem ( chem* BUN *chem ) and electrolytes ] were evaluated before initiation of therapy and every 2 days , until termination of the study ( a period of at least 6 days ) .

column1: Response to treatment was estimated by the visual analog scale for severity of pain .
column2: Response to treatment was estimated by the visual analog scale for severity of pain .

column1: RESULTS : Forty - two patients completed the study , 22 in Group A and 20 in Group B .
column2: RESULTS : Forty - two patients completed the study , 22 in Group A and 20 in Group B .

column1: BUN and creatinine increased by > 50 % of baseline levels in 54 and 45 % of Group A patients , respectively , compared to only 20 and 10 % of Group B patients ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: chem* BUN *chem and chem* creatinine *chem increased by > 50 % of baseline levels in 54 and 45 % of Group A patients , respectively , compared to only 20 and 10 % of Group B patients ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: Potassium ( K ) increment of 0 . 6 mEq / l or more was observed in 50 % of Group A , but in only 15 % of Group B patients ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: chem* Potassium *chem ( chem* K *chem ) increment of 0 . 6 mEq / l or more was observed in 50 % of Group A , but in only 15 % of Group B patients ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: The mean increments in BUN , creatinine , and K were reduced by 63 , 80 , and 42 % , respectively , in Group B patients compared to Group A . Response to treatment did not differ significantly between the 2 groups .
column2: The mean increments in chem* BUN *chem , chem* creatinine *chem , and chem* K *chem were reduced by 63 , 80 , and 42 % , respectively , in Group B patients compared to Group A . Response to treatment did not differ significantly between the 2 groups .

column1: CONCLUSION : Hospitalized elderly patients are at risk for developing indomethacin related renal dysfunction .
column2: CONCLUSION : Hospitalized elderly patients are at risk for developing chem* indomethacin *chem related renal dysfunction .

column1: Cognitive deterioration from long - term abuse of dextromethorphan : a case report .
column2: Cognitive deterioration from long - term abuse of chem* dextromethorphan *chem : a case report .

column1: Dextromethorphan ( DM ) , the dextrorotatory isomer of 3 - hydroxy - N - methylmorphinan , is the main ingredient in a number of widely available , over - the - counter antitussives .
column2: chem* Dextromethorphan *chem ( chem* DM *chem ) , the dextrorotatory isomer of chem* 3 - hydroxy - N - methylmorphinan *chem , is the main ingredient in a number of widely available , over - the - counter antitussives .

column1: Initial studies ( Bornstein 1968 ) showed that it possessed no respiratory suppressant effects and no addiction liability .
column2: Initial studies ( Bornstein 1968 ) showed that it possessed no respiratory suppressant effects and no addiction liability .

column1: Subsequently , however , several articles reporting abuse of this drug have appeared in the literature .
column2: Subsequently , however , several articles reporting abuse of this drug have appeared in the literature .

column1: The drug is known to cause a variety of acute toxic effects , ranging from nausea , restlessness , insomnia , ataxia , slurred speech and nystagmus to mood changes , perceptual alterations , inattention , disorientation and aggressive behavior ( Rammer et al 1988 ; Katona and Watson 1986 ; Isbell and Fraser 1953 ; Devlin et al 1985 ; McCarthy 1971 ; Dodds and Revai 1967 ; Degkwitz 1964 ; Hildebrand et al 1989 ) .
column2: The drug is known to cause a variety of acute toxic effects , ranging from nausea , restlessness , insomnia , ataxia , slurred speech and nystagmus to mood changes , perceptual alterations , inattention , disorientation and aggressive behavior ( Rammer et al 1988 ; Katona and Watson 1986 ; Isbell and Fraser 1953 ; Devlin et al 1985 ; McCarthy 1971 ; Dodds and Revai 1967 ; Degkwitz 1964 ; Hildebrand et al 1989 ) .

column1: There have also been two reported fatalities from DM overdoses ( Fleming 1986 ) .
column2: There have also been two reported fatalities from chem* DM *chem overdoses ( Fleming 1986 ) .

column1: However , there are no reports describing the effects of chronic abuse .
column2: However , there are no reports describing the effects of chronic abuse .

column1: This report describes a case of cognitive deterioration resulting from prolonged use of DM .
column2: This report describes a case of cognitive deterioration resulting from prolonged use of chem* DM *chem .

column2: Left ventricular end - diastolic pressure fell from 11 . 5 + / - 1 . 4 ( mean + / - SE ) to 5 . 6 + / - 0 . 9 mm Hg ( P less than 0 . 001 ) and left ventricular end - diastolic volume fell from 100 + / - 17 to 82 + / - 12 ml / m2 ( P less than 0 . 01 ) 1 h after chem* ouabain *chem infusion was completed .

column2: We conclude that in patients with chronic coronary artery disease who are not in clinical congestive heart failure left ventricular end - diastolic volume falls after chem* ouabain *chem administration even when it is initially normal .

column1: Dexamethasone - induced ocular hypertension in perfusion - cultured human eyes .

column1: PURPOSE : Glucocorticoid administration can lead to the development of ocular hypertension and corticosteroid glaucoma in a subset of the population through a decrease in the aqueous humor outflow facility .
column2: PURPOSE : Glucocorticoid administration can lead to the development of ocular hypertension and corticosteroid glaucoma in a subset of the population through a decrease in the aqueous humor outflow facility .

column1: The purpose of this study was to determine whether glucocorticoid treatment can directly affect the outflow facility of isolated , perfusion - cultured human eyes .
column2: The purpose of this study was to determine whether glucocorticoid treatment can directly affect the outflow facility of isolated , perfusion - cultured human eyes .

column1: METHODS : The anterior segments of human donor eyes from regional eye banks were placed in a constant flow , variable pressure perfusion culture system .
column2: METHODS : The anterior segments of human donor eyes from regional eye banks were placed in a constant flow , variable pressure perfusion culture system .

column1: Paired eyes were perfused in serum - free media with or without 10 ( - 7 ) M dexamethasone for 12 days .
column2: Paired eyes were perfused in serum - free media with or without 10 ( - 7 ) M chem* dexamethasone *chem for 12 days .

column1: Intraocular pressure was monitored daily .
column2: Intraocular pressure was monitored daily .

column1: After incubation , the eyes were morphologically characterized by light microscopy , transmission and scanning electron microscopy , and scanning laser confocal microscopy .
column2: After incubation , the eyes were morphologically characterized by light microscopy , transmission and scanning electron microscopy , and scanning laser confocal microscopy .

column1: RESULTS : A significant increase in intraocular pressure developed in 13 of the 44 pairs of eyes perfused with dexamethasone with an average pressure rise of 17 . 5 + / - 3 . 8 mm Hg after 12 days of dexamethasone exposure .
column2: RESULTS : A significant increase in intraocular pressure developed in 13 of the 44 pairs of eyes perfused with chem* dexamethasone *chem with an average pressure rise of 17 . 5 + / - 3 . 8 mm Hg after 12 days of chem* dexamethasone *chem exposure .

column1: The contralateral control eyes , which did not receive dexamethasone , maintained a stable intraocular pressure during the same period .
column2: The contralateral control eyes , which did not receive chem* dexamethasone *chem , maintained a stable intraocular pressure during the same period .

column1: The outflow pathway of the untreated eyes appeared morphologically normal .
column2: The outflow pathway of the untreated eyes appeared morphologically normal .

column1: In contrast , the dexamethasone - treated hypertensive eyes had thickened trabecular beams , decreased intertrabecular spaces , thickened juxtacanalicular tissue , activated trabecular meshwork cells , and increased amounts of amorphogranular extracellular material , especially in the juxtacanalicular tissue and beneath the endothelial lining of the canal of Schlemm .
column2: In contrast , the chem* dexamethasone *chem - treated hypertensive eyes had thickened trabecular beams , decreased intertrabecular spaces , thickened juxtacanalicular tissue , activated trabecular meshwork cells , and increased amounts of amorphogranular extracellular material , especially in the juxtacanalicular tissue and beneath the endothelial lining of the canal of Schlemm .

column2: The chem* dexamethasone *chem - treated nonresponder eyes appeared to be morphologically similar to the untreated eyes , although several subtle chem* dexamethasone *chem - induced morphologic changes were evident .

column1: CONCLUSION : Dexamethasone treatment of isolated , perfusion - cultured human eyes led to the generation of ocular hypertension in approximately 30 % of the dexamethasone - treated eyes .

column1: From Days 9 to 25 , subjects were randomly assigned to either sertraline ( 12 subjects ) or placebo ( 12 subjects ) ; the sertraline dose was titrated from 50 to 200 mg / day from Days 9 to 16 , and remained at 200 mg / day for the final 10 days of the drug administration period .

column1: Recently , we demonstrated the hepatoprotective effects of nicotinic acid amide , a selective inhibitor of poly ( ADP - ribose ) polymerase ( PARP ; EC 2 . 4 . 2 . 30 ) on mice suffering from acetaminophen ( AAP ) - hepatitis , suggesting that the AAP - induced liver injury involves a step which depends on adenoribosylation .

column1: Our results provide evidence that the AAP - induced hepatitis and its exacerbation by ethanol can either be reduced by end - product inhibition of PARP by NAA or by dietary depletion of the enzyme ' s substrate NAD .

column2: Maximal chem* CS *chem - mediated protection was observed in experimental animals pretreated 24 h prior to the toxic insult .

column1: These data suggest that CS intervenes in a critical cellular event that is an important common pathway to toxic cell death .
column2: These data suggest that chem* CS *chem intervenes in a critical cellular event that is an important common pathway to toxic cell death .

column1: The mechanism of CS protection does not appear to be dependent on the inhibition of chemical bioactivation to a toxic reactive intermediate ( in light of the protection observed against galactosamine hepatotoxicity ) .
column2: The mechanism of chem* CS *chem protection does not appear to be dependent on the inhibition of chemical bioactivation to a toxic reactive intermediate ( in light of the protection observed against chem* galactosamine *chem hepatotoxicity ) .

column1: However , based on the data presented , we can not exclude the possibility that CS administration inhibits chemical bioactivation .
column2: However , based on the data presented , we can not exclude the possibility that chem* CS *chem administration inhibits chemical bioactivation .

column1: Our findings do suggest that CS - mediated protection is dependent on the action of the intact anionic CS molecule ( non - hydrolyzable CSE was as protective as CS ) , whose mechanism has yet to be defined .
column2: Our findings do suggest that chem* CS *chem - mediated protection is dependent on the action of the intact anionic chem* CS *chem molecule ( non - hydrolyzable chem* CSE *chem was as protective as chem* CS *chem ) , whose mechanism has yet to be defined .

column1: A murine model of adenomyosis : the effects of hyperprolactinemia induced by fluoxetine hydrochloride , a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor , on adenomyosis induction in Wistar albino rats .
column2: A murine model of adenomyosis : the effects of hyperprolactinemia induced by chem* fluoxetine hydrochloride *chem , a selective chem* serotonin *chem reuptake inhibitor , on adenomyosis induction in Wistar albino rats .

column1: OBJECTIVE : The aim of this study was to investigate whether fluoxetine given to castrated and noncastrated rats caused hyperprolactinemia and its effects with respect to adenomyosis .
column2: OBJECTIVE : The aim of this study was to investigate whether chem* fluoxetine *chem given to castrated and noncastrated rats caused hyperprolactinemia and its effects with respect to adenomyosis .

column1: DESIGN : Fluoxetine , a serotonin reuptake inhibitor , was given to Wistar Albino rats for 98 days to produce hyperprolactinemia .
column2: DESIGN : chem* Fluoxetine *chem , a chem* serotonin *chem reuptake inhibitor , was given to Wistar Albino rats for 98 days to produce hyperprolactinemia .

column1: The drug was given to two groups consisting of castrated and noncastrated rats and compared to two groups of castrated and noncastrated controls .
column2: The drug was given to two groups consisting of castrated and noncastrated rats and compared to two groups of castrated and noncastrated controls .

column1: Prolactin levels were measured and the uteri of the rats were removed for histopathological analysis at the end of 98 days .
column2: Prolactin levels were measured and the uteri of the rats were removed for histopathological analysis at the end of 98 days .

column1: SETTING : Marmara University School of Medicine , Department of Histology and Embryology , Zeynep Kamil Women and Children ' s Hospital .
column2: SETTING : Marmara University School of Medicine , Department of Histology and Embryology , Zeynep Kamil Women and Children ' s Hospital .

column1: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES : Serum prolactin levels , uterine histopathology .
column2: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES : Serum prolactin levels , uterine histopathology .

column1: RESULTS : The prolactin levels of castrated and noncastrated groups treated with fluoxetine were statistically significantly higher when compared to their respective control groups .
column2: RESULTS : The prolactin levels of castrated and noncastrated groups treated with chem* fluoxetine *chem were statistically significantly higher when compared to their respective control groups .

column1: Histological studies revealed 11 cases of adenomyosis , all within the noncastrated group receiving fluoxetine .
column2: Histological studies revealed 11 cases of adenomyosis , all within the noncastrated group receiving chem* fluoxetine *chem .

column1: CONCLUSION : It was suggested that high serum prolactin levels cause degeneration of myometrial cells in the presence of ovarian steroids that results in a myometrial invasion by endometrial stroma .
column2: CONCLUSION : It was suggested that high serum prolactin levels cause degeneration of myometrial cells in the presence of ovarian chem* steroids *chem that results in a myometrial invasion by endometrial stroma .

column1: This invasion eventually progresses to adenomyosis .

column1: Neuroactive steroids protect against pilocarpine - and kainic acid - induced limbic seizures and status epilepticus in mice .
column2: Neuroactive chem* steroids *chem protect against chem* pilocarpine *chem - and chem* kainic acid *chem - induced limbic seizures and status epilepticus in mice .

column1: Several structurally related metabolites of progesterone ( 3 alpha - hydroxy pregnane - 20 - ones ) and deoxycorticosterone ( 3 alpha - hydroxy pregnane - 21 - diol - 20 - ones ) and their 3 beta - epimers were evaluated for protective activity against pilocarpine - , kainic acid - and N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) - induced seizures in mice .
column2: Several structurally related metabolites of chem* progesterone *chem ( chem* 3 alpha - hydroxy pregnane - 20 - ones *chem ) and chem* deoxycorticosterone *chem ( chem* 3 alpha - hydroxy pregnane - 21 - diol - 20 - ones *chem ) and their 3 beta - epimers were evaluated for protective activity against chem* pilocarpine *chem - , chem* kainic acid *chem - and chem* N - methyl - D - aspartate *chem ( chem* NMDA *chem ) - induced seizures in mice .

column1: Steroids with the 3 - hydroxy group in the alpha - position and 5 - H in the alpha - or beta - configurations were highly effective in protecting against pilocarpine ( 416 mg / kg , s . c . ) - induced limbic motor seizures and status epilepticus ( ED50 values , 7 . 0 - 18 . 7 mg / kg , i . p . ) .
column2: chem* Steroids *chem with the 3 - hydroxy group in the alpha - position and 5 - H in the alpha - or beta - configurations were highly effective in protecting against chem* pilocarpine *chem ( 416 mg / kg , s . c . ) - induced limbic motor seizures and status epilepticus ( ED50 values , 7 . 0 - 18 . 7 mg / kg , i . p . ) .

column1: The corresponding epimers with the 3 - hydroxy group in the beta - position were also effective but less potent ( ED50 values , 33 . 8 - 63 . 5 , i . p . ) .
column2: The corresponding epimers with the 3 - hydroxy group in the beta - position were also effective but less potent ( ED50 values , 33 . 8 - 63 . 5 , i . p . ) .

column1: Although the neuroactive steroids were considerably less potent than the benzodiazepine clonazepam in protecting against pilocarpine seizures , steroids with the 5 alpha , 3 alpha - configuration had comparable or higher protective index values ( TD50 for motor impairment divided by ED50 for seizure protection ) than clonazepam , indicating that some neuroactive steroids may have lower relative toxicity .
column2: Although the neuroactive chem* steroids *chem were considerably less potent than the chem* benzodiazepine chem* clonazepam *chem in protecting against chem* pilocarpine *chem seizures , chem* steroids *chem with the 5 alpha , 3 alpha - configuration had comparable or higher protective index values ( TD50 for motor impairment divided by ED50 for seizure protection ) than chem* clonazepam *chem , indicating that some neuroactive chem* steroids *chem may have lower relative toxicity .

column1: Steroids with the 5 alpha , 3 alpha - or 5 beta , 3 alpha - configurations also produced a dose - dependent delay in the onset of limbic seizures induced by kainic acid ( 32 mg / kg , s . c . ) , but did not completely protect against the seizures .
column2: chem* Steroids *chem with the 5 alpha , 3 alpha - or 5 beta , 3 alpha - configurations also produced a dose - dependent delay in the onset of limbic seizures induced by chem* kainic acid *chem ( 32 mg / kg , s . c . ) , but did not completely protect against the seizures .

column1: However , when a second dose of the steroid was administered 1 hr after the first dose , complete protection from the kainic acid - induced limbic seizures and status epilepticus was obtained .
column2: However , when a second dose of the chem* steroid *chem was administered 1 hr after the first dose , complete protection from the chem* kainic acid *chem - induced limbic seizures and status epilepticus was obtained .

column1: The steroids also caused a dose - dependent delay in NMDA ( 257 mg / kg , s . c . ) - induced lethality , but did not completely protect against NMDA seizures or lethality .
column2: The chem* steroids *chem also caused a dose - dependent delay in chem* NMDA *chem ( 257 mg / kg , s . c . ) - induced lethality , but did not completely protect against chem* NMDA *chem seizures or lethality .

column1: We conclude that neuroactive steroids are highly effective in protecting against pilocarpine - and kainic acid - induced seizures and status epilepticus in mice , and may be of utility in the treatment of some forms of status epilepticus in humans .
column2: We conclude that neuroactive chem* steroids *chem are highly effective in protecting against chem* pilocarpine *chem - and chem* kainic acid *chem - induced seizures and status epilepticus in mice , and may be of utility in the treatment of some forms of status epilepticus in humans .

column1: The attenuating effect of carteolol hydrochloride , a beta - adrenoceptor antagonist , on neuroleptic - induced catalepsy in rats .
column2: The attenuating effect of chem* carteolol hydrochloride *chem , a beta - adrenoceptor antagonist , on neuroleptic - induced catalepsy in rats .

column2: It is known that beta - adrenoceptor antagonists are effective in the treatment of akathisia , one of the extrapyramidal side effects that occur during neuroleptic treatment .

column1: Neuroleptic - induced catalepsy , a model of neuroleptic - induced extrapyramidal side effects , was considered suitable as a model for predicting neuroleptic - induced akathisia in humans , although neuroleptic - induced catalepsy was not considered a specific test for neuroleptic - induced akathisia .
column2: Neuroleptic - induced catalepsy , a model of neuroleptic - induced extrapyramidal side effects , was considered suitable as a model for predicting neuroleptic - induced akathisia in humans , although neuroleptic - induced catalepsy was not considered a specific test for neuroleptic - induced akathisia .

column1: Therefore , the effects of carteolol , a beta - adrenoceptor antagonist , on haloperidol - induced catalepsy in rats were behaviorally studied and compared with those of propranolol and biperiden , a muscarinic receptor antagonist .

column1: Finally , carteolol did not inhibit physostigmine - induced lethality in rats .
column2: Finally , chem* carteolol *chem did not inhibit chem* physostigmine *chem - induced lethality in rats .

column1: These results strongly suggest that carteolol improves haloperidol - induced catalepsy via its beta - adrenoceptor antagonistic activity and is expected to be effective in the treatment of akathisia without attenuating neuroleptic - induced antipsychotic effects due to its postsynaptic dopamine receptor antagonistic activity .

column1: To elucidate the role of estrogen in the regulation of tumor angiogenesis in the pituitary of female rats , the density of blood vessels was analysed using factor VIII related antigen ( FVIIIRAg ) immunohistochemistry and the expression of vascular endothelial growth factor / vascular permeability factor ( VEGF / VPF ) was examined by Western blot and immunohistochemical analysis .

column2: In addition , chem* NIK - 247 *chem and chem* tacrine *chem , but not chem* E - 2020 *chem , strongly inhibited butyrylcholinestrase ( BuChE ) in human serum .

column1: All three drugs produced mixed inhibition of AChE activity .

column1: Moreover , the inhibitory effect of NIK - 247 on AChE was reversible .
column2: Moreover , the inhibitory effect of chem* NIK - 247 *chem on AChE was reversible .

column1: All compounds at 0 . 1 - 1 mg / kg p . o . significantly improved the amnesia induced by scopolamine ( 0 . 5 mg / kg s . c . ) in rats performing a passive avoidance task .
