column1: Potential therapeutic use of the selective dopamine D1 receptor agonist , A - 86929 : an acute study in parkinsonian levodopa - primed monkeys .
column2: Potential therapeutic use of the selective chem* dopamine *chem D1 receptor agonist , chem* A - 86929 *chem : an acute study in parkinsonian chem* levodopa *chem - primed monkeys .

column1: The clinical utility of dopamine ( DA ) D1 receptor agonists in the treatment of Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) is still unclear .
column2: The clinical utility of chem* dopamine *chem ( chem* DA *chem ) D1 receptor agonists in the treatment of Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) is still unclear .

column1: The therapeutic use of selective DA D1 receptor agonists such as SKF - 82958 ( 6 - chloro - 7 , 8 - dihydroxy - 3 - allyl - 1 - phenyl - 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 - tetrahydro - 1H - 3 - benzaze pine hydrobromide ) and A - 77636 ( [ 1R , 3S ] 3 - [ 1 ' - admantyl ] - 1 - aminomethyl - 3 , 4 - dihydro - 5 , 6 - dihydroxy - 1H - 2 - benzo pyran hydrochloride ) seems limited because of their duration of action , which is too short for SKF - 82958 ( < 1 hr ) and too long for A - 77636 ( > 20 hr , leading to behavioral tolerance ) .
column2: The therapeutic use of selective chem* DA *chem D1 receptor agonists such as chem* SKF - 82958 *chem ( chem* 6 - chloro - 7 , 8 - dihydroxy - 3 - allyl - 1 - phenyl - 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 - tetrahydro - 1H - 3 - benzaze pine hydrobromide *chem ) and chem* A - 77636 *chem ( chem* [ 1R , 3S ] 3 - [ 1 ' - admantyl ] - 1 - aminomethyl - 3 , 4 - dihydro - 5 , 6 - dihydroxy - 1H - 2 - benzo pyran hydrochloride *chem ) seems limited because of their duration of action , which is too short for chem* SKF - 82958 *chem ( < 1 hr ) and too long for chem* A - 77636 *chem ( > 20 hr , leading to behavioral tolerance ) .

column1: We therefore conducted the present acute dose - response study in four 1 - methyl - 4 - phenyl - 1 , 2 , 3 , 6 - tetrahydropyridine ( MPTP ) - exposed cynomolgus monkeys primed to exhibit levodopa - induced dyskinesias to evaluate the locomotor and dyskinetic effects on challenge with four doses ( from 0 . 03 to 1 . 0 mg / kg ) of A - 86929 ( [ - ] - [ 5aR , 11bS ] - 4 , 5 , 5a , 6 , 7 , 11b - hexahydro - 2 - propyl - 3 - thia - 5 - + + + azacyclopent - 1 - ena [ c ] phenathrene - 9 - 10 - diol ) , a selective and full DA D1 - like receptor agonist with an intermediate duration of action .
column2: We therefore conducted the present acute dose - response study in four chem* 1 - methyl - 4 - phenyl - 1 , 2 , 3 , 6 - tetrahydropyridine *chem ( chem* MPTP *chem ) - exposed cynomolgus monkeys primed to exhibit chem* levodopa *chem - induced dyskinesias to evaluate the locomotor and dyskinetic effects on challenge with four doses ( from 0 . 03 to 1 . 0 mg / kg ) of chem* A - 86929 *chem ( chem* [ - ] - [ 5aR , 11bS ] - 4 , 5 , 5a , 6 , 7 , 11b - hexahydro - 2 - propyl - 3 - thia - 5 - + + + azacyclopent - 1 - ena [ c ] phenathrene - 9 - 10 - diol *chem ) , a selective and full chem* DA *chem D1 - like receptor agonist with an intermediate duration of action .

column1: Levodopa and the DA D2 - like receptor agonist , LY - 171555 ( [ 4aR - trans ] - 4 , 4a , 5 , 6 , 7 , 8 , 8a , 9 - o - dihydro - 5n - propyl - 2H - pyrazo lo - 3 - 4 - quinoline hydrochloride ) were also used for comparison .
column2: chem* Levodopa *chem and the chem* DA *chem D2 - like receptor agonist , chem* LY - 171555 *chem ( chem* [ 4aR - trans ] - 4 , 4a , 5 , 6 , 7 , 8 , 8a , 9 - o - dihydro - 5n - propyl - 2H - pyrazo lo - 3 - 4 - quinoline hydrochloride *chem ) were also used for comparison .

column1: Acute administration of A - 86929 was as efficacious in alleviating MPTP - induced parkinsonism as levodopa and LY - 171555 , but was less likely to reproduce the levodopa - induced dyskinesias in these animals than with either LY - 171555 or subsequent challenge of levodopa .
column2: Acute administration of chem* A - 86929 *chem was as efficacious in alleviating chem* MPTP *chem - induced parkinsonism as chem* levodopa *chem and chem* LY - 171555 *chem , but was less likely to reproduce the chem* levodopa *chem - induced dyskinesias in these animals than with either chem* LY - 171555 *chem or subsequent challenge of chem* levodopa *chem .

column1: Selective stimulation of the DA D1 receptor may provide better integration of neural inputs transmitted to the internal segment of the globus pallidus ( referred to as the basal ganglia output ) compared with levodopa and selective DA D2 receptor agonist .
column2: Selective stimulation of the chem* DA *chem D1 receptor may provide better integration of neural inputs transmitted to the internal segment of the globus pallidus ( referred to as the basal ganglia output ) compared with chem* levodopa *chem and selective chem* DA *chem D2 receptor agonist .

column1: Potent DA D1 receptor agents with an intermediate duration of efficacy such as A - 86929 ( approximately 4 hr at higher doses tested ) are potential therapeutic tools in PD and merit further attention .
column2: Potent chem* DA *chem D1 receptor agents with an intermediate duration of efficacy such as chem* A - 86929 *chem ( approximately 4 hr at higher doses tested ) are potential therapeutic tools in PD and merit further attention .

column1: Neuropeptide - Y immunoreactivity in the pilocarpine model of temporal lobe epilepsy .
column2: Neuropeptide - Y immunoreactivity in the chem* pilocarpine *chem model of temporal lobe epilepsy .

column1: Neuropeptide - Y ( NPY ) is expressed by granule cells and mossy fibres of the hippocampal dentate gyrus during experimental temporal lobe epilepsy ( TLE ) .
column2: Neuropeptide - Y ( NPY ) is expressed by granule cells and mossy fibres of the hippocampal dentate gyrus during experimental temporal lobe epilepsy ( TLE ) .

column1: This expression may represent an endogenous damping mechanism since NPY has been shown to block seizure - like events following high - frequency stimulation in hippocampal slices .
column2: This expression may represent an endogenous damping mechanism since NPY has been shown to block seizure - like events following high - frequency stimulation in hippocampal slices .

column1: The pilocarpine ( PILO ) model of epilepsy is characterized by an acute period of status epilepticus followed by spontaneous recurrent seizures and related brain damage .
column2: The chem* pilocarpine *chem ( chem* PILO *chem ) model of epilepsy is characterized by an acute period of status epilepticus followed by spontaneous recurrent seizures and related brain damage .

column1: We report peroxidase - antiperoxidase immunostaining for NPY in several brain regions in this model .
column2: We report peroxidase - antiperoxidase immunostaining for NPY in several brain regions in this model .

column1: PILO - injected animals exhibited NPY immunoreactivity in the region of the mossy fibre terminals , in the dentate gyrus inner molecular layer and , in a few cases , within presumed granule cells .
column2: chem* PILO *chem - injected animals exhibited NPY immunoreactivity in the region of the mossy fibre terminals , in the dentate gyrus inner molecular layer and , in a few cases , within presumed granule cells .

column1: NPY immunoreactivity was also dramatically changed in the entorhinal cortex , amygdala and sensorimotor areas .
column2: NPY immunoreactivity was also dramatically changed in the entorhinal cortex , amygdala and sensorimotor areas .

column1: In addition , PILO injected animals exhibited a reduction in the number of NPY - immunoreactive interneurons compared with controls .
column2: In addition , chem* PILO *chem injected animals exhibited a reduction in the number of NPY - immunoreactive interneurons compared with controls .

column1: The results demonstrate that changes in NPY expression , including expression in the granule cells and mossy fibres and the loss of vulnerable NPY neurons , are present in the PILO model of TLE .
column2: The results demonstrate that changes in NPY expression , including expression in the granule cells and mossy fibres and the loss of vulnerable NPY neurons , are present in the chem* PILO *chem model of TLE .

column1: However , the significance of this changed synthesis of NPY remains to be determined .
column2: However , the significance of this changed synthesis of NPY remains to be determined .

column1: Posteroventral medial pallidotomy in advanced Parkinson ' s disease .
column2: Posteroventral medial pallidotomy in advanced Parkinson ' s disease .

column1: BACKGROUND : Posteroventral medial pallidotomy sometimes produces striking improvement in patients with advanced Parkinson ' s disease , but the studies to date have involved small numbers of patients and short - term follow - up .
column2: BACKGROUND : Posteroventral medial pallidotomy sometimes produces striking improvement in patients with advanced Parkinson ' s disease , but the studies to date have involved small numbers of patients and short - term follow - up .

column1: METHODS : Forty patients with Parkinson ' s disease underwent serial , detailed assessments both after drug withdrawal ( " off " period ) and while taking their optimal medical regimens ( " on " period ) .
column2: METHODS : Forty patients with Parkinson ' s disease underwent serial , detailed assessments both after drug withdrawal ( " off " period ) and while taking their optimal medical regimens ( " on " period ) .

column1: All patients were examined preoperatively and 39 were examined at six months ; 27 of the patients were also examined at one year , and 11 at two years .
column2: All patients were examined preoperatively and 39 were examined at six months ; 27 of the patients were also examined at one year , and 11 at two years .

column1: RESULTS : The percent improvements at six months were as follows : off - period score for overall motor function , 28 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 19 to 38 percent ) , with most of the improvement in the contralateral limbs ; off - period score for activities of daily living , 29 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 19 to 39 percent ) ; on - period score for contralateral dyskinesias , 82 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 72 to 91 percent ) ; and on - period score for ipsilateral dyskinesias , 44 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 29 to 59 percent ) .
column2: RESULTS : The percent improvements at six months were as follows : off - period score for overall motor function , 28 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 19 to 38 percent ) , with most of the improvement in the contralateral limbs ; off - period score for activities of daily living , 29 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 19 to 39 percent ) ; on - period score for contralateral dyskinesias , 82 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 72 to 91 percent ) ; and on - period score for ipsilateral dyskinesias , 44 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 29 to 59 percent ) .

column1: The improvements in dyskinesias and the total scores for off - period parkinsonism , contralateral bradykinesia , and rigidity were sustained in the 11 patients examined at two years .
column2: The improvements in dyskinesias and the total scores for off - period parkinsonism , contralateral bradykinesia , and rigidity were sustained in the 11 patients examined at two years .

column1: The improvement in ipsilateral dyskinesias was lost after one year , and the improvements in postural stability and gait lasted only three to six months .
column2: The improvement in ipsilateral dyskinesias was lost after one year , and the improvements in postural stability and gait lasted only three to six months .

column1: Approximately half the patients who had been dependent on assistance in activities of daily living in the off period before surgery became independent after surgery .
column2: Approximately half the patients who had been dependent on assistance in activities of daily living in the off period before surgery became independent after surgery .

column1: The complications of surgery were generally well tolerated , and there were no significant changes in the use of medication .
column2: The complications of surgery were generally well tolerated , and there were no significant changes in the use of medication .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : In late - stage Parkinson ' s disease , pallidotomy significantly reduces levodopa - induced dyskinesias and off - period disability .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : In late - stage Parkinson ' s disease , pallidotomy significantly reduces chem* levodopa *chem - induced dyskinesias and off - period disability .

column1: Much of the benefit is sustained at two years , although some improvements , such as those on the ipsilateral side and in axial symptoms , wane within the first year .
column2: Much of the benefit is sustained at two years , although some improvements , such as those on the ipsilateral side and in axial symptoms , wane within the first year .

column1: The on - period symptoms that are resistant to dopaminergic therapy do not respond to pallidotomy .
column2: The on - period symptoms that are resistant to dopaminergic therapy do not respond to pallidotomy .

column1: Clarithromycin - induced ventricular tachycardia .
column2: chem* Clarithromycin *chem - induced ventricular tachycardia .

column1: Clarithromycin is a relatively new macrolide antibiotic that offers twice - daily dosing .
column2: chem* Clarithromycin *chem is a relatively new chem* macrolide *chem antibiotic that offers twice - daily dosing .

column1: It differs from erythromycin only in the methylation of the hydroxyl group at position 6 .
column2: It differs from chem* erythromycin *chem only in the methylation of the hydroxyl group at position 6 .

column1: Although the side - effect profile of erythromycin is established , including gastroenteritis and interactions with other drugs subject to hepatic mixed - function oxidase metabolism , experience with the newer macrolides is still being recorded .
column2: Although the side - effect profile of chem* erythromycin *chem is established , including gastroenteritis and interactions with other drugs subject to hepatic mixed - function oxidase metabolism , experience with the newer chem* macrolides *chem is still being recorded .

column1: Cardiotoxicity has been demonstrated after both intravenous and oral administration of erythromycin but has never been reported with the newer macrolides .
column2: Cardiotoxicity has been demonstrated after both intravenous and oral administration of chem* erythromycin *chem but has never been reported with the newer chem* macrolides *chem .

column1: We report a case of ventricular dysrhythmias that occurred after six therapeutic doses of clarithromycin .
column2: We report a case of ventricular dysrhythmias that occurred after six therapeutic doses of chem* clarithromycin *chem .

column1: The dysrhythmias resolved after discontinuation of the drug .
column2: The dysrhythmias resolved after discontinuation of the drug .

column1: Effect of glyceryl trinitrate on the sphincter of Oddi spasm evoked by prostigmine - morphine administration .
column2: Effect of chem* glyceryl trinitrate *chem on the sphincter of Oddi spasm evoked by chem* prostigmine *chem - chem* morphine *chem administration .

column1: OBJECTIVE : In this study the effect of glyceryl trinitrate on the prostigmine - morphine - induced sphincter of Oddi spasm was evaluated in nine female patients with sphincter of Oddi dyskinesia .
column2: OBJECTIVE : In this study the effect of chem* glyceryl trinitrate *chem on the chem* prostigmine *chem - chem* morphine *chem - induced sphincter of Oddi spasm was evaluated in nine female patients with sphincter of Oddi dyskinesia .

column1: METHOD : Sphincter of Oddi spasm was induced by prostigmine - morphine administration ( 0 . 5 mg prostigmine intramuscularly and 10 mg morphine subcutaneously ) and visualized by quantitative hepatobiliary scintigraphy .
column2: METHOD : Sphincter of Oddi spasm was induced by chem* prostigmine *chem - chem* morphine *chem administration ( 0 . 5 mg chem* prostigmine *chem intramuscularly and 10 mg chem* morphine *chem subcutaneously ) and visualized by quantitative hepatobiliary scintigraphy .

column1: The entire procedure was repeated during glyceryl trinitrate infusion ( Nitrolingual 1 microg / kg / min for 120 min ) .
column2: The entire procedure was repeated during chem* glyceryl trinitrate *chem infusion ( chem* Nitrolingual *chem 1 microg / kg / min for 120 min ) .

column1: RESULTS : Prostigmine - morphine provocation caused significant increases in the time to peak activity ( Tmax ) over the hepatic hilum ( HH : 34 . 33 + / - 5 . 05 vs . 22 . 77 + / - 3 . 26 ) and the common bile duct ( CBD : 60 . 44 + / - 5 . 99 vs . 40 . 0 + / - 2 . 88 ) and in the half - time of excretion ( T1 / 2 ) over the liver parenchyma ( LP : 120 . 04 + / - 16 . 01 vs . 27 . 37 + / - 2 . 19 ) , HH ( 117 . 61 + / - 14 . 71 vs . 31 . 85 + / - 3 . 99 ) and CBD ( 158 . 11 + / - 9 . 18 vs . 40 . 1 + / - 6 . 24 ) , indicating a complete spasm at the level of the sphincter of Oddi .
column2: RESULTS : chem* Prostigmine *chem - chem* morphine *chem provocation caused significant increases in the time to peak activity ( Tmax ) over the hepatic hilum ( HH : 34 . 33 + / - 5 . 05 vs . 22 . 77 + / - 3 . 26 ) and the common bile duct ( CBD : 60 . 44 + / - 5 . 99 vs . 40 . 0 + / - 2 . 88 ) and in the half - time of excretion ( T1 / 2 ) over the liver parenchyma ( LP : 120 . 04 + / - 16 . 01 vs . 27 . 37 + / - 2 . 19 ) , HH ( 117 . 61 + / - 14 . 71 vs . 31 . 85 + / - 3 . 99 ) and CBD ( 158 . 11 + / - 9 . 18 vs . 40 . 1 + / - 6 . 24 ) , indicating a complete spasm at the level of the sphincter of Oddi .

column1: Glyceryl trinitrate infusion completely normalized the prostigmine - morphine - induced alterations in these quantitative parameters ( TmaX over the LP : 11 . 33 + / - 1 . 13 ; over the HH : 18 . 88 + / - 1 . 48 ; and over the CBD : 36 . 22 + / - 1 . 92 ; and T1 / 2 over the LP : 28 . 21 + / - 1 . 83 ; over the HH : 33 . 42 + / - 3 . 10 ; and over the CBD : 41 . 66 + / - 6 . 33 ) , suggesting an effective sphincter - relaxing effect of glyceryl trinitrate .
column2: chem* Glyceryl trinitrate *chem infusion completely normalized the chem* prostigmine *chem - chem* morphine *chem - induced alterations in these quantitative parameters ( TmaX over the LP : 11 . 33 + / - 1 . 13 ; over the HH : 18 . 88 + / - 1 . 48 ; and over the CBD : 36 . 22 + / - 1 . 92 ; and T1 / 2 over the LP : 28 . 21 + / - 1 . 83 ; over the HH : 33 . 42 + / - 3 . 10 ; and over the CBD : 41 . 66 + / - 6 . 33 ) , suggesting an effective sphincter - relaxing effect of chem* glyceryl trinitrate *chem .

column1: CONCLUSION : These results provide the first evidence of the effectiveness of glyceryl trinitrate on the morphine - induced sphincter of Oddi spasm in humans .
column2: CONCLUSION : These results provide the first evidence of the effectiveness of chem* glyceryl trinitrate *chem on the chem* morphine *chem - induced sphincter of Oddi spasm in humans .

column1: Since glyceryl trinitrate is able to overcome even the drastic effect of morphine , it might be of relevance in the treatment of sphincter of Oddi dyskinesia .
column2: Since chem* glyceryl trinitrate *chem is able to overcome even the drastic effect of chem* morphine *chem , it might be of relevance in the treatment of sphincter of Oddi dyskinesia .

column1: Immunopathology of penicillamine - induced glomerular disease .
column2: Immunopathology of chem* penicillamine *chem - induced glomerular disease .

column1: Four patients with rheumatoid arthritis developed heavy proteinuria after five to 12 months of treatment with D - penicillamine .
column2: Four patients with rheumatoid arthritis developed heavy proteinuria after five to 12 months of treatment with chem* D - penicillamine *chem .

column1: Light microscopy of renal biopsy samples showed minimal glomerular capillary wall thickening and mesangial matrix increase , or no departure from normal .
column2: Light microscopy of renal biopsy samples showed minimal glomerular capillary wall thickening and mesangial matrix increase , or no departure from normal .

column1: Electron microscopy , however , revealed subepithelial electron - dense deposits , fusion of epithelial cell foot processes , and evidence of mesangial cell hyperactivity .
column2: Electron microscopy , however , revealed subepithelial electron - dense deposits , fusion of epithelial cell foot processes , and evidence of mesangial cell hyperactivity .

column2: Immunofluorescence microscopy demonstrated granular capillary wall deposits of IgG and C3 .

column1: The findings were similar to those in early membranous glomerulonephritis , differences being observed however in the results of staining for the early - acting complement components C1q and C4 .
column2: The findings were similar to those in early membranous glomerulonephritis , differences being observed however in the results of staining for the early - acting complement components C1q and C4 .

column1: Experimental cranial pain elicited by capsaicin : a PET study .
column2: Experimental cranial pain elicited by chem* capsaicin *chem : a PET study .

column1: Using a positron emission tomography ( PET ) study it was shown recently that in migraine without aura certain areas in the brain stem were activated during the headache state , but not in the headache free interval .
column2: Using a positron emission tomography ( PET ) study it was shown recently that in migraine without aura certain areas in the brain stem were activated during the headache state , but not in the headache free interval .

column1: It was suggested that this brain stem activation is inherent to the migraine attack itself and represents the so called ' migraine generator ' .
column2: It was suggested that this brain stem activation is inherent to the migraine attack itself and represents the so called ' migraine generator ' .

column1: To test this hypothesis we performed an experimental pain study in seven healthy volunteers , using the same positioning in the PET scanner as in the migraine patients .
column2: To test this hypothesis we performed an experimental pain study in seven healthy volunteers , using the same positioning in the PET scanner as in the migraine patients .

column1: A small amount of capsaicin was administered subcutaneously in the right forehead to evoke a burning painful sensation in the first division of the trigeminal nerve .
column2: A small amount of chem* capsaicin *chem was administered subcutaneously in the right forehead to evoke a burning painful sensation in the first division of the trigeminal nerve .

column1: Increases of regional cerebral blood flow ( rCBF ) were found bilaterally in the insula , in the anterior cingulate cortex , the cavernous sinus and the cerebellum .
column2: Increases of regional cerebral blood flow ( rCBF ) were found bilaterally in the insula , in the anterior cingulate cortex , the cavernous sinus and the cerebellum .

column1: Using the same stereotactic space limits as in the above mentioned migraine study no brain stem activation was found in the acute pain state compared to the pain free state .
column2: Using the same stereotactic space limits as in the above mentioned migraine study no brain stem activation was found in the acute pain state compared to the pain free state .

column1: The increase of activation in the region of the cavernous sinus however , suggests that this structure is more likely to be involved in trigeminal transmitted pain as such , rather than in a specific type of headache as was suggested for cluster headache .
column2: The increase of activation in the region of the cavernous sinus however , suggests that this structure is more likely to be involved in trigeminal transmitted pain as such , rather than in a specific type of headache as was suggested for cluster headache .

column1: Value of methylprednisolone in prevention of the arthralgia - myalgia syndrome associated with the total dose infusion of iron dextran : a double blind randomized trial .
column2: Value of chem* methylprednisolone *chem in prevention of the arthralgia - myalgia syndrome associated with the total dose infusion of chem* iron dextran *chem : a double blind randomized trial .

column1: The safety and efficacy of total dose infusion ( TDI ) of iron dextran has been well documented .
column2: The safety and efficacy of total dose infusion ( TDI ) of chem* iron dextran *chem has been well documented .

column1: In 40 % of treated patients , an arthralgia - myalgia syndrome develops .
column2: In 40 % of treated patients , an arthralgia - myalgia syndrome develops .

column1: The purpose of this randomized , double - blind , prospective study was to investigate whether intravenous ( i . v . ) administration of methylprednisolone ( MP ) prevents this complication .
column2: The purpose of this randomized , double - blind , prospective study was to investigate whether intravenous ( i . v . ) administration of chem* methylprednisolone *chem ( chem* MP *chem ) prevents this complication .

column1: Sixty - five patients , 34 women and 31 men , ages 36 to 80 years , received either normal saline before and after TDI ( group 1 ) , 125 mg i . v . MP before and saline after TDI ( group 2 ) , or 125 mg i . v . MP before and after TDI ( group 3 ) .
column2: Sixty - five patients , 34 women and 31 men , ages 36 to 80 years , received either normal saline before and after TDI ( group 1 ) , 125 mg i . v . chem* MP *chem before and saline after TDI ( group 2 ) , or 125 mg i . v . chem* MP *chem before and after TDI ( group 3 ) .

column1: Patients were observed for 72 hours and reactions were recorded and graded according to severity .
column2: Patients were observed for 72 hours and reactions were recorded and graded according to severity .

column1: Fifty - eight percent of group 1 patients , 33 % of group 2 , and 26 % of group 3 had reactions to TDI .
column2: Fifty - eight percent of group 1 patients , 33 % of group 2 , and 26 % of group 3 had reactions to TDI .

column1: The severity of reactions ( minimal , mild , and moderate , respectively ) was as follows : group 1 - - 6 , 6 , and 2 ; group 2 - - 1 , 5 , and 0 ; group 3 - - 5 , 1 , and 0 .
column2: The severity of reactions ( minimal , mild , and moderate , respectively ) was as follows : group 1 - - 6 , 6 , and 2 ; group 2 - - 1 , 5 , and 0 ; group 3 - - 5 , 1 , and 0 .

column1: Data were analyzed by the two - sided Fisher ' s exact test using 95 % confidence intervals with the approximation of Woolf .
column2: Data were analyzed by the two - sided Fisher ' s exact test using 95 % confidence intervals with the approximation of Woolf .

column1: These data demonstrate that administration of MP before and after TDI reduces the frequency and severity of the arthralgia - myalgia syndrome .
column2: These data demonstrate that administration of chem* MP *chem before and after TDI reduces the frequency and severity of the arthralgia - myalgia syndrome .

column1: We conclude that 125 mg i . v . MP should be given routinely before and after TDI of iron dextran .
column2: We conclude that 125 mg i . v . chem* MP *chem should be given routinely before and after TDI of chem* iron dextran *chem .

column1: Prolongation of the QT interval related to cisapride - diltiazem interaction .
column2: Prolongation of the QT interval related to chem* cisapride *chem - chem* diltiazem *chem interaction .

column1: Cisapride , a cytochrome P450 3A4 ( CYP3A4 ) substrate , is widely prescribed for the treatment of gastrointestinal motility disorders .
column2: chem* Cisapride *chem , a cytochrome P450 3A4 ( CYP3A4 ) substrate , is widely prescribed for the treatment of gastrointestinal motility disorders .

column1: Prolongation of QT interval , torsades de pointes , and sudden cardiac death have been reported after concomitant administration with erythromycin or azole antifungal agents , but not with other CYP3A4 inhibitors .
column2: Prolongation of QT interval , torsades de pointes , and sudden cardiac death have been reported after concomitant administration with chem* erythromycin *chem or chem* azole *chem antifungal agents , but not with other CYP3A4 inhibitors .

column1: A possible drug interaction occurred in a 45 - year - old woman who was taking cisapride for gastroesophageal reflux disorder and diltiazem , an agent that has inhibitory effect on CYP3A4 , for hypertension .
column2: A possible drug interaction occurred in a 45 - year - old woman who was taking chem* cisapride *chem for gastroesophageal reflux disorder and chem* diltiazem *chem , an agent that has inhibitory effect on CYP3A4 , for hypertension .

column1: Single photon emission tomography with i . v . 133Xe was used to measure the rCBF changes .
column2: Single photon emission tomography with i . v . 133Xe was used to measure the rCBF changes .

column1: The dyskinetic parkinsonian patients exhibited a pattern of response which was markedly different from those of the normal subjects and non - dyskinetic parkinsonian patients , with a significant overactivation in the supplementary motor area and the ipsi - and contralateral primary motor areas .
column2: The dyskinetic parkinsonian patients exhibited a pattern of response which was markedly different from those of the normal subjects and non - dyskinetic parkinsonian patients , with a significant overactivation in the supplementary motor area and the ipsi - and contralateral primary motor areas .

column1: These results are compatible with the hypothesis that an hyperkinetic abnormal involuntary movement , like L - dopa - induced peak dose dyskinesia , is due to a disinhibition of the primary and associated motor cortex secondary to an excessive outflow of the pallidothalamocortical motor loop .
column2: These results are compatible with the hypothesis that an hyperkinetic abnormal involuntary movement , like chem* L - dopa *chem - induced peak dose dyskinesia , is due to a disinhibition of the primary and associated motor cortex secondary to an excessive outflow of the pallidothalamocortical motor loop .

column1: Open - label assessment of levofloxacin for the treatment of acute bacterial sinusitis in adults .
column2: Open - label assessment of chem* levofloxacin *chem for the treatment of acute bacterial sinusitis in adults .

column1: PURPOSE : To evaluate the efficacy and safety of levofloxacin ( 500 mg orally once daily for 10 to 14 days ) in treating adult outpatients with acute bacterial sinusitis .
column2: PURPOSE : To evaluate the efficacy and safety of chem* levofloxacin *chem ( 500 mg orally once daily for 10 to 14 days ) in treating adult outpatients with acute bacterial sinusitis .

column1: PATIENTS AND METHODS : A total of 329 patients enrolled in the study at 24 centers .
column2: PATIENTS AND METHODS : A total of 329 patients enrolled in the study at 24 centers .

column1: All patients had a pre - therapy Gram ' s stain and culture of sinus exudate obtained by antral puncture or nasal endoscopy .
column2: All patients had a pre - therapy Gram ' s stain and culture of sinus exudate obtained by antral puncture or nasal endoscopy .

column1: Clinical response was assessed on the basis of signs and symptoms and sinus radiograph or computed tomography results .
column2: Clinical response was assessed on the basis of signs and symptoms and sinus radiograph or computed tomography results .

column1: Microbiologic cure rates were determined on the basis of presumed plus documented eradication of the pre - therapy pathogen ( s ) .
column2: Microbiologic cure rates were determined on the basis of presumed plus documented eradication of the pre - therapy pathogen ( s ) .

column1: RESULTS : The most common pathogens were Haemophilus influenzae , Streptococcus pneumoniae , Staphylococcus aureus , and Moraxella catarrhalis .
column2: RESULTS : The most common pathogens were Haemophilus influenzae , Streptococcus pneumoniae , Staphylococcus aureus , and Moraxella catarrhalis .

column1: Of 300 clinically evaluable patients , 175 ( 58 % ) were cured and 90 ( 30 % ) were improved at the post - therapy evaluation , resulting in a clinical success rate of 88 % .
column2: Of 300 clinically evaluable patients , 175 ( 58 % ) were cured and 90 ( 30 % ) were improved at the post - therapy evaluation , resulting in a clinical success rate of 88 % .

column1: Thirty - five patients ( 12 % ) clinically failed treatment .
column2: Thirty - five patients ( 12 % ) clinically failed treatment .

column1: The microbiologic eradication rate ( presumed plus documented ) among 138 microbiologically evaluable patients was 92 % .
column2: The microbiologic eradication rate ( presumed plus documented ) among 138 microbiologically evaluable patients was 92 % .

column1: Microbiologic eradication rates ( presumed plus documented ) of the most common pathogens ranged from 93 % ( M . catarrhalis ) to 100 % ( S . pneumoniae ) at the post - therapy visit .
column2: Microbiologic eradication rates ( presumed plus documented ) of the most common pathogens ranged from 93 % ( M . catarrhalis ) to 100 % ( S . pneumoniae ) at the post - therapy visit .

column1: All but one of the 265 patients who were cured or improved at post - therapy returned for a long - term follow - up visit ; 243 ( 92 % ) remained well 4 to 6 weeks after therapy ; and 21 ( 8 % ) had a relapse of symptoms .
column2: All but one of the 265 patients who were cured or improved at post - therapy returned for a long - term follow - up visit ; 243 ( 92 % ) remained well 4 to 6 weeks after therapy ; and 21 ( 8 % ) had a relapse of symptoms .

column1: Adverse events considered to be related to levofloxacin administration were reported by 29 patients ( 9 % ) .
column2: Adverse events considered to be related to chem* levofloxacin *chem administration were reported by 29 patients ( 9 % ) .

column1: The most common drug - related adverse events were diarrhea , flatulence , and nausea ; most adverse events were mild to moderate in severity .
column2: The most common drug - related adverse events were diarrhea , flatulence , and nausea ; most adverse events were mild to moderate in severity .

column1: CONCLUSION : The results of this study indicate that levofloxacin 500 mg once daily is an effective and safe treatment for acute bacterial sinusitis .
column2: CONCLUSION : The results of this study indicate that chem* levofloxacin *chem 500 mg once daily is an effective and safe treatment for acute bacterial sinusitis .

column1: Iatrogenic risks of endometrial carcinoma after treatment for breast cancer in a large French case - control study .
column2: Iatrogenic risks of endometrial carcinoma after treatment for breast cancer in a large French case - control study .

column1: F d ration Nationale des Centres de Lutte Contre le Cancer ( FNCLCC ) .
column2: F d ration Nationale des Centres de Lutte Contre le Cancer ( FNCLCC ) .

column1: Since tamoxifen is widely used in breast cancer treatment and has been proposed for the prevention of breast cancer , its endometrial iatrogenic effects must be carefully examined .
column2: Since chem* tamoxifen *chem is widely used in breast cancer treatment and has been proposed for the prevention of breast cancer , its endometrial iatrogenic effects must be carefully examined .

column1: We have investigated the association between endometrial cancer and tamoxifen use or other treatments in women treated for breast cancer in a case - control study .
column2: We have investigated the association between endometrial cancer and chem* tamoxifen *chem use or other treatments in women treated for breast cancer in a case - control study .

column1: Cases of endometrial cancer diagnosed after breast cancer ( n = 135 ) and 467 controls matched for age , year of diagnosis of breast cancer and hospital and survival time with an intact uterus were included .
column2: Cases of endometrial cancer diagnosed after breast cancer ( n = 135 ) and 467 controls matched for age , year of diagnosis of breast cancer and hospital and survival time with an intact uterus were included .

column1: Women who had received tamoxifen were significantly more likely to have endometrial cancer diagnosed than those who had not ( crude relative risk = 4 . 9 , p = 0 . 0001 ) .
column2: Women who had received chem* tamoxifen *chem were significantly more likely to have endometrial cancer diagnosed than those who had not ( crude relative risk = 4 . 9 , p = 0 . 0001 ) .

column1: Univariate and adjusted analyses showed that the risk increased with the length of treatment ( p = 0 . 0001 ) or the cumulative dose of tamoxifen received ( p = 0 . 0001 ) , irrespective of the daily dose .
column2: Univariate and adjusted analyses showed that the risk increased with the length of treatment ( p = 0 . 0001 ) or the cumulative dose of chem* tamoxifen *chem received ( p = 0 . 0001 ) , irrespective of the daily dose .

column1: Women who had undergone pelvic radiotherapy also had a higher risk ( crude relative risk = 7 . 8 , p = 0 . 0001 ) .
column2: Women who had undergone pelvic radiotherapy also had a higher risk ( crude relative risk = 7 . 8 , p = 0 . 0001 ) .

column1: After adjusting for confounding factors , the risk was higher for tamoxifen users ( p = 0 . 0012 ) , treatment for more than 3 years ( all p < 0 . 03 ) and pelvic radiotherapy ( p = 0 . 012 ) .
column2: After adjusting for confounding factors , the risk was higher for chem* tamoxifen *chem users ( p = 0 . 0012 ) , treatment for more than 3 years ( all p < 0 . 03 ) and pelvic radiotherapy ( p = 0 . 012 ) .

column1: Women who had endometrial cancer and had received tamoxifen had more advanced disease and poorer prognosis than those with endometrial cancer who had not received this treatment .
column2: Women who had endometrial cancer and had received chem* tamoxifen *chem had more advanced disease and poorer prognosis than those with endometrial cancer who had not received this treatment .

column1: Our results suggest a causal role of tamoxifen in endometrial cancer , particularly when used as currently proposed for breast cancer prevention .
column2: Our results suggest a causal role of chem* tamoxifen *chem in endometrial cancer , particularly when used as currently proposed for breast cancer prevention .

column1: Pelvic radiotherapy may be an additional iatrogenic factor for women with breast cancer .
column2: Pelvic radiotherapy may be an additional iatrogenic factor for women with breast cancer .

column1: Endometrial cancers diagnosed in women treated with tamoxifen have poorer prognosis .
column2: Endometrial cancers diagnosed in women treated with chem* tamoxifen *chem have poorer prognosis .

column1: Women who receive tamoxifen for breast cancer should be offered gynaecological surveillance during and after treatment .
column2: Women who receive chem* tamoxifen *chem for breast cancer should be offered gynaecological surveillance during and after treatment .

column1: A long - term evaluation of the risk - benefit ratio of tamoxifen as a preventive treatment for breast cancer is clearly warranted .
column2: A long - term evaluation of the risk - benefit ratio of chem* tamoxifen *chem as a preventive treatment for breast cancer is clearly warranted .

column1: Contribution of the glycine site of NMDA receptors in rostral and intermediate - caudal parts of the striatum to the regulation of muscle tone in rats .
column2: Contribution of the chem* glycine *chem site of chem* NMDA *chem receptors in rostral and intermediate - caudal parts of the striatum to the regulation of muscle tone in rats .

column1: The aim of the present study was to assess the contribution of the glycine site of NMDA receptors in the striatum to the regulation of muscle tone .
column2: The aim of the present study was to assess the contribution of the chem* glycine *chem site of chem* NMDA *chem receptors in the striatum to the regulation of muscle tone .

column1: Muscle tone was examined using a combined mechanoand electromyographic method , which measured simultaneously the muscle resistance ( MMG ) of the rat ' s hind foot to passive extension and flexion in the ankle joint and the electromyographic activity ( EMG ) of the antagonistic muscles of that joint : gastrocnemius and tibialis anterior .
column2: Muscle tone was examined using a combined mechanoand electromyographic method , which measured simultaneously the muscle resistance ( MMG ) of the rat ' s hind foot to passive extension and flexion in the ankle joint and the electromyographic activity ( EMG ) of the antagonistic muscles of that joint : gastrocnemius and tibialis anterior .

column1: Muscle rigidity was induced by haloperidol ( 2 . 5 mg / kg i . p . ) .
column2: Muscle rigidity was induced by chem* haloperidol *chem ( 2 . 5 mg / kg i . p . ) .

column1: 5 , 7 - dichlorokynurenic acid ( 5 , 7 - DCKA ) , a selective glycine site antagonist , injected in doses of 2 . 5 and 4 . 5 microg / 0 . 5 microl bilaterally , into the rostral region of the striatum , decreased both the haloperidol - induced muscle rigidity ( MMG ) and the enhanced electromyographic activity ( EMG ) .
column2: chem* 5 , 7 - dichlorokynurenic acid *chem ( chem* 5 , 7 - DCKA *chem ) , a selective chem* glycine *chem site antagonist , injected in doses of 2 . 5 and 4 . 5 microg / 0 . 5 microl bilaterally , into the rostral region of the striatum , decreased both the chem* haloperidol *chem - induced muscle rigidity ( MMG ) and the enhanced electromyographic activity ( EMG ) .

column1: 5 , 7 - DCKA injected bilaterally in a dose of 4 . 5 microg / 0 . 5 microl into the intermediate - caudal region of the striatum of rats not pretreated with haloperidol had no effect on the muscle tone .
column2: chem* 5 , 7 - DCKA *chem injected bilaterally in a dose of 4 . 5 microg / 0 . 5 microl into the intermediate - caudal region of the striatum of rats not pretreated with chem* haloperidol *chem had no effect on the muscle tone .

column1: The present results suggest that blockade of the glycine site of NMDA receptors in the rostral part of the striatum may be mainly responsible for the antiparkinsonian action of this drug .
column2: The present results suggest that blockade of the chem* glycine *chem site of chem* NMDA *chem receptors in the rostral part of the striatum may be mainly responsible for the antiparkinsonian action of this drug .

column1: Carboplatin toxic effects on the peripheral nervous system of the rat .
column2: chem* Carboplatin *chem toxic effects on the peripheral nervous system of the rat .

column1: BACKGROUND : The most striking of carboplatin ' s advantages ( CBDCA ) over cisplatin ( CDDP ) is its markedly reduced rate of neurotoxic effects .
column2: BACKGROUND : The most striking of chem* carboplatin *chem ' s advantages ( chem* CBDCA *chem ) over chem* cisplatin *chem ( chem* CDDP *chem ) is its markedly reduced rate of neurotoxic effects .

column1: However , the use of CBDCA higher - intensity schedules and the association with other neurotoxic drugs in polychemotherapy may cause some concern about its safety with respect to peripheral nervous system damage .
column2: However , the use of chem* CBDCA *chem higher - intensity schedules and the association with other neurotoxic drugs in polychemotherapy may cause some concern about its safety with respect to peripheral nervous system damage .

column1: MATERIALS AND METHODS : Two different schedules of CBDCA administration ( 10 mg / kg and 15 mg / kg i . p . twice a week for nine times ) were evaluated in Wistar rats .
column2: MATERIALS AND METHODS : Two different schedules of chem* CBDCA *chem administration ( 10 mg / kg and 15 mg / kg i . p . twice a week for nine times ) were evaluated in Wistar rats .

column1: Neurotoxicity was assessed for behavioral ( tail - flick test ) , neurophysiological ( nerve conduction velocity in the tail nerve ) , morphological , morphometrical and analytical effects .
column2: Neurotoxicity was assessed for behavioral ( tail - flick test ) , neurophysiological ( nerve conduction velocity in the tail nerve ) , morphological , morphometrical and analytical effects .

column1: RESULTS : CBDCA administration induced dose - dependent peripheral neurotoxicity .
column2: RESULTS : chem* CBDCA *chem administration induced dose - dependent peripheral neurotoxicity .

column1: Pain perception and nerve conduction velocity in the tail were significantly impaired , particularly after the high - dose treatment .
column2: Pain perception and nerve conduction velocity in the tail were significantly impaired , particularly after the high - dose treatment .

column1: The dorsal root ganglia sensory neurons and , to a lesser extent , satellite cells showed the same changes as those induced by CDDP , mainly affecting the nucleus and nucleolus of ganglionic sensory neurons .
column2: The dorsal root ganglia sensory neurons and , to a lesser extent , satellite cells showed the same changes as those induced by chem* CDDP *chem , mainly affecting the nucleus and nucleolus of ganglionic sensory neurons .

column1: Moreover , significant amounts of platinum were detected in the dorsal root ganglia and kidney after CBDCA treatment .
column2: Moreover , significant amounts of chem* platinum *chem were detected in the dorsal root ganglia and kidney after chem* CBDCA *chem treatment .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : CBDCA is neurotoxic in our model , and the type of pathological changes it induces are so closely similar to those caused by CDDP that it is probable that neurotoxicity is induced in the two drugs by the same mechanism .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* CBDCA *chem is neurotoxic in our model , and the type of pathological changes it induces are so closely similar to those caused by chem* CDDP *chem that it is probable that neurotoxicity is induced in the two drugs by the same mechanism .

column1: This model can be used alone or in combination with other drugs to explore the effect of CBDCA on the peripheral nervous system .
column2: This model can be used alone or in combination with other drugs to explore the effect of chem* CBDCA *chem on the peripheral nervous system .

column1: Effects of cisapride on symptoms and postcibal small - bowel motor function in patients with irritable bowel syndrome .
column2: Effects of chem* cisapride *chem on symptoms and postcibal small - bowel motor function in patients with irritable bowel syndrome .

column1: BACKGROUND : Irritable bowel syndrome is a common cause of abdominal pain and discomfort and may be related to disordered gastrointestinal motility .
column2: BACKGROUND : Irritable bowel syndrome is a common cause of abdominal pain and discomfort and may be related to disordered gastrointestinal motility .

column1: Our aim was to assess the effects of long - term treatment with a prokinetic agent , cisapride , on postprandial jejunal motility and symptoms in the irritable bowel syndrome ( IBS ) .
column2: Our aim was to assess the effects of long - term treatment with a prokinetic agent , chem* cisapride *chem , on postprandial jejunal motility and symptoms in the irritable bowel syndrome ( IBS ) .

column1: METHODS : Thirty - eight patients with IBS ( constipation - predominant , n = 17 ; diarrhoea - predominant , n = 21 ) underwent 24 - h ambulatory jejunal manometry before and after 12 week ' s treatment [ cisapride , 5 mg three times daily ( n = 19 ) or placebo ( n = 19 ) ] .
column2: METHODS : Thirty - eight patients with IBS ( constipation - predominant , n = 17 ; diarrhoea - predominant , n = 21 ) underwent 24 - h ambulatory jejunal manometry before and after 12 week ' s treatment [ chem* cisapride *chem , 5 mg three times daily ( n = 19 ) or placebo ( n = 19 ) ] .

column1: RESULTS : In diarrhoea - predominant patients significant differences in contraction characteristics were observed between the cisapride and placebo groups .
column2: RESULTS : In diarrhoea - predominant patients significant differences in contraction characteristics were observed between the chem* cisapride *chem and placebo groups .

column1: In cisapride - treated diarrhoea - predominant patients the mean contraction amplitude was higher ( 29 . 3 + / - 3 . 2 versus 24 . 9 + / - 2 . 6 mm Hg , cisapride versus placebo ( P < 0 . 001 ) ; pretreatment , 25 . 7 + / - 6 . 0 mm Hg ) , the mean contraction duration longer ( 3 . 4 + / - 0 . 2 versus 3 . 0 + / - 0 . 2 sec , cisapride versus placebo ( P < 0 . 001 ) ; pretreatment , 3 . 1 + / - 0 . 5 sec ) , and the mean contraction frequency lower ( 2 . 0 + / - 0 . 2 versus 2 . 5 + / - 0 . 4 cont . / min , cisapride versus placebo ( P < 0 . 001 ) ; pretreatment , 2 . 5 + / - 1 . 1 cont . / min ] than patients treated with placebo .
column2: In chem* cisapride *chem - treated diarrhoea - predominant patients the mean contraction amplitude was higher ( 29 . 3 + / - 3 . 2 versus 24 . 9 + / - 2 . 6 mm Hg , chem* cisapride *chem versus placebo ( P < 0 . 001 ) ; pretreatment , 25 . 7 + / - 6 . 0 mm Hg ) , the mean contraction duration longer ( 3 . 4 + / - 0 . 2 versus 3 . 0 + / - 0 . 2 sec , chem* cisapride *chem versus placebo ( P < 0 . 001 ) ; pretreatment , 3 . 1 + / - 0 . 5 sec ) , and the mean contraction frequency lower ( 2 . 0 + / - 0 . 2 versus 2 . 5 + / - 0 . 4 cont . / min , chem* cisapride *chem versus placebo ( P < 0 . 001 ) ; pretreatment , 2 . 5 + / - 1 . 1 cont . / min ] than patients treated with placebo .

column1: No significant differences in jejunal motility were found in the constipation - predominant IBS group .
column2: No significant differences in jejunal motility were found in the constipation - predominant IBS group .

column1: Symptoms were assessed by using a visual analogue scale before and after treatment .
column2: Symptoms were assessed by using a visual analogue scale before and after treatment .

column1: Symptom scores relating to the severity of constipation were lower in cisapride - treated constipation - predominant IBS patients [ score , 54 + / - 5 versus 67 + / - 14 mm , cisapride versus placebo ( P < 0 . 05 ) ; pretreatment , 62 + / - 19 mm ] .
column2: Symptom scores relating to the severity of constipation were lower in chem* cisapride *chem - treated constipation - predominant IBS patients [ score , 54 + / - 5 versus 67 + / - 14 mm , chem* cisapride *chem versus placebo ( P < 0 . 05 ) ; pretreatment , 62 + / - 19 mm ] .

column1: Diarrhoea - predominant IBS patients had a higher pain score after cisapride therapy [ score , 55 + / - 15 versus 34 + / - 12 mm , cisapride versus placebo ( P < 0 . 05 ) ; pretreatment , 67 + / - 19 mm ] .
column2: Diarrhoea - predominant IBS patients had a higher pain score after chem* cisapride *chem therapy [ score , 55 + / - 15 versus 34 + / - 12 mm , chem* cisapride *chem versus placebo ( P < 0 . 05 ) ; pretreatment , 67 + / - 19 mm ] .

column1: CONCLUSION : Cisapride affects jejunal contraction characteristics and some symptoms in IBS .
column2: CONCLUSION : chem* Cisapride *chem affects jejunal contraction characteristics and some symptoms in IBS .

column1: Prevention of breast cancer with tamoxifen : preliminary findings from the Italian randomised trial among hysterectomised women .
column2: Prevention of breast cancer with chem* tamoxifen *chem : preliminary findings from the Italian randomised trial among hysterectomised women .

column1: Italian Tamoxifen Prevention Study .
column2: Italian chem* Tamoxifen *chem Prevention Study .

column1: BACKGROUND : Tamoxifen is a candidate chemopreventive agent in breast cancer , although the drug may be associated with the development of endometrial cancer .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Tamoxifen *chem is a candidate chemopreventive agent in breast cancer , although the drug may be associated with the development of endometrial cancer .

column1: Therefore we did a trial in hysterectomised women of tamoxifen as a chemopreventive .
column2: Therefore we did a trial in hysterectomised women of chem* tamoxifen *chem as a chemopreventive .

column1: METHODS : In October , 1992 , we started a double - blind placebo - controlled , randomised trial of tamoxifen in women ( mainly in Italy ) who did not have breast cancer and who had had a hysterectomy .
column2: METHODS : In October , 1992 , we started a double - blind placebo - controlled , randomised trial of chem* tamoxifen *chem in women ( mainly in Italy ) who did not have breast cancer and who had had a hysterectomy .

column1: Women were randomised to receive tamoxifen 20 mg per day or placebo , both orally for 5 years .
column2: Women were randomised to receive chem* tamoxifen *chem 20 mg per day or placebo , both orally for 5 years .

column1: The original plan was to follow the intervention phase by 5 years ' follow - up .
column2: The original plan was to follow the intervention phase by 5 years ' follow - up .

column1: In June , 1997 , the trialists and the data - monitoring committee decided to end recruitment primarily because of the number of women dropping out of the study .
column2: In June , 1997 , the trialists and the data - monitoring committee decided to end recruitment primarily because of the number of women dropping out of the study .

column1: Recruitment ended on July 11 , 1997 , and the study will continue as planned .
column2: Recruitment ended on July 11 , 1997 , and the study will continue as planned .

column1: The primary endpoints are the occurrence of and deaths from breast cancer .
column2: The primary endpoints are the occurrence of and deaths from breast cancer .

column1: This preliminary interim analysis is based on intention - to - treat .
column2: This preliminary interim analysis is based on intention - to - treat .

column1: FINDINGS : 5408 women were randomised ; participating women have a median follow - up of 46 months for major endpoints .
column2: FINDINGS : 5408 women were randomised ; participating women have a median follow - up of 46 months for major endpoints .

column1: 41 cases of breast cancer occurred so far ; there have been no deaths from breast cancer .
column2: 41 cases of breast cancer occurred so far ; there have been no deaths from breast cancer .

column1: There is no difference in breast - cancer frequency between the placebo ( 22 cases ) and tamoxifen ( 19 ) arms .
column2: There is no difference in breast - cancer frequency between the placebo ( 22 cases ) and chem* tamoxifen *chem ( 19 ) arms .

column1: There is a statistically significant reduction of breast cancer among women receiving tamoxifen who also used hormone - replacement therapy during the trial : among 390 women on such therapy and allocated to placebo , we found eight cases of breast cancer compared with one case among 362 women allocated to tamoxifen .
column2: There is a statistically significant reduction of breast cancer among women receiving chem* tamoxifen *chem who also used hormone - replacement therapy during the trial : among 390 women on such therapy and allocated to placebo , we found eight cases of breast cancer compared with one case among 362 women allocated to chem* tamoxifen *chem .

column1: Compared with the placebo group , there was a significantly increased risk of vascular events and hypertriglyceridaemia among women on tamoxifen .
column2: Compared with the placebo group , there was a significantly increased risk of vascular events and hypertriglyceridaemia among women on chem* tamoxifen *chem .

column1: INTERPRETATION : Although this preliminary analysis has low power , in this cohort of women at low - to - normal risk of breast cancer , the postulated protective effects of tamoxifen are not yet apparent .
column2: INTERPRETATION : Although this preliminary analysis has low power , in this cohort of women at low - to - normal risk of breast cancer , the postulated protective effects of chem* tamoxifen *chem are not yet apparent .

column1: Women using hormone - replacement therapy appear to have benefited from use of tamoxifen .
column2: Women using hormone - replacement therapy appear to have benefited from use of chem* tamoxifen *chem .

column1: There were no deaths from breast cancer recorded in women in the study .
column2: There were no deaths from breast cancer recorded in women in the study .

column1: It is essential to continue follow - up to quantify the long - term risks and benefits of tamoxifen therapy .
column2: It is essential to continue follow - up to quantify the long - term risks and benefits of chem* tamoxifen *chem therapy .

column1: Epileptogenic activity of folic acid after drug induces SLE ( folic acid and epilepsy )
column2: Epileptogenic activity of chem* folic acid *chem after drug induces SLE ( chem* folic acid *chem and epilepsy )

column1: OBJECTIVE : To study the effect of folic acid - containing multivitamin supplementation in epileptic women before and during pregnancy in order to determine the rate of structural birth defects and epilepsy - related side effects .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To study the effect of chem* folic acid *chem - containing multivitamin supplementation in epileptic women before and during pregnancy in order to determine the rate of structural birth defects and epilepsy - related side effects .

column1: STUDY DESIGN : First a randomised trial , later periconception care including in total 12225 females .
column2: STUDY DESIGN : First a randomised trial , later periconception care including in total 12225 females .

column1: RESULTS : Of 60 epileptic women with periconceptional folic acid ( 0 . 8 mg ) - containing multivitamin supplementation , no one developed epilepsy - related side effects during the periconception period .
column2: RESULTS : Of 60 epileptic women with periconceptional chem* folic acid *chem ( 0 . 8 mg ) - containing multivitamin supplementation , no one developed epilepsy - related side effects during the periconception period .

column1: One epileptic woman delivered a newborn with cleft lip and palate .
column2: One epileptic woman delivered a newborn with cleft lip and palate .

column1: Another patient exhibited with a cluster of seizures after the periconception period using another multivitamin .
column2: Another patient exhibited with a cluster of seizures after the periconception period using another multivitamin .

column1: This 22 - year - old epileptic woman was treated continuously by carbamazepine and a folic acid ( 1 mg ) - containing multivitamin from the 20th week of gestation .
column2: This 22 - year - old epileptic woman was treated continuously by chem* carbamazepine *chem and a chem* folic acid *chem ( 1 mg ) - containing multivitamin from the 20th week of gestation .

column1: She developed status epilepticus and later symptoms of systemic lupus erythematodes .
column2: She developed status epilepticus and later symptoms of systemic lupus erythematodes .

column1: Her pregnancy ended with stillbirth .
column2: Her pregnancy ended with stillbirth .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : The epileptic pregnant patient ' s autoimmune disease ( probably drug - induced lupus ) could damage the blood - brain barrier , therefore the therapeutic dose ( > or = 1 mg ) of folic acid triggered a cluster of seizures .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : The epileptic pregnant patient ' s autoimmune disease ( probably drug - induced lupus ) could damage the blood - brain barrier , therefore the therapeutic dose ( > or = 1 mg ) of chem* folic acid *chem triggered a cluster of seizures .

column1: Physiological dose ( < 1 mg ) of folic acid both in healthy and 60 epileptic women , all without any autoimmune disease , did not increase the risk for epileptic seizures .
column2: Physiological dose ( < 1 mg ) of chem* folic acid *chem both in healthy and 60 epileptic women , all without any autoimmune disease , did not increase the risk for epileptic seizures .

column1: Stroke and cocaine or amphetamine use .
column2: Stroke and chem* cocaine *chem or chem* amphetamine *chem use .

column1: The association of cocaine and amphetamine use with hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke is based almost solely on data from case series .
column2: The association of chem* cocaine *chem and chem* amphetamine *chem use with hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke is based almost solely on data from case series .

column1: The limited number of epidemiologic studies of stroke and use of cocaine and / or amphetamine have been done in settings that serve mostly the poor and / or minorities .
column2: The limited number of epidemiologic studies of stroke and use of chem* cocaine *chem and / or chem* amphetamine *chem have been done in settings that serve mostly the poor and / or minorities .

column1: This case - control study was conducted in the defined population comprising members of Kaiser Permanente of Northern and Southern California .
column2: This case - control study was conducted in the defined population comprising members of Kaiser Permanente of Northern and Southern California .

column1: We attempted to identify all incident strokes in women ages 15 - 44 years during a 3 - year period using hospital admission and discharge records , emergency department logs , and payment requests for out - of - plan hospitalizations .
column2: We attempted to identify all incident strokes in women ages 15 - 44 years during a 3 - year period using hospital admission and discharge records , emergency department logs , and payment requests for out - of - plan hospitalizations .

column1: We selected controls , matched on age and facility of usual care , at random from healthy members of the health plan .
column2: We selected controls , matched on age and facility of usual care , at random from healthy members of the health plan .

column1: We obtained information in face - to - face interviews .
column2: We obtained information in face - to - face interviews .

column1: There were 347 confirmed stroke cases and 1 , 021 controls .
column2: There were 347 confirmed stroke cases and 1 , 021 controls .

column1: The univariate matched odds ratio for stroke in women who admitted to using cocaine and / or amphetamine was 8 . 5 ( 95 % confidence interval = 3 . 6 - 20 . 0 ) .
column2: The univariate matched odds ratio for stroke in women who admitted to using chem* cocaine *chem and / or chem* amphetamine *chem was 8 . 5 ( 95 % confidence interval = 3 . 6 - 20 . 0 ) .

column1: After further adjustment for potential confounders , the odds ratio in women who reported using cocaine and / or amphetamine was 7 . 0 ( 95 % confidence interval = 2 . 8 - 17 . 9 ) .
column2: After further adjustment for potential confounders , the odds ratio in women who reported using chem* cocaine *chem and / or chem* amphetamine *chem was 7 . 0 ( 95 % confidence interval = 2 . 8 - 17 . 9 ) .

column1: The use of cocaine and / or amphetamine is a strong risk factor for stroke in this socioeconomically heterogeneous , insured urban population .
column2: The use of chem* cocaine *chem and / or chem* amphetamine *chem is a strong risk factor for stroke in this socioeconomically heterogeneous , insured urban population .

column1: Acute renal failure subsequent to the administration of rifampicin .
column2: Acute renal failure subsequent to the administration of chem* rifampicin *chem .

column1: A follow - up study of cases reported earlier .
column2: A follow - up study of cases reported earlier .

column1: A clinical presentation is made of a 2 - 3 year follow - up of six cases of acute renal failure that have been reported earlier .
column2: A clinical presentation is made of a 2 - 3 year follow - up of six cases of acute renal failure that have been reported earlier .

column1: The patients had developed transient renal failure after the intermittent administration of rifampicin .
column2: The patients had developed transient renal failure after the intermittent administration of chem* rifampicin *chem .
