column1: Chronic effects of a novel synthetic anthracycline derivative ( SM - 5887 ) on normal heart and doxorubicin - induced cardiomyopathy in beagle dogs .
column2: Chronic effects of a novel synthetic chem* anthracycline *chem derivative ( chem* SM - 5887 *chem ) on normal heart and chem* doxorubicin *chem - induced cardiomyopathy in beagle dogs .

column1: This study was designed to investigate the chronic cardiotoxic potential of SM - 5887 and a possible deteriorating effect of SM - 5887 on low - grade cardiotoxicity pre - induced by doxorubicin in beagle dogs .
column2: This study was designed to investigate the chronic cardiotoxic potential of chem* SM - 5887 *chem and a possible deteriorating effect of chem* SM - 5887 *chem on low - grade cardiotoxicity pre - induced by chem* doxorubicin *chem in beagle dogs .

column1: In the chronic treatment , beagle dogs of each sex were given intravenously once every 3 weeks , either a sublethal dose of doxorubicin ( 1 . 5 mg / kg ) or SM - 5887 ( 2 . 5 mg / kg ) .
column2: In the chronic treatment , beagle dogs of each sex were given intravenously once every 3 weeks , either a sublethal dose of chem* doxorubicin *chem ( 1 . 5 mg / kg ) or chem* SM - 5887 *chem ( 2 . 5 mg / kg ) .

column1: The experiment was terminated 3 weeks after the ninth dosing .
column2: The experiment was terminated 3 weeks after the ninth dosing .

column1: Animals which received over six courses of doxorubicin demonstrated the electrocardiogram ( ECG ) changes , decrease of blood pressure and high - grade histopathological cardiomyopathy , while animals which were terminally sacrificed after the SM - 5887 administration did not show any changes in ECG , blood pressure and histopathological examinations .
column2: Animals which received over six courses of chem* doxorubicin *chem demonstrated the electrocardiogram ( ECG ) changes , decrease of blood pressure and high - grade histopathological cardiomyopathy , while animals which were terminally sacrificed after the chem* SM - 5887 *chem administration did not show any changes in ECG , blood pressure and histopathological examinations .

column1: To examine a possibly deteriorating cardiotoxic effect of SM - 5887 , low - grade cardiomyopathy was induced in dogs by four courses of doxorubicin ( 1 . 5 mg / kg ) .
column2: To examine a possibly deteriorating cardiotoxic effect of chem* SM - 5887 *chem , low - grade cardiomyopathy was induced in dogs by four courses of chem* doxorubicin *chem ( 1 . 5 mg / kg ) .

column1: Nine weeks after pre - treatment , dogs were given four courses of either doxorubicin ( 1 . 5 mg / kg ) or SM - 5887 ( 2 . 5 mg / kg ) once every 3 weeks .
column2: Nine weeks after pre - treatment , dogs were given four courses of either chem* doxorubicin *chem ( 1 . 5 mg / kg ) or chem* SM - 5887 *chem ( 2 . 5 mg / kg ) once every 3 weeks .

column1: The low - grade cardiotoxic changes were enhanced by the additional doxorubicin treatment .
column2: The low - grade cardiotoxic changes were enhanced by the additional chem* doxorubicin *chem treatment .

column1: On the contrary , the SM - 5887 treatment did not progress the grade of cardiomyopathy .
column2: On the contrary , the chem* SM - 5887 *chem treatment did not progress the grade of cardiomyopathy .

column1: In conclusion , SM - 5887 does not have any potential of chronic cardiotoxicity and deteriorating effect on doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity in dogs .
column2: In conclusion , chem* SM - 5887 *chem does not have any potential of chronic cardiotoxicity and deteriorating effect on chem* doxorubicin *chem - induced cardiotoxicity in dogs .

column1: Risk for valvular heart disease among users of fenfluramine and dexfenfluramine who underwent echocardiography before use of medication .
column2: Risk for valvular heart disease among users of chem* fenfluramine *chem and chem* dexfenfluramine *chem who underwent echocardiography before use of medication .

column1: BACKGROUND : Because uncontrolled echocardiographic surveys suggested that up to 30 % to 38 % of users of fenfluramine and dexfenfluramine had valvular disease , these drugs were withdrawn from the market .
column2: BACKGROUND : Because uncontrolled echocardiographic surveys suggested that up to 30 % to 38 % of users of chem* fenfluramine *chem and chem* dexfenfluramine *chem had valvular disease , these drugs were withdrawn from the market .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To determine the risk for new or worsening valvular abnormalities among users of fenfluramine or dexfenfluramine who underwent echocardiography before they began to take these medications .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To determine the risk for new or worsening valvular abnormalities among users of chem* fenfluramine *chem or chem* dexfenfluramine *chem who underwent echocardiography before they began to take these medications .

column1: DESIGN : Cohort study .
column2: DESIGN : Cohort study .

column1: SETTING : Academic primary care practices .
column2: SETTING : Academic primary care practices .

column1: PATIENTS : 46 patients who used fenfluramine or dexfenfluramine for 14 days or more and had echocardiograms obtained before therapy .
column2: PATIENTS : 46 patients who used chem* fenfluramine *chem or chem* dexfenfluramine *chem for 14 days or more and had echocardiograms obtained before therapy .

column1: MEASUREMENTS : Follow - up echocardiography .
column2: MEASUREMENTS : Follow - up echocardiography .

column1: The primary outcome was new or worsening valvulopathy , defined as progression of either aortic or mitral regurgitation by at least one degree of severity and disease that met U . S .
column2: The primary outcome was new or worsening valvulopathy , defined as progression of either aortic or mitral regurgitation by at least one degree of severity and disease that met U . S .

column1: Food and Drug Administration criteria ( at least mild aortic regurgitation or moderate mitral regurgitation ) .
column2: Food and Drug Administration criteria ( at least mild aortic regurgitation or moderate mitral regurgitation ) .

column1: RESULTS : Two patients ( 4 . 3 % [ 95 % CI , 0 . 6 % to 14 . 8 % ] ) receiving fenfluramine - phentermine developed valvular heart disease .
column2: RESULTS : Two patients ( 4 . 3 % [ 95 % CI , 0 . 6 % to 14 . 8 % ] ) receiving chem* fenfluramine *chem - chem* phentermine *chem developed valvular heart disease .

column1: One had baseline bicuspid aortic valve and mild aortic regurgitation that progressed to moderate regurgitation .
column2: One had baseline bicuspid aortic valve and mild aortic regurgitation that progressed to moderate regurgitation .

column1: The second patient developed new moderate aortic insufficiency .
column2: The second patient developed new moderate aortic insufficiency .

column1: CONCLUSION : Users of diet medications are at risk for valvular heart disease .
column2: CONCLUSION : Users of diet medications are at risk for valvular heart disease .

column1: However , the incidence may be lower than that reported previously .
column2: However , the incidence may be lower than that reported previously .

column1: Therapeutic drug monitoring of tobramycin : once - daily versus twice - daily dosage schedules .
column2: Therapeutic drug monitoring of chem* tobramycin *chem : once - daily versus twice - daily dosage schedules .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To evaluate the effect of dosage regimen ( once - daily vs . twice - daily ) of tobramicyn on steady - state serum concentrations and toxicity .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To evaluate the effect of dosage regimen ( once - daily vs . twice - daily ) of chem* tobramicyn *chem on steady - state serum concentrations and toxicity .

column1: MATERIALS AND METHODS : Patients undergoing treatment with i . v . tobramycin ( 4 mg / kg / day ) were randomised to two groups .
column2: MATERIALS AND METHODS : Patients undergoing treatment with i . v . chem* tobramycin *chem ( 4 mg / kg / day ) were randomised to two groups .

column1: Group OD ( n = 22 ) received a once - daily dose of tobramycin and group TD ( n = 21 ) received the same dose divided into two doses daily .
column2: Group OD ( n = 22 ) received a once - daily dose of chem* tobramycin *chem and group TD ( n = 21 ) received the same dose divided into two doses daily .

column1: Tobramycin serum concentrations ( peak and trough ) were measured by enzyme multiplied immunoassay .
column2: chem* Tobramycin *chem serum concentrations ( peak and trough ) were measured by enzyme multiplied immunoassay .

column1: The renal and auditory functions of the patients were monitored before , during and immediately after treatment .
column2: The renal and auditory functions of the patients were monitored before , during and immediately after treatment .

column1: RESULTS : The two groups were comparable with respect to sex , age , body weight and renal function .
column2: RESULTS : The two groups were comparable with respect to sex , age , body weight and renal function .

column1: No statistically significant differences were found in mean daily dose , duration of treatment , or cumulative dose .
column2: No statistically significant differences were found in mean daily dose , duration of treatment , or cumulative dose .

column1: Trough concentrations were < 2 g / ml in the two groups ( 100 % ) .
column2: Trough concentrations were < 2 g / ml in the two groups ( 100 % ) .

column1: Peak concentrations were > 6 microg / ml in 100 % of the OD group and in 67 % of the TD group ( P < 0 . 01 ) .
column2: Peak concentrations were > 6 microg / ml in 100 % of the OD group and in 67 % of the TD group ( P < 0 . 01 ) .

column1: Mean peak concentrations were markedly different : 11 . 00 + / - 2 . 89 microg / ml in OD vs . 6 . 53 + / - 1 . 45 microg / ml in TD ( P < 0 . 01 ) .
column2: Mean peak concentrations were markedly different : 11 . 00 + / - 2 . 89 microg / ml in OD vs . 6 . 53 + / - 1 . 45 microg / ml in TD ( P < 0 . 01 ) .

column1: The pharmacokinetics parameters were : Ke , ( 0 . 15 + / - 0 . 03 / h in OD vs . 0 . 24 + / - 0 . 06 / h in TD ) , t1 / 2 , ( 4 . 95 + / - 1 . 41 h in OD vs . 3 . 07 + / - 0 . 71 h in TD ) , Vd ( 0 . 35 + / - 0 . 11 l / kg in OD vs . 0 . 33 + / - 0 . 09 l / kg in TD ) , Cl ( 0 . 86 + / - 0 . 29 ml / min / kg in OD vs . 1 . 28 + / - 0 . 33 ml / min / kg in TD ) .
column2: The pharmacokinetics parameters were : Ke , ( 0 . 15 + / - 0 . 03 / h in OD vs . 0 . 24 + / - 0 . 06 / h in TD ) , t1 / 2 , ( 4 . 95 + / - 1 . 41 h in OD vs . 3 . 07 + / - 0 . 71 h in TD ) , Vd ( 0 . 35 + / - 0 . 11 l / kg in OD vs . 0 . 33 + / - 0 . 09 l / kg in TD ) , Cl ( 0 . 86 + / - 0 . 29 ml / min / kg in OD vs . 1 . 28 + / - 0 . 33 ml / min / kg in TD ) .

column1: Increased serum creatinine was observed in 73 % of patients in OD versus 57 % of patients in TD , without evidence of nephrotoxicity .
column2: Increased serum chem* creatinine *chem was observed in 73 % of patients in OD versus 57 % of patients in TD , without evidence of nephrotoxicity .

column1: In TD group , three patients developed decreased auditory function , of which one presented with an auditory loss of - 30 dB , whereas in the OD group only one patient presented decreased auditory function .
column2: In TD group , three patients developed decreased auditory function , of which one presented with an auditory loss of - 30 dB , whereas in the OD group only one patient presented decreased auditory function .

column1: CONCLUSION : This small study suggests that a once - daily dosing regimen of tobramycin is at least as effective as and is no more and possibly less toxic than the twice - daily regimen .
column2: CONCLUSION : This small study suggests that a once - daily dosing regimen of chem* tobramycin *chem is at least as effective as and is no more and possibly less toxic than the twice - daily regimen .

column1: Using a single - dose therapy , peak concentration determination is not necessary , only trough samples should be monitored to ensure levels below 2 microg / ml .
column2: Using a single - dose therapy , peak concentration determination is not necessary , only trough samples should be monitored to ensure levels below 2 microg / ml .

column1: Enhanced bradycardia induced by beta - adrenoceptor antagonists in rats pretreated with isoniazid .
column2: Enhanced bradycardia induced by beta - adrenoceptor antagonists in rats pretreated with chem* isoniazid *chem .

column1: High doses of isoniazid increase hypotension induced by vasodilators and change the accompanying reflex tachycardia to bradycardia , an interaction attributed to decreased synthesis of brain gamma - aminobutyric acid ( GABA ) .
column2: High doses of chem* isoniazid *chem increase hypotension induced by vasodilators and change the accompanying reflex tachycardia to bradycardia , an interaction attributed to decreased synthesis of brain chem* gamma - aminobutyric acid *chem ( chem* GABA *chem ) .

column1: In the present study , the possible enhancement by isoniazid of bradycardia induced by beta - adrenoceptor antagonists was determined in rats anaesthetised with chloralose - urethane .
column2: In the present study , the possible enhancement by chem* isoniazid *chem of bradycardia induced by beta - adrenoceptor antagonists was determined in rats anaesthetised with chem* chloralose *chem - chem* urethane *chem .

column1: Isoniazid significantly increased bradycardia after propranolol , pindolol , labetalol and atenolol , as well as after clonidine , but not after hexamethonium or carbachol .
column2: chem* Isoniazid *chem significantly increased bradycardia after chem* propranolol *chem , chem* pindolol *chem , chem* labetalol *chem and chem* atenolol *chem , as well as after chem* clonidine *chem , but not after chem* hexamethonium *chem or chem* carbachol *chem .

column1: Enhancement was not observed in rats pretreated with methylatropine or previously vagotomised .
column2: Enhancement was not observed in rats pretreated with chem* methylatropine *chem or previously vagotomised .

column1: These results are compatible with interference by isoniazid with GABAergic inhibition of cardiac parasympathetic tone .
column2: These results are compatible with interference by chem* isoniazid *chem with GABAergic inhibition of cardiac parasympathetic tone .

column1: Such interference could be exerted centrally , possibly at the nucleus ambiguus , or peripherally at the sinus node .
column2: Such interference could be exerted centrally , possibly at the nucleus ambiguus , or peripherally at the sinus node .

column1: Structural and functional impairment of mitochondria in adriamycin - induced cardiomyopathy in mice : suppression of cytochrome c oxidase II gene expression .
column2: Structural and functional impairment of mitochondria in chem* adriamycin *chem - induced cardiomyopathy in mice : suppression of cytochrome c oxidase II gene expression .

column1: The use of adriamycin ( ADR ) in cancer chemotherapy has been limited due to its cumulative cardiovascular toxicity .
column2: The use of chem* adriamycin *chem ( chem* ADR *chem ) in cancer chemotherapy has been limited due to its cumulative cardiovascular toxicity .

column1: Earlier observations that ADR interacts with mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase ( COX ) and suppresses its enzyme activity led us to investigate ADR ' s action on the cardiovascular functions and heart mitochondrial morphology in Balb - c mice i . p . treated with ADR for several weeks .
column2: Earlier observations that chem* ADR *chem interacts with mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase ( COX ) and suppresses its enzyme activity led us to investigate chem* ADR *chem ' s action on the cardiovascular functions and heart mitochondrial morphology in Balb - c mice i . p . treated with chem* ADR *chem for several weeks .

column1: At various times during treatment , the animals were assessed for cardiovascular functions by electrocardiography and for heart tissue damage by electron microscopy .
column2: At various times during treatment , the animals were assessed for cardiovascular functions by electrocardiography and for heart tissue damage by electron microscopy .

column1: In parallel , total RNA was extracted from samples of dissected heart and analyzed by Northern blot hybridization to determine the steady - state level of three RNA transcripts encoded by the COXII , COXIII , and COXIV genes .
column2: In parallel , total RNA was extracted from samples of dissected heart and analyzed by Northern blot hybridization to determine the steady - state level of three RNA transcripts encoded by the COXII , COXIII , and COXIV genes .

column1: Similarly , samples obtained from the liver of the same animals were analyzed for comparative studies .
column2: Similarly , samples obtained from the liver of the same animals were analyzed for comparative studies .

column1: Our results indicated that 1 ) treatment of mice with ADR caused cardiovascular arrhythmias characterized by bradycardia , extension of ventricular depolarization time ( tQRS ) , and failure of QRS at high concentrations ( 10 - 14 mg / kg body weight cumulative dose ) ; 2 ) the heart mitochondria underwent swelling , fusion , dissolution , and / or disruption of mitochondrial cristae after several weeks of treatment .
column2: Our results indicated that 1 ) treatment of mice with chem* ADR *chem caused cardiovascular arrhythmias characterized by bradycardia , extension of ventricular depolarization time ( tQRS ) , and failure of QRS at high concentrations ( 10 - 14 mg / kg body weight cumulative dose ) ; 2 ) the heart mitochondria underwent swelling , fusion , dissolution , and / or disruption of mitochondrial cristae after several weeks of treatment .

column1: Such abnormalities were not observed in the mitochondria of liver tissue ; and 3 ) among the three genes of COX enzyme examined , only COXII gene expression was suppressed by ADR treatment , mainly after 8 weeks in both heart and liver .
column2: Such abnormalities were not observed in the mitochondria of liver tissue ; and 3 ) among the three genes of COX enzyme examined , only COXII gene expression was suppressed by chem* ADR *chem treatment , mainly after 8 weeks in both heart and liver .

column1: Knowing that heart mitochondria represent almost 40 % of heart muscle by weight , we conclude that the deteriorating effects of ADR on cardiovascular function involve mitochondrial structural and functional impairment .
column2: Knowing that heart mitochondria represent almost 40 % of heart muscle by weight , we conclude that the deteriorating effects of chem* ADR *chem on cardiovascular function involve mitochondrial structural and functional impairment .
